story:
Closet Warriors is a multiplayer fighting game.  In this game you can go to your closet, pick an outfit and become the Warrior you always wanted to be. Master a variety of Warriors and beat other players.

You can find the Closet Warriors Demo here: https://closetwarriorsdt.itch.io/closet-warriors

 

 

​

  • Up to 4 player gameplay
  • Local + Online multiplayer
  • Variety of warrior and classes to choose from
  • Fast paced fights that provide a lot of fun
  • Variety of game modes and win conditions

 

 

 

 

The game will have 8 playable Warriors and a Free4All Mode.

 

New Maps and Music will be added to the game.

 

2 New Game Modes! A 2v2 and a Map Destruction  Game Mode will be added to the game. 

 

New Class Mages will be added.

 

Every Warrior will get a Skin.

 

Raids and a 1-For-All game mode will be added to the game.

 

More Warriors will be added to the game.

 

If we reach our Final Goal we will be releasing New Expansions frequently FOR FREE.

 

 

 

 

There are many different Closet Warriors, so in order to avoid confusion, we divided them in 3 Classes.

Assassins

 

 Trained to kill everyone standing against them. They usually have Low Max Health but High Damage.

 

Protectors

   

Born to protect those behind their shield. Mostly themselves. They usually have High Max Health but Low Damage.

 

Fighters

   

They specialize in close combat. Their stats are more balanced than the other classes,  since they have Max Health and Damage in a Medium Level.

 

 

 

These are SOME of the Closet Warriors that we have in mind:

       Samurai                Crusader                       Ninja                   Musketeer

   

      Hoplite                       Knight                         Viking                      Pirate

 

 

 

During the fight you can find some Power-Ups spawning on the map. These are the Key to Beat your opponents

      Health Potion: Restores your Health.

         Shield: Grants Armor.

     Sword: Buffs your next Attack.

    Speed Boots: Buffs your Movement Speed for a short period of time.

 

 

 

 1$ - Thank You

Every penny counts, thank you for supporting Closet Warriors. Thank you for being Awesome!

 

5$ - Recruit

Now you are officially a part of th game. As a recruit you will have your name in the Credits and a "Recruit" role on our Discord channel.

 

10$ - Squire

You will get 1 Steam Key for the game as soon as it is released and a "Squire" role on our Discord channel.

 

25$ - Warrior

You will get 4 Steam Keys to play with your friends as soon as it is released and a "Warrior" role on our Discord channel.

 

50$ - Closet Warrior

You will get 4 Steam to play with your friends as soon as it is released, 4 Exclusive Skins and a "Closet Warrior" role on our Discord channel.

 

100$ - Ultimate Closet Warrior

You can now Design your own Closet Warrior or Skin. Send us the Warrior you want to see in the game and we will make it happen. We will design your Warrior together (just make sure that your idea fits in the game). You will also get an Account Unique Skin (Just For YOU) and an "Ultimate Closet Warrior" role on our Discord channel.

 

You can find our Discord Channel here: https://discord.gg/pRBeFdG

 

 

 

 

 

This is the Closet Warrior Theme song

 

 

 

 

Who doesn’t want the chance to laugh, shout, scream, and throw things at each other over some hardcore fighting game? People these days have forgotten how fun that was. So our vision is to bring local multiplayer back and remind to all the gamers what real fun is. 

 

 

We are working tirelessly on graphics, coding, character design and gameplay mechanics. However this is not enough. In order to achieve our dream we need YOUR help

With this 900$ we will be able to launch a playable game with that supports Online Multiplayer and 8 Warriors to choose from.

The Piechart below represents a simple breakdown of how the money raised by you will be spent:

 

Don't forget to follow us in the Social Media. This way you can stay informed about the Progress of Closet Warriors.

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ClosetWarriors/

Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCsyWVElBVQxrf3...

Discord: https://discord.gg/pRBeFdG

And our Developer's Twitter https://twitter.com/TheLaZeus

 

 

We all first met in school. After we graduated, we realised that we had something in common.

We Love Video Games and making our own is what we wish to do for a living.

 George Papapostolou - Programmer / Game Designer / Artist

 

Dimitris Ladias - Programmer / Game Designer / Animator

 

Petros Sfakianakis - Marketeer / Game Designer

 

Thanasis Voutsilas - Musician

story:
Piko Piko is a classic platform action adventure game with hammers and fast

 cute awesome gameplay.

Piko Piko is a adventure platform action game with visual novel elements where you play as Piko, a little blacksmith girl with a big heart hammer.Piko lives in a peaceful world, but all changes when strange shakes start to happening. The game features cute characters, fast gameplay and with tons of npc interactions.

↓ Download the demo ↓

 

Stretch Goals!!

 

What are Stretch Goals?​

Stretch goals are extra content that we can accomplish if the funding goals are met. For instance, if we hit 25,000, then we will have enough resources to produce for Wii U / Switch  and Xbox-One.

I realy love to make the gameplay fast. Pixel-perfect, precise control, jumps, and mobility. That  'feel' of great control.

 

Features:

  • Cute Girls
  • Secrets! Hidden npcs with new history interactions
  • Hacking 
  • Detailed, living background ! Beautiful handmade pixel art!
  • Cute characters and bosses!
  • Cute gameplay, easy to new ones, and hard for experts.
  • Narrative with humor
  • Hammers

Work in progress

 

Risks & Challenges

But rest assured! With your help, I'm confident I can get the game done. Fit for purpose, working as advertised and on a timely schedule!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't spare any money, that's fine! Just share this page with your friends and social media followers. Also be sure to share and follow my official social media pages!

Share / folow: http://marquetgames.tumblr.com/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/MarquetGames

story:
Baerveldt Media started in 2017 with one goal in mind, "to create new adventures". To that end, we have spent the last 2 years crafting a game that stands apart from the competition, and provides an exciting new experience for players. 

For us, Possums VS Felines has been a labor of love. We have been completely self funded for the entirety of the project. However, with a few months to go until completion, we have found ourselves short of the funds needed to finish the game, and give it the extra polish it deserves.

We need your help to finish this wonderful game, and release it to the world.   

 Benjamin Daigle a.k.a. FirstGearGames (Lead Developer)

Responsible for putting together all the various pieces of the game. Including building the code, animation, and design. Ben brings several years of development experience to the team, as well as his signature puns.

 

Amber Jackson a.k.a. AmberRam (Lead Artist) 

Responsible for all of the Characters, UI, and Outfit design in game. Amber brings several years of art experience to the team, as well as her bubbly personality. 

 

Antonio McCall a.k.a. Pesto Cat (Creative Director)

Responsible for dialogue, creative concepts, and keeping the project on time, and on budget. Antonio brings his business knowledge, and creative capabilities to the team. 

Encounter 90+ challenges across several areas. Each area boasts a unique environment, with its own unique enemies to encounter. 

Completing challenges will be key to unlocking powerful spells, additional outfits, and bountiful riches.

Artifacts are discovered by visiting dig sites, and monster lairs scattered throughout the world.

For those brave souls willing to risk the wrath of the gods. Immensely powerful Divine Artifacts may be pillaged from the temples of those deities. But beware. In this world, the gods do not make idle threats. 

Upgrades will increase both the power of your available units, as well as the number of possums at your command.  

Upgrades will be essential to ensure that your units maintain their edge against the feline menace. Choosing which units to upgrade, and when, will prove to be the difference between victory and defeat. 

Decimate the invading felines in style with numerous fashionable outfits. Additional outfits are unlocked through challenges, or from the in-game shop.

Consumable items are optional purchases that can be made with Possum Coins. These items include potions, resource & gold chests, as well as item bundles that will make challenges easier to conquer.

Towers will range in effect from assisting your possums with long range bolt fire, to boosting the effects of your artifacts. It will be up to you to decide the best layout for your play style.

​In addition to the plethora of mechanics Possum vs Felines already offers, we would love the opportunity to implement additional content our team has been discussing for post-release. Some of these features are:   

  • Multiplayer - Climb the ranks by invading other player's defenses. Waging war with other possums will have it's risks, and rewards.
  • 1000+ Stories & Challenges - For the hardcore players we want to add more levels, new stories, and plenty of epic bosses to dominate. 
  • Tower Enhancements - Scavenge the world for parts to improve your towers in unique, and devastating ways.
  • Additional Artifacts and Lore - Numerous additional excavation sites containing additional artifacts to discover with powerful effects. 
  • Expanded Skill System - Unlock additional unit skills by uncovering ancient texts as you traverse the world.
  • Endless Mode - Why should good things have to come to an end? With endless mode, they don't have to. Play as long as you want and discover new adventures and secrets the longer you play. 
  • Steam Release - A PC release on steam is planned along with trading cards, leaderboards, and achievements

With the game nearly completed, we are aiming for a mid August 2019 release on IOS and Android.

We have a highly skilled, and dedicated development team that is working daily on finishing the game and preparing it for release. With your help, our dream will become a reality. 

A major key to the success of any crowdfunding campaign is knowledge of the campaign itself. The more people that know about our campaign, the better the chance we will be able to fulfill our vision for this game. 

Every bit of interest, and every share means so much to us. Please help us spread the word about the campaign, and about Possums VS Felines.

Thank you for your help!
story_txt:
Baerveldt Media started in 2017 with one goal in mind, "to create new adventures". To that end, we have spent the last 2 years crafting a game that stands apart from the competition, and provides an exciting new experience for players. 
For us, Possums VS Felines has been a labor of love. We have been completely self funded for the entirety of the project. However, with a few months to go until completion, we have found ourselves short of the funds needed to finish the game, and give it the extra polish it deserves.
We need your help to finish this wonderful game, and release it to the world.   



 Benjamin Daigle a.k.a. FirstGearGames (Lead Developer)
Responsible for putting together all the various pieces of the game. Including building the code, animation, and design. Ben brings several years of development experience to the team, as well as his signature puns.
 

Amber Jackson a.k.a. AmberRam (Lead Artist) 
Responsible for all of the Characters, UI, and Outfit design in game. Amber brings several years of art experience to the team, as well as her bubbly personality. 
 

Antonio McCall a.k.a. Pesto Cat (Creative Director)
Responsible for dialogue, creative concepts, and keeping the project on time, and on budget. Antonio brings his business knowledge, and creative capabilities to the team. 



Encounter 90+ challenges across several areas. Each area boasts a unique environment, with its own unique enemies to encounter. 
Completing challenges will be key to unlocking powerful spells, additional outfits, and bountiful riches.


Artifacts are discovered by visiting dig sites, and monster lairs scattered throughout the world.
For those brave souls willing to risk the wrath of the gods. Immensely powerful Divine Artifacts may be pillaged from the temples of those deities. But beware. In this world, the gods do not make idle threats. 


Upgrades will increase both the power of your available units, as well as the number of possums at your command.  
Upgrades will be essential to ensure that your units maintain their edge against the feline menace. Choosing which units to upgrade, and when, will prove to be the difference between victory and defeat. 


Decimate the invading felines in style with numerous fashionable outfits. Additional outfits are unlocked through challenges, or from the in-game shop.


Consumable items are optional purchases that can be made with Possum Coins. These items include potions, resource & gold chests, as well as item bundles that will make challenges easier to conquer.


Towers will range in effect from assisting your possums with long range bolt fire, to boosting the effects of your artifacts. It will be up to you to decide the best layout for your play style.

​In addition to the plethora of mechanics Possum vs Felines already offers, we would love the opportunity to implement additional content our team has been discussing for post-release. Some of these features are:   


Multiplayer - Climb the ranks by invading other player's defenses. Waging war with other possums will have it's risks, and rewards.

1000+ Stories & Challenges - For the hardcore players we want to add more levels, new stories, and plenty of epic bosses to dominate. 

Tower Enhancements - Scavenge the world for parts to improve your towers in unique, and devastating ways.

Additional Artifacts and Lore - Numerous additional excavation sites containing additional artifacts to discover with powerful effects. 

Expanded Skill System - Unlock additional unit skills by uncovering ancient texts as you traverse the world.

Endless Mode - Why should good things have to come to an end? With endless mode, they don't have to. Play as long as you want and discover new adventures and secrets the longer you play. 

Steam Release - A PC release on steam is planned along with trading cards, leaderboards, and achievements


With the game nearly completed, we are aiming for a mid August 2019 release on IOS and Android.
We have a highly skilled, and dedicated development team that is working daily on finishing the game and preparing it for release. With your help, our dream will become a reality. 


A major key to the success of any crowdfunding campaign is knowledge of the campaign itself. The more people that know about our campaign, the better the chance we will be able to fulfill our vision for this game. 
Every bit of interest, and every share means so much to us. Please help us spread the word about the campaign, and about Possums VS Felines.
Thank you for your help!

story:
Keep Zom Coming is an arcade first person shooter based on the beautiful places of Guatemala, Mayan culture and its remote locations.

You need to endure as much as you can from the waves of zombies coming from every direction. The thing is, you can only see 1 of 4 possible directions zombies can attack you. You are going to be able to temporarily block an alley using grenades and other various weapons and abilities to survive.

Each map has its own boss battle based on Guatemalan culture, like ¨El Torito¨ which is a guy wearing a piñata in the shape of a bull with fireworks attached to it (https://youtu.be/4AwYC_zJ8UY?t=11).

 

The map included in the demo hasn´t been optimized since the beginning of development. The demo is a glimpse of what the full version will be. This is a fixed-funding campaign. Keep Zom Coming can only happen if our goal is reached.

Trailer

Dont miss out on the trailer.

 

Gameplay

You can check out the concept of the gameplay on this video. Look around and try to keep the zombies away from you. You will need to clear each corridor of zombies before you can move through it, and on to the next.

 

Thriller Chapin

We were so excited to release the campaign, that the only logical thing to do was dance until our bodies hurt! This is the visual representation.

 

 

After the campaign is over there's a lot to be done and here's a list of the things we are going to do and what are you helping us achieve. We hope this gives you a glimpse into the process and our goal.

  • 4 unlockable and unique maps of Guatemalan locations including: Antigua, Tikal, Lake Atitlan and Semuc Champey
  • 4 bosses, one for each map
  • 6 types of weapons
  • 6 types of zombies (plus the ones offered in some rewards)
  • 3 types of grenades
  • Add vertical mobility
  • Weapons visibility
  • Enemy proximity alerts
  • UI and design
  • Score and Leaderboards
  • Drop items (coins, health, powerups)
  • Unlockables
  • Achievements
  • Music for maps, menus and sound FX
  • Constant improvement of game mechanics
  • Custom animations
  • Offer the game in 5 languages (English, Spanish, Russian, Chinese, German)

 

 

We are a 2-man team that will expand once the campaign succeeds.

 

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/fahr_tsn/

Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/jjmarrand

 

 

The zombies have evolved from their initial designs. The zombies first wore a typical office outfit, but was later changed to a more traditional Guatemalan outfit.

Certain zombies have different abilities depending on the outfit they wear. These outfits will also change to adapt to the Guatemalan theme of the game. There will be specific zombies for each location.

 

Right now, there's 2 main zombies models, one tougher than the other. The first one wears tradional clothes from Guatemala. These clothes designs will vary depending on what region the zombie is in.

The second one has no clothing. You can see the infection growing and taking over the body. There will be variations and mutations dependent on the level of difficulty. 

 

Guatemala is full of secrets that can transport you to different eras. From Mayan culture to colonial architecture and all of nature wonders merging into one location.

These are the four locations that will be in the game. You can have a little glimpse of them through the links below.

Antigua Guatemala, Guatemala: Used to be the capital of Guatemala but in 1776 the volcano “Fuego” erupts and the people had to evacuated to safety. Now, it's a popular place for people all over the world to experience the colonial arquitectures, the food and friendly people who lives there. The buildings from that era had been preserved and you can see the damages of some buildings still suffer from the volcano.

 

Tikal, Peten: Was the center of the mayan culture at the time and probably the largest cities we can find in mesoamerica. The main attraction its the “Gran Jaguar” the main pyramid you can find at the center of the forest of peten. The episode IV of Star Wars record a scene from the movie in this amazing place.

 

Semuc Champey, Alta Verapaz: (where the river hides below the stones) The flora and fauna you can find in this place it's fascinating. There's caves you can explore and the river that changes to different colors in each season of the year transform this magical place into one of the most exciting places to become an authentic “Indiana Jones”.

 

Lake Atitlan, San Marcos: Surrounded by 3 volcanos, the vistas of the lake are something you cannot miss if you come to Guatemala on your vacations. There is a lot of little villages you can visit taking a boat across the sky blue lake and maybe a little surprise if you are crossing you are going to fight off to continue in your journey.

 

The soundtrack is all about having an epic sound combined with Guatemalan folklore. A mix of instruments from the country, like the marimba, tzicolaj, huehuetl and tunkul, are merged with other sounds and instruments to create different rich melodies. Each level will have a specific sound related to the location, whether it be church bells from the cathedrals of Antigua Guatemala, or rainforest ambience from the jungles of Tikal.

https://soundcloud.com/jjmarrand/keep-zom-coming-concept

Heres the chart of the perks you can get if you decide to back up this project, hope you like whats in store for you. 

There's still a lot of thing we would love to do but there's a big effort and considerations to this points that we thought it would be better to put them as Stretch Goals.

We prepare some items you can pick up in our store if you want to keep helping the game and have something with a unique and cool designs. We have t-shirts, shoes, backpacks, cell phone cases, skateboards and more! Don't miss the opportunity and tell us what would you like to see next.

Chek out our store to see all the products: https://acroviu.threadless.com/

Chek out our store to see all the products: https://acroviu.threadless.com/

Chek out our store to see all the products: https://acroviu.threadless.com/

 

The funding has an specific purpose and problem to solve. You can see how we are going to spend the money and what percentage of the money is being use to finish all that aspects of the game.

You can follow us on Facebook, instagram and youtube for more updates and support. We are going to have some behind the scenes and other goodies you may like. 

 

 

  • Because it's only me working in the game, I wouldn't be able to finish all the features I wanted to do, like additional levels, more zombies, weapons, story, etc. The game would be released no matter what, but with less features, I would dedicate my spare time to polish all the things I developed until now and add a couple so it won't feel that empty.

 

  • Learning Unreal has taken me a lot of time, so having someone who knows how to work on it would be really helpful on the development.

 

  • I feel the game has the of potential off being really entertaining but the hardest challenge is time and money. Right now I have to look for a job because I run out of money and doing the game part time would take years for me to finish.
 
  • It would be easier for the game to get accepted on playstation and nintendo if the game has the features I had presented.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can share the link of the campaign with your friend and family or through social media. The more people know the more chance are to get this made.

story:
My name is David Watson and I am the sole proprietor of Maddman Studios. A virgin studio that intends on breaking into the gaming industry with energy and imagination, with your help.

All funding that is raised will go to the establishment of Maddman Studios and the making of our first Game, The Island.

Establishing our studios name involves hiring game designers, hiring employees, paying salaries, advertising, buying computers, and leasing a building. To accomplish this, Maddman Studios will need $60,000  to establish its name and to launch our first Game within a year and a half.

Currently all work has been done by myself, I hope to hire others during this time for help and to add to available jobs during this pandemic.

With that being said, I would like to introduce the flagship of Maddman Studios, The Island.

The Island is a first person game of mystery and exploration. There are no guns, there is no death, and no map, just time. You have all the time that you need to learn all the secrets that the Island has. But fear not, all questions will be answered in time, all you have to do is follow the clues and discover the mystery of The Island. The area viewed in the video is 1/4 of the size of the map that is planned. The world will be tremendously bigger, along with at least 25 to 30 structures and 100 collectables, everything you need to have an amazing adventure. Learn the hidden secrets that the Island keeps and you will ultimately discover yourself.

Along with helping a game studio get on its feet, we have established great perks for your donations. The first level has unlimited spots and it is the $5 tier. If you donate $5 you will be named in the credits of the game as well as you being named as a baker on our up coming Facebook page.

The highest level has five spots and it is the $1000 level, on this level you will receive a free early copy of the game, a character in the game named after you, a map of the entire island and a key that opens a special mystery in the game. This level also includes a sneak peak of Maddman Studios second Game Demons.

Thank you and I will see you on The Island.

story:
About us

We are STICLI Games, a small indie game dev studio consisting of 5 people who are passionate about Aviation and Games! We are Greg, Kate, Stu, Tony & Maria.

In 2015 we have branched with Airport Master Game Prototype into a game dev studio, previously we’ve been developing web-applications and Windows security software. With some money we’ve managed to accumulate from our small web and software development business, we have started working on this project!

Having played almost each and every airport management game out there throughout videogames history, we have found the majority of titles being really far far far from how real world aviation works. People who’d been trying to create an airport management game previously, made common mistakes (from not realistic time-scale to total lack of knowledge how planes fly ))) we’ve seen planes with tail-engines & underwing engines in the same model ))) We’ve seen ILS antennas the size of a fishing pole and we’ve seen taxiway marker signs the size of Beech 1900 =)

In our case, we believe we’re an amalgam of aviation fans (Greg is real-world PPL-license holder and Tony, our biggest fan and consultant holds ATPL with more than 8,000 hours in the left seat) and programmers, 3D-artists and sound artists. Thus, we’ve started with making Airport Master world a pretty realistic place where there are lift and drag and air masses movement, where aircraft actually have IAS, TAS and GS. We have created ATC which can (to some good extent) place arriving and departing IFR & VFR traffic at 4nm separation, etc. So we went in from the aviation side of things, right? ) Same is true for airport economy.

 

How can you help

We intentionally waited for the moment that our game gets released as Steam Early Access before starting a campaign at IndieGoGo. We wanted you to have opportunity to not just look at videos and screenshots but also be able to download, install and play the game at its current stage of development (mid-alpha). That honestly took pretty much resources (money and man-hour -wise) and we would like to ask you, whether you’re an Aviation fan or Airport Management Games genre fan or both, to support our campaign at IndieGoGo in order to facilitate the development of Airport Master game!

 

Where will the funding go

  • Paying for outstaffing 3D-modeling (we do a lot of 3D modeling for Airport Master in-house, but with our ambitious plan to make it The Ultimate Airport Management Game we’d need hundreds of 3D-models created to our engine specs (aircraft, airport vehicles, vegetation, people avatars etc.) – for a complex 3D-model of an aircraft that goes with our tech spec – it’s average outsourcing cost to produce is about $200 per model
  • Paying for two crucial parts of weather engine – truly vivid volumetric clouds engine (the one we’re looking at is priced at $4500) and fog-additive-precipitation model (this one is cheaper and can be licensed at about $1200)
  • Paying current office running costs and IT-related costs (as previously we’ve used office space provided by our parent-webdev-firm, but since we now work almost solely on Airport Master Game project, this will not last forever, - we need to maintain our working environment as we’ve invested a lot of effort in making it efficient during last 2 years.

 

More information on Airport Master game:

Official website: http://sticli.com/airport-master.php

Steam Early Access: http://store.steampowered.com/app/584280

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/AirportMasterGame/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/STICLI_Games

story:
Welcome to Project917 - BUILDING THE FIRST FULL MOTION 917 SIMULATOR

Hi, I'm Ian and I initiated Project 917 from a passion for the world's most famous endurance race the 24 hours of Le Mans and the cars that have raced this most famous of races.

This is Le Mans...

 

I’ve been captivated by the Le Mans 24 Hours and travelled to France for many years as a keen spectator witnessing the success of Porsche, Jaguar, Mercedes, Bentley, McLaren, Audi, but its the 1970's Porsche 917 that really does it for me.

I, like many, have wondered what it might have been like to drive one of these cars on the famous circuit and it is incredible to think that back in 1970 the 917 would hurtle down the Mulsanne straight at 240 mph, hour after hour through the day and night the sunshine and rain driven by racing heroes of the era..

Original Porsche 917's are incredibly rare and driving them is the preserve of the very lucky few and so you can imagine for me it was a monumentally fantastic day when I was given the opportunity to sit in an original 917. This car was nearly 46 years old and I have to say it was a little scary squeezed into the drivers seat and to imagine what it might have been like to drive this awesome race car...

Meeting my hero....

Meeting your heroes can sometimes be disappointing, but this was not the case for me and the 917 just spurred me on to recreate something close to the original experience of driving this amazing car and something special for like minded fans...

So what do the people who have driven the 917 have to say...

It was a lovely car to drive; it turned in very well…. When you put the power on the back was quite enthusiastic to come round… by comparison, the Ferrari 512 that I drove at Le Mans the previous year did not send you any messages… Derek Bell

I remember walking around this thing and literally stroking it... It looked big, powerful and sexy… Vic Elford

Everywhere I went with it I was comfortable. On high-speed circuits, especially at night, it was a brilliant car… Jackie Oliver

Of course I rate the Porsche 917 very highly. I liked driving the car; it drove very well…. Brian Redman

Being able to replicate that sensation in a car of the period and on a Le Mans circuit layout of the day is no longer possible but 21st century simulator software technology means that we can get close to what it might have been like. 

So we have put together a team to create and build a Full Motion 917 Simulator. 

Our team, partners and advisors include automotive industry and simulator technology specialists who have come together to ensure the car and project are a success. 

WE DON'T CALL THIS A DREAM, WE CALL IT A PLAN!

The key to this project is people and to deliver this build we have teamed up with a dream team of associates and we will be working with some really cool people who really know their stuff. 

Meet our Build Partners... 

SO WHY THE 917?

The Porsche 917 is arguably the most famous sports car of the 1970's, if not ever, a car whose place in history is immortalised by its race victories but also as the automotive star of the 1971 Steve McQueen movie 'Le Mans'.

A short tribute to the 'King Of Cool' and his movie 'Le Mans'.

I can remember seeing the movie for the first time and being gripped by the opening sequences, the build up to the race with McQueen sliding into his awesome Gulf Porsche 917, his heart pumping, the flag comes down and maximum power off the line into the race...

So the Porsche 917 is arguably the coolest race-car ever built...

FULL MOTION 917 SIMULATOR EXPERIENCE 

We will take you back in time to the 1970's with the experience of racing that years Le Mans an providing a fantastically unique and immersive experience.

Our 917 simulator  will be detailed to look like car number 20 that Delaney races to end of the race  in the movie Le Mans, well, the one Steve McQueen eventually finishes the race in (not number 22 in which he crashes!)

The Simulator would look something like this... 

 

Stepping into the cabin of our Simulator will be as close to what it would be like getting into an original 917 with the driving position as exact as possible the interior basic and purposeful but giving you the feel, the noise and even the smell, of an original car for a total immersive experience. 

We will ensure that the simulator can accommodate young and old and also adapt to different sizes so that we can include as many fans as possible.

TECH BIT...

The Full Motion Simulation will be provided by movement actuators directly driven by the steering wheel, load-cell pedals, sequential and h-pattern shifter for use as novice or advanced users with full cabin enclosure and triple 48 inch screens to provide a 180 degree view out of the cockpit.

To achieve the best visual experience possible we will use rFactor software a world-renowned, industry-standard computer racing simulator software developed by Image Space Incorporated, who have been developing simulators since the early 1990s for commercial purposes and will deliver a sensational visual experience.

ITS ALL ABOUT AN UNFORGETTABLE & UNIQUE EXPERIENCE... 

Does this look like an experience you would enjoy?

THATS NOT ALL...

We plan to take the 917 SIM around the country to shows and events such as Autosport International at the NEC, Goodwood Revival, Race Retro and car clubs and related events across the UK and Europe, but we also intend to rent the SIM for corporate events.

THE DELANEY TROPHY

This will be a challenge to anyone who takes to the wheel of the Simulator running the 1970 Le Mans circuit layout and as our tribute to the movie Le Mans and the character that Steve McQueen plays.

The Delaney Trophy where we will seek the fastest times of the 1970 Le Mans circuit but also to find a super fan, the coolest experience video and most enthusiastic and passionate fan. 

Winners of different categories will be announced 12 months from when the Simulator is ready and special prizes will be awarded at a special event.

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

To do this we need your help to raise £30,000 to the parts and software to build the simulator we expect it to be completed in 3 to 4 months with the skilled team we have brought together.  

THIS IS THE EXCITING BIT,

THESE ARE THE REWARDS FOR YOUR SUPPORT

Although you can support the project from as little as £1 however, the rewards start at £10 support the and to experience the simulator at an event near you rewards start at £25 though to securing the Simulator for an exclusive Le Mans & The Movie event at £3000 and so our rewards have been created to allow as many people can join in and experience the 917 Simulator as possible, here is a little more detail.

Rewards video...

 

SIMULATOR DRIVE EXPERIENCE REWARDS

The entry level to secure a drive experience is £25, this will be  10 minute ride that can be on the selected circuit of the venue. This is presented at a 30% discount from the voucher for early adopter.

For £50 you will be able to race the 1970 Le Mans for a 24 minute drive at a venue or event that the simulator will attend. This is presented at 50% discount for early adopter.

NOTE: You will be given the option of a preferred venue for your experience and you will be kept informed via our newsletter and schedule information of where the simulator will located for you to redeem your reward. (You will need to make your way to the event and gain entry). Initially events will be in the UK, but we plan to get the simulator to venues in Europe and beyond.

917 DRIVE CLUB MEMBERSHIPS

Our rewards are also designed to build a special 917 and Le Mans related club, this will be the 917 Drive Club and will include multiple ride experiences and access to special events to be held by the club with opportunities to meet like minded fans as well as Le Mans heroes and drivers. Events will be announced in the near future.

We have designated the club into thee levels, named after the iconic liveries that the 917 raced under and they are the Martini, Salzburg and Gulf starting from £150 to £300 giving you access to some cool events as well as multiple drive experiences and plus some other bonus gifts such as a DVD of movie, The Mans & Le Mans.

For fans of Steve McQueen and Le Mans this is the ultimate tribute and is offered as a £20 stand alone reward or as a 'combo' of the Salzburg and Martini 917 Drive Club Memberships.

917 ARTWORK

Additionally we are offering 917 related artwork from VSIXDesign who have created some really stunning 917 liveried prints. 

You will get to chose between the following 3 liveries, Martini, Salzburg or Gulf.


Martini Racing 1970 Porsche 917 Kurzheck 917-053 - Outright winner of the 1971 24 Hours of Le Mans as driven by Dr. Helmut Marko and Gijs van Lennep. Gallery quality Giclée print on natural white, matte, ultra smooth, 100% cotton rag, acid and lignin free archival paper using Epson K3 archival inks. Custom trimmed with 1" border for framing.

Size 19 inch x 13 inch in size 

Reward £40

The iconic Porsche 917 in the classic Gulf livery, featured in the movie Le Mans with Steve McQueen. Gallery quality Giclée print on natural white, matte, ultra smooth, 100% cotton rag, acid and lignin free archival paper using Epson K3 archival inks. Custom trimmed with 1" border for framing.

Size 13 inch x 19 inch.

Reward £40

The winning Salzburg Porsche 917 of the 1970 24 Hours of Le Mans.Gallery quality Giclée print on natural white, matte, ultra smooth, 100% cotton rag, acid and lignin free archival paper using Epson K3 archival inks.

Custom trimmed with 1" border for framing.

Size 13 inch x 19 inch

Reward £40

EXCLUSIVE REWARDS COMMISSIONED BY PROJECT 917

We also have some fantastically exclusively commissioned pieces that we believe showcases not only cool and creative work by passionate fans of the 917 and Le Mans.

GRAHAM & LEIGH TRIBUTE FRAMES

The Graham & Leigh 917 Tribute piece is especially created for us and is a tribute to the winning 917 Le Mans victories. The piece showcases the 1970 circuit layout of Le Mans  and is 28 cm x 27 cm and comes engraved with the winning drivers and a project 917 logo.

This piece can be wall mounted or can stand alone on a table and you can secure this piece for £110

SPORTOMOTIV 917 SCULPTURES

 

The first piece from Sportomotiv specially commissioned for Project 917 is a limited run of spectacular 917 sculptures who have created these super sexy 1:10 scale pieces complete with a unique plaque and individually numbered and limited to 25 pieces

Reward £350

 

 

The second piece from Sportomotiv is the DIY build version 1:12 scale 917 Sculpture that is delivered as a 'do-it-yourself kit that you can secure for £220

REWARD SUPPORT TIP

IF YOU WISH TO SUPPORT US, CHECK OUT THE ART, SCULPTURE AND PRINT 'COMBO' REWARDS AS FOR A LITTLE EXTRA YOU WILL RECEIVE A SIM DRIVE VOUCHER :)

FURTHER REWARDS

At £1000 & £2000 is exclusive rental of the Simulator for an event or party!

We will deliver the Simulator (within UK) and our team will set it up and run it for your event. This could be a party where you get all your driving pals around to test your driving skills in a competitive and fun activity or it could be as part of a corporate event or exhibition.

This offering is based upon a 'one day' event but we can offer longer terms should you want to extend the experience and is based on a first come first severed to avoid double booking. 

We hope that you can see something from our rewards that you like and look forward to thanking you for your support.

YOUR HELP

Your contribution will help us build the simulator and to arrange for the simulator has its first event appearances. 

WHY IS THIS IMPORTANT

So this is not just about us this project is about fans and providing a unique experience, something extremely rare, but to generate an unforgettable experience.  Its about having fun, doing something very special and unique, a little bit of time travel... back to the 1970's...

Risks & Challenges

We have carried out all the calculations and with the help of Radical Simulator and RallyPrep, Chris Beatty Design and Faroux Sports Cars imparting their skills and experience we have a very strong plan to get the simulator complete and not only functioning but looking and functioning as we envisage so that the experience is unforgettable.

That said, delays can obviously occur, especially with supplied parts, however, we have already sourced these ready for the start of the build and expect few hiccups along the way but if there are  issues we will need to work through these, but we will have the team on hand whose experience and skill should find solutions. 

Neil at Rally Prep has has been involved in building over 40 road and track cars and so knows how to build one off and complex cars and vehicles, and is the sort of chap that just gets things done.

With Gavin's at Radical Simulation expertise in simulator and VR, we can build a simulator that will generate the best experience possible and will have the ability to be upgraded as the software improves. Marcel and Chris at Faroux build 917 kits and have years of engineering experience as does Chris Beatty who is a specialist 3D designer and animator will help us ensure that the design and final product will be awesome.

What happens after the Simulator is Built?

Once the simulator is built we will do shake down tests and include consultative assistance to set the simulator to produce the most accurate of experiences and as real to the original as is possible. It will then be delivered to events and exhibitions throughout the UK so that fans who have purchased drive vouchers will get the opportunity to get behind the wheel.

The business model will continue to promote and exhibit the simulator at events and will work with clients to offer the rig for corporate events.

Our affiliate partner is boutique-cars.com which will be selling project related products to also generate a revenue for the initiative.

Other Ways You Can Help

So, if you like the project your help will be appreciated if you purchase rewards or just share the project through your network so that we can reach as many like minded fans as possible.

To be part of this doesn’t mean that you have to experience or even become a member of the 917DriveClub, but if you think the idea is cool, help us to pass the word around and join our networks:

  • Facebook.com/project917 
  • Twitter @917_legend
  • Instagram Project_917_build

And hashtags;

  • #917fan
  • #917sim
  • #917experience
  • #917driveclub

 Keep up to date and share and make some noise for our project.

THANK YOU 

Lets Go Racing!!

story:
an excerpt from our concept document

. Main features of the game

 Map scale 1:4
 quality, detailed models of trucks and trailers, all global manufacturers, the new modern and classic (since 1960, the). The ability to "try on" the life of a trucker.
 It is planned to obtain licenses from the truck manufacturers, tires, gas stations, transport companies, etc. (take time)
 Purchase of own trucks, new dealers and old by auction or secondary market
 Purchase of own trailers
 Purchase of own garages
 In the future, it is planned to add to cars and buses, and the ability to manage
 It is planned to add to the character and come out of the car
 maximum realistic physics.
 Beautiful graphics.
 Change of day and night, the dynamic change of weather. Wind, which has an impact on the physics of the world and of the truck.
 The ability to create its cargo transportation company, and the opportunity to hire drivers.
 The ability to see your drivers on the roads.
 Support for multiple points of the axes of rotation (double, triple, trailers).
 Realistic car sounds, environment, nature, etc.
 Different loads and trailers
 Realistic fines and fees for travel on motorways, etc.
 A variety of AI traffic, cars, trucks, buses, fire trucks, ambulance, police, etc.
 Police, who will be fined for traffic violations
 A lot of unexpected breakdowns of the truck, and the difficulties during transportation
 Construction of a world map design based on google maps and yandex maps
 Map of USA, Canada, Australia, Europe, Russia ...

 

Our team for more than 1.5 years of successfully developing mods for games such as Euro Truck Simulator-2 and American Truck Simulator by team SCS Software. We develop modified trucks and trailers (our forum https://forum.rta-mods.net)


Now we have decided to create their own game in the genre (simulator truckers). The game is developed on the game engine Unreal Engine 4. Due to this we have opened almost limitless possibilities that would create a beautiful game world with roads, cities, bridges, etc. for STEAM/PC/Xbox One/PS4.

After the acquisition of the game, all future updates, such as expansion maps, adding new features and improvements will be free. But will also be the rare trucks that will be sold separately as DLC

Why do we need money?
To implement the project "Trucker:Roads America", we have to work for about one year (until the end of 2017), as we will need a few specialists (Animator, 2D artist, level designer), which we will be able to hire.
Development: Creating all of the elements (poles, lights, bridges, gas stations, buildings, etc.) that form a final game, such as animations, music, sound effects,  game design, level construction, road editor. And we are coming negotiations with manufacturers of trucks to get their license. 
We also need to buy a license software for a number of employees

how many people in our team at the moment?
The team consist of 6 people: 1-Programmer, 3-3D artist, 1-Project Manager, 1-sound engineer
if you can not help us financially, any help would be appreciated.

if we collect $ 200,000, we  are ready to immediately begin creating a map of Australia

if we collect $ 250,000, we are ready to immediately begin creating a map of Australia Europe and Russia

it becomes real, due to the expansion team, on each maps will work more level designers

. Main features of the game
 Map scale 1:4 quality, detailed models of trucks and trailers, all global manufacturers, the new modern and classic (since 1960, the). The ability to "try on" the life of a trucker. It is planned to obtain licenses from the truck manufacturers, tires, gas stations, transport companies, etc. (take time) Purchase of own trucks, new dealers and old by auction or secondary market Purchase of own trailers Purchase of own garages In the future, it is planned to add to cars and buses, and the ability to manage It is planned to add to the character and come out of the car maximum realistic physics. Beautiful graphics. Change of day and night, the dynamic change of weather. Wind, which has an impact on the physics of the world and of the truck. The ability to create its cargo transportation company, and the opportunity to hire drivers. The ability to see your drivers on the roads. Support for multiple points of the axes of rotation (double, triple, trailers). Realistic car sounds, environment, nature, etc. Different loads and trailers Realistic fines and fees for travel on motorways, etc. A variety of AI traffic, cars, trucks, buses, fire trucks, ambulance, police, etc. Police, who will be fined for traffic violations A lot of unexpected breakdowns of the truck, and the difficulties during transportation Construction of a world map design based on google maps and yandex maps Map of USA, Canada, Australia, Europe, Russia ...
 
Our team for more than 1.5 years of successfully developing mods for games such as Euro Truck Simulator-2 and American Truck Simulator by team SCS Software. We develop modified trucks and trailers (our forum https://forum.rta-mods.net)
Now we have decided to create their own game in the genre (simulator truckers). The game is developed on the game engine Unreal Engine 4. Due to this we have opened almost limitless possibilities that would create a beautiful game world with roads, cities, bridges, etc. for STEAM/PC/Xbox One/PS4.
After the acquisition of the game, all future updates, such as expansion maps, adding new features and improvements will be free. But will also be the rare trucks that will be sold separately as DLC
Why do we need money?To implement the project "Trucker:Roads America", we have to work for about one year (until the end of 2017), as we will need a few specialists (Animator, 2D artist, level designer), which we will be able to hire.Development: Creating all of the elements (poles, lights, bridges, gas stations, buildings, etc.) that form a final game, such as animations, music, sound effects,  game design, level construction, road editor. And we are coming negotiations with manufacturers of trucks to get their license. We also need to buy a license software for a number of employees
how many people in our team at the moment?The team consist of 6 people: 1-Programmer, 3-3D artist, 1-Project Manager, 1-sound engineerif you can not help us financially, any help would be appreciated.
if we collect $ 200,000, we  are ready to immediately begin creating a map of Australia
if we collect $ 250,000, we are ready to immediately begin creating a map of Australia Europe and Russia
it becomes real, due to the expansion team, on each maps will work more level designers
campaign_city: Nizhny Novgorod, St. Petersburg, Russian Federation

story:
Today marks the the first year I've been sealed in this subway station. I still remember the day I witnessed the emergence of the singularity, a moment fractured in time by the government scientists looking for a new super-weapon, it reverberated around the world, destroying civilization.

It didn't take me long to seal myself down here. Those people who weren't poisoned by the radiation or killed in the anarchy which followed, soon found themselves fighting strange creatures, appearing out of nowhere, confused, but aggressive, killing all they came in contact with. I knew this station was my only hope for survival.

I'm running short on supplies, I have water in abundance, but the stores of food I brought with me have almost run out. I fear I must venture out to find out what has become of the world, and to survive another day...

What's the Project?

The Best Post-Apocalypse Fantasy RPG Mini-Boardgame (or better known as TBPAFRM, pronounced tea-be-par-from) is a game centred around a mini board and a companion app. Between these, you can play against the app game master, or play cooperatively with friends to survive a global post apocalyptic world filled with ruptures in time and space, dangerous creatures and quests to be solved.

What you'll receive

For everyone who backs $5 or more, you'll receive:

  • A set of gameboards (around DL in size, 210x100mm)
  • A set of double sided tokens
  • A basic rule sheet and setup instructions
  • An unlock code for the set in the companion app

The initial prototype game boards we developed for Hackagong

Our first set of prototype tokens for the game
To see more images from the prototype, take a look at the gallery, or the video for example of game play.
 

Who We Are

We are Team KARRAK, a small game development team from NSW, Australia, passionate about making games. We are a team comprised of a game designer, a programmer and an artist.

This isn't something we spend all our time on. Each of us has a day job to pay the bills, but are looking for ways to start making waves in the industry we love. This campaign represents our first step into making financially viable games, and we promise to bring you hours of fun with the games we are creating.

What We Need

We're looking for $2000 to fund an initial run of TBPAFRM, which, at $5 posted a person, is enough to print 3000 board games, bringing the cost of production

story:
Short Summary

A farther, a husband, an office worker, a gamer... For a long time I'v been chasing a carrier in the field i don't really like, just because it was paying well. Support engineer is a good job, but not something i'd like to be doing my whole life.

Though creating games and spending time thinking of what i could make, what i would like to make seems much more appealing.

I'm looking for funding to be able to quit my day job and create a first game as it requires some time to create and polish game. I already have base, but need time to polish the game and add many more features to it.

Your help will not only allow me to follow my dream that i always had, but will also allow me to make my own company, to gather other people feeling like me and having the passion to create fun for themselves and for others.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Most of the budget would go as the salary for the game makers and designers to create assets
  • As a gamer I'm not looking into pay-to-win scheme, it spoils the game. the only thing that will be possible to buy in the game will be cosmetics.
  • This game will be released, no matter what. Why? because that is my dream, with no help it will take longer, but there is nothing impossible if you put enough effort to it

The Impact

Imagine the game, cross platform, for which you can spend from few minutes a day to few hours. Just as much as you wish, o are able to spend today. You can play it casually, just going and killing mobs in the dungeon floor, collecting items and upgrading your gear. Or you can go for that big boss and better loot together with your friend, as it seems more fun for you. You can replay this game many times, because map layout is always different, as it is procedural generated. Short fight against mobs, or maybe a fight against your friend? it not that you always want to play against game, some times there is wish to show for that friend of yours, that you dodging and attacking skills are better and his luckily collected shining sword wont win against your  baguette sword or spiked mace you found and upgraded earlier.

I know that i want a game like that, that i could play on mobile phone, or my pc, or maybe my console.

Risks & Challenges

I have never created a game previously. But i have played a lot of them and have a vision of what i want.

Creating a game with Unreal Engine might be quite challenging, as there are some many ways to do things, but there is such a good community, ready to assist you when there are questions that you cant find answers to by yourself.

Using free assets or purchasing? Or maybe drawing it your self?

it all depends on how much money you have to spend, as original content is always preferred, though not always available.

Other Ways You Can Help

You cant contribute by money, but still want to help me to create this game?

Maybe you are a good animator? Maybe you can create various graphical assets to make a game more appealing and more visually beautiful? Or maybe you can create a music for the game, that even after finishing the level you would keep it open on your screen, so that just to listen more to that background track?

story:
The Edge of Twilight series is a multiplatform, diverse-genre series of Steampunk games. "Edge of Twilight - Return to Glory" is a 3rd person action adventure game developed for the PC, Consoles and Nvidia Shield platforms presenting a unique post-apocalyptic, steampunk fantasy world that has been split into separate realms of Day and Night. Players take the role of Lex, an outcast bounty hunter who finds himself caught amidst the clash of two polar opposite civilisations, the industrial Atherns and the spiritual Lithern, the result of impetuous greed for a solitary source of energy. 



Edge of Twilight is a 3rd person action adventure game developed for the PC and Xbox 360 platforms. It is a story set in a post-apocalyptic world that has been split into two parallel realms: Day and Night. Players take on the role of Lex, an outcast bounty hunter who has found himself in the middle a clash resulting from an impetuous greed for a solitary source of energy. Lex finds himself caught between two polar opposite civilizations, the Atherns and the Lithern.

Lex is the only living halfbreed left in the world, giving him the unique ability to venture between the two parallel realms.In his mission to close the Rift that divides the realms and bring stability to the world, Lex realizes that his halfbreed nature is the last chance this world has to escape complete darkness. During his journey, Lex will become part of an increasingly complex storyline that blurs the line between good and evil, right and wrong. This is a story full of wildly interesting characters, over-the-top action-packed scenes, and ornate mysteries set within an alternate universe where anything is possible. 

A New World

(Above: A cave in Selann mountains in the Day Realm and Night Realm, respectively. The Night Realm is filled with vaporized Ether, changing the environment.)

Edge of Twilight’s (EoT) story begins in the land of Hellayem, hundreds of years prior to the game’s main events. Hellayem is a vast and largely uncharted land that contains all manner and varieties of fauna and flora, and with it, an immensely powerful source of energy that flows naturally throughout.Referred to as Ether,this largely unexplained energy source affects every living creature of the world in various undefined ways. It is known to flow and exist within environments everywhere and at all times.However its actual form is dictated by Day and by Night. 

Bounty Hunter Lex

Lex grew up an orphan on the streets of the iron city, the Citadel of Athyr, and is contracted as a contract killer, thug, and bounty hunter by the Martial Corps. 

Empress Galina

Empress Galina is a beautiful young woman in whom the Athern population has placed its faith. By many, she is considered a lonely and unlucky child, born in a very turbulent time and burdened with huge responsibilities and no alternatives. 

Lukasin

Lukasin is the demented and bloodthirsty leader of the Tainted Lithern. Lukasin is hell-bent on exterminating the Athern race and bringing his own disturbed rule over the land. Lukasin was once a young, peaceful, and ambitious Lithern who aspired to tread in the footsteps of his elders, who lived a life of divine spirituality. After the arrival of the Athern race to Hellayem and the subsequent violent treatment of his own race, Lukasin was swiftly thrust into the position of a leader due to his being one of the few surviving Majestic to escape the Athern onslaught.

The Tainted are the main enemies of Edge of Twilight. They remain true to its faith of worshiping nature but exist in a corrupted state. With his new-found powers, Lukasin is able to call forward damned Lithern spirits from the Twilight Realm and re-animate them into the Day or the Night realm. A Tainted is an enslaved and demonized representation of a deceased Majestic Lithern. They are not exactly alive, nor are they dead. The Tainted carry a simple but distinctive look. They are Lithern, after all, and thus behave as basic grunt units: expendable.They are deployed with the sole purpose of destroying anyone who threatens the Ether Cores. The Tainted will always appear in the world through Rifts that open up mid-air. Below are two types of Tainted.

Tainted Warrior

The Tainted Warriors complement the corresponding Majestic souls that once must have lived in this rocky, harsh environment. Their bodies are sparsely covered with light pieces of armor and other generic garments, with distinguishably larger plates covering other parts of the body - mostly around the shoulders and knees.

Tainted Bruiser

The Tainted Bruisers are much like the Tainted Warriors. Visually, they differ in that their waists are wrapped in steel armor sheets and legs are supported and protected. Their free-flowing thick strands of hair can be seen at the back of their head, reaching halfway down their backs.


Jiankra

The Jiankra is a large carnivore that appropriates items from its surroundings, be they natural or manufactured, and uses these items as crude yet effective camouflage.

Forsaken (The Goal)

Despite their colossal size, these wild beasts have eluded researchers for ages. Rumors from the Guard suggest that Titans enslaved by Lukasin are instrumental in protecting the Ether cores from Athern reclamation.

Forsaken (The Discovery Goal) 

Forsaken (Twilight Goal) 

Above are a small handful of the enemies of Edge of Twilight. With the progression of the game, you will discover more characters, beasts, and enemies.

Engine

Edge of Twilight - Return to Glory was developed with a customized Unreal Engine 3. With support from NVIDIA directly, we plan to bring the game to Shield 2 devices. The NVIDIA Shield 2 version of Edge of Twilight - Return to Glory will have  almost the same visual and gameplay quality as consoles and PCs. Currently, the team plans to bring the game to XBox One and PS4 with some additional developments.

We could throw hundreds of technical terms at you to explain the engine. However, we believe it is much better if we just show you a realtime gameplay video:

Environment

Combat

We are proud of our cinematic combat system. Based on the character and enemies' position, and as well as number of key factors, the camera system will determine the camera action for player to experience the best view during the fight. All the combat shown in the trailer is from real gameplay. Most scenes were directly recorded from someone playing.


Music

A whopping 95% of the audio and music were created by real people with real instruments. Multiple string quartets was record live in the multiple professional recording studio around the world to produce high quality music audio to eshance the gameplay.

Voice Overs

You’ve probably played great games in the past that were ruined by bad voice acting. We wanted to ensure that our game did not fall into this category. We purposefully hired voice talent from Australia to give the world a cohesive, “wild” feel (no offense, Aussies). 

Hardly any other game uses the Australian accent. We believe we created a unique Steampunk world. 

Main Voice Casts

Mike Patton as Lithern and Creatures

Melissa George as Galina

Martin Sacks as Walt

Max Gambale as Lex

Gary Sweet as Lewis

Bruce Spence as Horace

Holly Brisley as Hettie



Edge of Twilight started its development journey from Brisbane, Australia in 2007. After a few years of development, the work was moved to Shanghai. In 2011, we decided to bring the final development to Osaka, Japan. With our expert action adventure game developers experts in Japan, we were able to bring the combat system to the next level. In 2015, we completed the full version of Edge of Twilight with support from experts in Christchurch, New Zealand. We were finally ready for release - we ARE finally ready for release. However, we still must pass the last phase of testing before a formal release.

Fuzzyeyes and its associated company has offices in Kyoto, Osaka, Taiwan, Singapore, and London. With 3rd party support from around the world, we are able to leverage the best of international game development talent. Our team members were selected for their passion, specifically for a passion in creating an original Steampunk world.

Approximately 200 developers worked on this project. The development crossed three continents. Only through this international effort are we finally able to bring this unique title to all our fans.

story:
Essentials.TF is excited to finally be able to go public with information about our next offline 6v6 LAN event, which will take place in Lidköping, Sweden under the banner of Esport United Community Rumble between the 3rd and 5th of November 2017.

The current prizepool is 30 000 SEK (or ±€3000). With this fundraiser we aim to further increase the prizepool of event.

 

If you are interested in going to the event yourself more information on that can be found here.

With this fundraiser we aim to further increase the prizepool of event. If you are interested in going to the event yourself more information on that can be found here.

story:
What are we looking for? 

Guile eSports isn't backed by some millionaire ex-sportstar. It was founded by Oliver Willis, a gaming fan and up until now has been solely funded by him out of his own pocket. He has sent his fighting game players to tournaments, bought consoles and gaming equipment for his teams to enable them to play at the best of their capability. He also paid for the design of the team clothing as well as the website and graphic design costs for the logo and social media banners. 

Now, in order to take Guile eSports to the next level, in order to be associated with those organisations who have heavy financial backing, Oliver and all of Guile eSports is turning to you, the gaming community. 

We need your help to keep Guile eSports going, to keep our players, teams and streamers doing what they love alongside some of the biggest and best talent in the world. 

What will we spend it on?

Every penny of the money donated by you will go straight back into Guile eSports on such things as:

Paying for the tournament registration fees for our players

Paying for an official team jersey for each of our signed players

Supplying equipment to our players to help them perform at their best

Paying for graphic design work for our website and players' social media accounts

Every penny of your donation will go towards enabling our players to keep on playing under the Guile eSports banner as part of a team they love. 

What do our players think about being part of Guile eSports?

"The org feels supportive most importantly, you're treated like a person and not just another cog in the machine" - KuzmaTech (@kuzmatech) Tekken player

"It's fantastic to be part of an organization who's community is so friendly and celebrates success. I want to add my own and the team's success story to its ever growing list of achievements." - TJDJ1989 (@Guile_TJDJ) member of our Paladins team

"When I joined Guile, I did not only join an organization. I joined a family, full of supportive and kind people, helping each other and aiming to create a cozy atmosphere. Guile feels like home to me." - Axonya (@GuileSinon) captain of our Overwatch PC team

"While being one of the broadest organizations of its kind, featuring world-class talent from competitive games of all sorts, Guile is also incredibly community driven. The staff and players are connected in a way that other organizations should take note of." - King Sarathos (@King_Sarathos) Lead Talent Scout and Manager at Guile eSports 

Background:

Guile eSports is a competitive gaming organisation with teams, players and streamers across Europe and North America. We have teams in Smite, Paragon, Paladins, Overwatch, CSGO and FIFA 18. We have players in Injustice 2, Pokken, Tekken, Smash Bros and MVCI. 

We currently have five sponsors who all contribute to helping promote the organisation and grow our fan base. 

Frag Radio

KeenGamer

Manatee

Rogue Energy

Hitmarker Jobs

We get no financial gain from any of our sponsors, apart from Rogue Energy where we get a small commission of sales we push their way.
story_txt: What are we looking for? Guile eSports isn't backed by some millionaire ex-sportstar. It was founded by Oliver Willis, a gaming fan and up until now has been solely funded by him out of his own pocket. He has sent his fighting game players to tournaments, bought consoles and gaming equipment for his teams to enable them to play at the best of their capability. He also paid for the design of the team clothing as well as the website and graphic design costs for the logo and social media banners. Now, in order to take Guile eSports to the next level, in order to be associated with those organisations who have heavy financial backing, Oliver and all of Guile eSports is turning to you, the gaming community. We need your help to keep Guile eSports going, to keep our players, teams and streamers doing what they love alongside some of the biggest and best talent in the world. What will we spend it on?Every penny of the money donated by you will go straight back into Guile eSports on such things as:Paying for the tournament registration fees for our playersPaying for an official team jersey for each of our signed playersSupplying equipment to our players to help them perform at their bestPaying for graphic design work for our website and players' social media accountsEvery penny of your donation will go towards enabling our players to keep on playing under the Guile eSports banner as part of a team they love. What do our players think about being part of Guile eSports?"The org feels supportive most importantly, you're treated like a person and not just another cog in the machine" - KuzmaTech (@kuzmatech) Tekken player"It's fantastic to be part of an organization who's community is so friendly and celebrates success.
