story:
Hubble is an advanced Space Simulator controller based on two individual control interface.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Simulator games are so much more than just FHD/4K graphics, and the largest screen you can get your hands on. Your sense of touch, is an extremely important aspect of immersion as well.

 

Our team has taken great care to evaluate hundreds of switches. Based on durability/performance, we have chosen industrial-grade switches from brands such as APEM and ARCOLECTRIC to bring out the true feel of flicking a real-life control switch. The overall durability and life-span of Hubble also increases dramatically due to the use of premium switches.
 
 
 

 

 

 

 

Using an iPad Mini and 3rd-party applications, Hubble is designed to bring about a whole new dimension to immersion game-play. Through visual feedback and user-customizable controls, Hubble enables you to manipulate your spaceship using natural reflexes.
 
 
 
 
 

Our team takes great care in balancing the design of Hubble module to ensure maximum functionality, while retaining its sleekness. Therefore, magnets have been utilized in various ways to improve the functionality of Hubble.
 

 

 

 

Hubble's main enclosure is manufactured using a single piece of 3mm thick, aircraft-grade aluminium via Extrusion Manufacturing method. Precise holes are then drilled (CNC) into the enclosure with pinpoint accuracy. To put it simply, imagine aluminium being forced through a mold to form a uniform shape, just like Play-Doh.
 

There are many advantages to using Extrusion Manufacturing. Due to its low batch variation and defect rate, Hubble's enclosure can be manufactured with a high level of sturdiness and uniformity. Since there are fewer tools and simplified process requirements, higher yield rates directly translates into shorter lead time, and improved supply chain logistics management.
 
 
 
 

Hubble's iPad Mini Cradle + Cover is built with a sleek and modern Bamboo material. Sourced responsibly, highly recycle and durable in nature, the use of Bamboo adds an incredibly distinct identity to Hubble's design philosophy.
 
Note: As wood are natural materials, it is not possible to manufacture every of our enclosure to look as per image. Kindly expect some variation in-terms of wood grains.
 

The iPad Mini Cradle is bonded to Hubble's main enclosure using Gorilla Glue. With its renown reputation for Holding Strength, Impact Resistance and Waterproof properties, Gorilla Glue is the dominant option for keeping Hubble's top surface screw-free.
 
Learn more about Gorilla Glue here.
 
 
 
 

When you are flying your spaceship, we want to put you right there in the moment, and that's it. There should not be multiple combination keys to memorize, nor complicated controls to master.

 


Hubble is designed ground-up to be a companion control interface so that you can continue to use your favorite controllers. Be it Mouse + Keyboard, Flight Sticks, Dual Sticks, Wireless Controllers or any other devices, Hubble plays nice with them.
 
"You don't have to change yourself to fit Hubble, it was designed to fit you."
 
 
 


Hubble is made to grow alongside your spaceship. Our team are already hard at work on the expansion modules for Hubble, and will be launching them shortly after currently Indiegogo pledges are completely fulfilled.
 
 
 
 

Hubble's internals are designed to be user-accessible via a convenient sliding back cover. Modders and Programmers will feel right at home with the familiar and versatile Arduino Mega 2560-16AU Rev.3, which acts as Hubble's interface controller.

 

Hubble is compatible with virtually any 3rd-party program that recognizes USB input controls. With such an open design for hardware, software and firmware, the possible applications for Hubble are endless.
 
 
 
 
 

Want your control switches done in your own specific way, or really proud of your personal/guild/faction emblem? Simply go for the Customized backing option, and let us build you a set that is truly one-of-a-kind.
 
 

When you purchase the Customized backing option, our friendly staff will contact you by e-mail within 2 months from the end of Indiegogo campaign to confirm your choice of switch layout, and artwork (Recommended Size: 150mm x 150mm) for laser-engraving.
 

A mock-up picture with the artwork will be sent to you for approval before we begin the laser-engraving process on your unique Hubble module set.
 
 
 
 
 

 

 

 
 

Upon hitting the $200,000 stretch goal, we will unlock the incredibly cool Stealth Upgrade. This option changes your color scheme to Matt Black Sandblast finish, upgrades your iPad Cradle + Cover to Burmese Teak Wood, and brings your switches one step up to matching black variants.
 
 

Teak is widely regarded as THE premium choice for wood. An abundance of natural oils and rubber locked right into the wood grains gives it natural water-resistant properties. Teak's tight formation of thick fibers also allows woodwork to be done with minimal chipping or splitting, and holds well over years.
 
 
 
 
 

 

 

 

 

Our team is composed of mostly young adults, who lived and breathed all genre of games as we grew up. 
 
Peter literally lives and breathes entrepreneurship. He has assisted in 4 successful start-up companies, and recently left a stable career in the Immigration field to set-up Nebula Interface. Peter often claims to spot demands that are not filled in the Gaming Industry, and sees it as his mission to fill them with purposeful products.
 
Mickey is a brilliant CAD engineer, and spends his spare time on programming micro-controllers such as Arduino. With a mindset trained from his Aerospace Engineering days, Mickey drives the functionality of Hubble with religious fervor.
 
Sam is a second-generation wood craftsman, who has devoted his entire career in the art of working with solid wood. He currently owns a timber workshop, and guides the Nebula team with his wealth of experience. Since his involvement, Sam has improved the practical aspect of Hubble's enclosure by a significant margin.
 
Roy is an accredited trainer by profession, and believes in Quality over quantity. He takes charge of ensuring that all Assembly staffs are adequately trained, and often performs the task of Quality Control personally.
 
With a Degree in Marketing Communications and 5 years in the multimedia industry, Kim is a natural fit to get the word of Hubble out to the community. However, Kim claims that his job will be the simplest of the team as the Sim and Mod community people are generally a tight-knitted bunch.
 
Shirley will be the lovely lady who ensures that you get your orders made and delivered right. She is incredibly meticulous in her order management, customer service, accounting, and is best known for telling others not to 'interfere' with her work as we will only 'slow her down'.
 
 
 
 

Driven by our passion, the Nebula team has overcome numerous challenges in bringing Hubble to its current stage. We have used our own fundings to purchase large amount of different industrial switches from around the world for testing, and building of various prototypes. These prototypes (3D Print, Steel-Bending, Aluminium-Casting, Acrylic, Polycarbonate, etc) has been costly to produce due to the low MOQ (those of you in the manufacturing industry will understand).
 

Now that the design and concept is assuredly solid, we are at a critical crossroad where your pledges will help us make Hubble reach mass production stage. 
 
We have negotiated an exceptional deal with our manufacturing partners, and will be utilizing the pledge funds for the production of manufacturing mold, procurement of fiber laser machine, as well as purchasing of necessary components.
 
The next portion of the funding will go into the set-up of a 400sqft assembly and storage facilities, which allows us to perform assembly and QC on the Hubble units locally, at a personal level. Yes, we are that particular about it.
 
Help us bridge this financial gap, and let us (and Hubble) change the way you experience Space Flight.
 
 
 
 
 

The Highest Risk

The riskiest part of this campaign is essentially mechanical, the compatibility and durability of our chosen components are our highest risk since we don't manufacture them.

To overcome that issue, our team shortlisted components from only proven industrial brands in the industry, and have put all them (switches and controllers) through various tests by independent mechanical engineers. Through that procedure, we can confirm that the premium switches do indeed live up to their higher cost price.

Since then, we have also been using the same components for subsequent prototypes building and testing. Not a single component has broken down throughout the many rounds of soldering/unsoldering, and not-so-gentle handling. This successfully eliminates our biggest worry of this campaign.

 

Supply & Manufacturing

We have set our delivery timelines by taking into account the time required for all manufactured components to reach our workshop for assembly, and then added some additional buffer period.

To further strengthen relationships, our team will visit the various manufacturing plants in May 2016 to ensure total accuracy of product manufacturing specifications, as well as lead time.

Every components will be ordered with 10% excess stock, to minimize reaction time should any component happen to be faulty-on-arrival. Ready back-up sources for every key component have also been negotiated for, and are ready to be activated with minimal delay.

 

Shipment

All shipments traditionally face an unlikely risk of delay or even missing/lost shipment, regardless of postal companies. In such an event, kindly contact us and we will work out a solution, or replacement for you.

We are also working with an established private freight-forwarding company in Singapore, to bring down the shipping cost significantly for international shipping with tracking option.

However, if you prefer FedEx postal services, simply drop us an e-mail and we can arrange it separately for you (extra charges applies).

 
 

1. What games are support for Hubble controller ?
Star Citizen, Elite Dangerous, EVE Online, and any other games which allow players to bind joystick keys, will work on with Hubble.
2. What are the PC requirements for Hubble ?
Windows 7/8/10 PC. You will also need WIFI for the iPad Mini to connect to host PC on the same network.
3. Where can I find 3rd-party apps for my iPad Mini ?
We recommend using ROCCAT™ Power-Grid™ software for the control interface. ROCCAT has invested much effort into their eco-system, and has an GRID store full of control interface for the latest games. You can even create your own control interface and share it here.
4. Why only iPad Mini ? Is Android supported ?
The reason why we made the difficult decision to support only iPad Mini (with Lightning Charging Port) at launch, is mainly because it has retained almost identical form factor throughout its product refresh cycles.

iPad Mini's strong international availability, stable performance, strategic port placements and compact size enables us to design Hubble to work in tandem in the most seamless manner.

At the moment, we are experimenting with several ways that we can support Android tablets, but have no ETA on that at the moment.

5. Can I mount Hubble onto my desktop or cockpit ?
Yes. Hubble's back-plate is pre-drilled with VESA compatible, 75mm and 100mm thru-holes.

6. What are the dimensions for Hubble ?
Approximately: L 486mm x W 262mm x H 95mm

7. Does Hubble come with warranty ?
It is in our standard operating procedure to personally test each button and function of every Hubble unit we ship so that the chances of backers receiving a faulty unit will be minimized

On top of that, we will cover every Hubble module for 12 months (18 months if Stretch Goal is achieved) against manufacturing defects. RMA procedures will be included in the final product.

8. Where can I buy cheap iPad Mini for Hubble ?
If you are purchasing an iPad Mini only for gaming with Hubble, we recommend purchasing a pre-owned iPad Mini 2/3/4 via eBay, or refurbished via Apple's online store for your country.

Important: Please ensure that the iPad Mini that you are purchasing, comes with Lightning Charging Port, and NOT the older 30pin connector.

9. Can I buy Hubble after the Campaign has ended ?
Yes. Visit our website here to purchase.

10. Which countries do you ship to ?
United States, Australia, Canada, United Kingdom, Germany, Brunei, Hong Kong, India, Indonesia, Italy, Japan, Singapore, South Korea, Malaysia, Netherlands, New Zealand, Philippines, Taiwan, Thailand, Vietnam.

We are also able to arrange shipment to countries not listed above, simply send us an e-mail and we will update you of the shipping charges.

10. I am a re-seller/distributor, how can I get in touch ?
We will be happy to work with you. Contact us at our e-mail below.

 11. I have more questions, how can I get in touch ?
We will be happy to have a chat. Contact us at via Ask Us A Question at the top of this page.

 

 

 

The more we are known, the higher chances that the next-tier of stretch goals can be achieved. Help us spread the word among the community !

 

Website - http://www.nebint.com/

Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/Nebulainterface

Twitter - https://twitter.com/NebulaInterface

Email - general@nebint.com
story_txt:
Hubble is an advanced Space Simulator controller based on two individual control interface.
 

 
 
 


 
 




Simulator games are so much more than just FHD/4K graphics, and the largest screen you can get your hands on. Your sense of touch, is an extremely important aspect of immersion as well.
 



Our team has taken great care to evaluate hundreds of switches. Based on durability/performance, we have chosen industrial-grade switches from brands such as APEM and ARCOLECTRIC to bring out the true feel of flicking a real-life control switch. The overall durability and life-span of Hubble also increases dramatically due to the use of premium switches.
 
 
 



 

 
 
 


Using an iPad Mini and 3rd-party applications, Hubble is designed to bring about a whole new dimension to immersion game-play. Through visual feedback and user-customizable controls, Hubble enables you to manipulate your spaceship using natural reflexes.
 
 
 
 
 


Our team takes great care in balancing the design of Hubble module to ensure maximum functionality, while retaining its sleekness. Therefore, magnets have been utilized in various ways to improve the functionality of Hubble.
 


 
 
 


Hubble's main enclosure is manufactured using a single piece of 3mm thick, aircraft-grade aluminium via Extrusion Manufacturing method. Precise holes are then drilled (CNC) into the enclosure with pinpoint accuracy. To put it simply, imagine aluminium being forced through a mold to form a uniform shape, just like Play-Doh.
 


There are many advantages to using Extrusion Manufacturing. Due to its low batch variation and defect rate, Hubble's enclosure can be manufactured with a high level of sturdiness and uniformity. Since there are fewer tools and simplified process requirements, higher yield rates directly translates into shorter lead time, and improved supply chain logistics management.
 
 
 
 



Hubble's iPad Mini Cradle + Cover is built with a sleek and modern Bamboo material. Sourced responsibly, highly recycle and durable in nature, the use of Bamboo adds an incredibly distinct identity to Hubble's design philosophy.
 
Note: As wood are natural materials, it is not possible to manufacture every of our enclosure to look as per image. Kindly expect some variation in-terms of wood grains.
 


The iPad Mini Cradle is bonded to Hubble's main enclosure using Gorilla Glue. With its renown reputation for Holding Strength, Impact Resistance and Waterproof properties, Gorilla Glue is the dominant option for keeping Hubble's top surface screw-free.
 
Learn more about Gorilla Glue here.
 
 
 
 


When you are flying your spaceship, we want to put you right there in the moment, and that's it. There should not be multiple combination keys to memorize, nor complicated controls to master.
 

 Hubble is designed ground-up to be a companion control interface so that you can continue to use your favorite controllers. Be it Mouse + Keyboard, Flight Sticks, Dual Sticks, Wireless Controllers or any other devices, Hubble plays nice with them.
 
"You don't have to change yourself to fit Hubble, it was designed to fit you."
 
 
 



Hubble is made to grow alongside your spaceship. Our team are already hard at work on the expansion modules for Hubble, and will be launching them shortly after currently Indiegogo pledges are completely fulfilled.
 
 
 
 



Hubble's internals are designed to be user-accessible via a convenient sliding back cover. Modders and Programmers will feel right at home with the familiar and versatile Arduino Mega 2560-16AU Rev.3, which acts as Hubble's interface controller.
 


Hubble is compatible with virtually any 3rd-party program that recognizes USB input controls. With such an open design for hardware, software and firmware, the possible applications for Hubble are endless.
 
 
 
 
 



Want your control switches done in your own specific way, or really proud of your personal/guild/faction emblem? Simply go for the Customized backing option, and let us build you a set that is truly one-of-a-kind.
 
 



When you purchase the Customized backing option, our friendly staff will contact you by e-mail within 2 months from the end of Indiegogo campaign to confirm your choice of switch layout, and artwork (Recommended Size: 150mm x 150mm) for laser-engraving.
 




A mock-up picture with the artwork will be sent to you for approval before we begin the laser-engraving process on your unique Hubble module set.
 
 
 
 
 



 

 





 
 





Upon hitting the $200,000 stretch goal, we will unlock the incredibly cool Stealth Upgrade. This option changes your color scheme to Matt Black Sandblast finish, upgrades your iPad Cradle + Cover to Burmese Teak Wood, and brings your switches one step up to matching black variants.
 
 


Teak is widely regarded as THE premium choice for wood. An abundance of natural oils and rubber locked right into the wood grains gives it natural water-resistant properties. Teak's tight formation of thick fibers also allows woodwork to be done with minimal chipping or splitting, and holds well over years.
 
 
 
 
 


 

 
 
 


Our team is composed of mostly young adults, who lived and breathed all genre of games as we grew up. 
 

Peter literally lives and breathes entrepreneurship. He has assisted in 4 successful start-up companies, and recently left a stable career in the Immigration field to set-up Nebula Interface. Peter often claims to spot demands that are not filled in the Gaming Industry, and sees it as his mission to fill them with purposeful products.
 

Mickey is a brilliant CAD engineer, and spends his spare time on programming micro-controllers such as Arduino. With a mindset trained from his Aerospace Engineering days, Mickey drives the functionality of Hubble with religious fervor.
 

Sam is a second-generation wood craftsman, who has devoted his entire career in the art of working with solid wood. He currently owns a timber workshop, and guides the Nebula team with his wealth of experience. Since his involvement, Sam has improved the practical aspect of Hubble's enclosure by a significant margin.
 

Roy is an accredited trainer by profession, and believes in Quality over quantity. He takes charge of ensuring that all Assembly staffs are adequately trained, and often performs the task of Quality Control personally.
 
With a Degree in Marketing Communications and 5 years in the multimedia industry, Kim is a natural fit to get the word of Hubble out to the community. However, Kim claims that his job will be the simplest of the team as the Sim and Mod community people are generally a tight-knitted bunch.
 

Shirley will be the lovely lady who ensures that you get your orders made and delivered right. She is incredibly meticulous in her order management, customer service, accounting, and is best known for telling others not to 'interfere' with her work as we will only 'slow her down'.
 
 
 
 


Driven by our passion, the Nebula team has overcome numerous challenges in bringing Hubble to its current stage. We have used our own fundings to purchase large amount of different industrial switches from around the world for testing, and building of various prototypes. These prototypes (3D Print, Steel-Bending, Aluminium-Casting, Acrylic, Polycarbonate, etc) has been costly to produce due to the low MOQ (those of you in the manufacturing industry will understand).
 



Now that the design and concept is assuredly solid, we are at a critical crossroad where your pledges will help us make Hubble reach mass production stage. 
 
We have negotiated an exceptional deal with our manufacturing partners, and will be utilizing the pledge funds for the production of manufacturing mold, procurement of fiber laser machine, as well as purchasing of necessary components.
 
The next portion of the funding will go into the set-up of a 400sqft assembly and storage facilities, which allows us to perform assembly and QC on the Hubble units locally, at a personal level. Yes, we are that particular about it.
 
Help us bridge this financial gap, and let us (and Hubble) change the way you experience Space Flight.
 
 
 
 
 


The Highest Risk
The riskiest part of this campaign is essentially mechanical, the compatibility and durability of our chosen components are our highest risk since we don't manufacture them.
To overcome that issue, our team shortlisted components from only proven industrial brands in the industry, and have put all them (switches and controllers) through various tests by independent mechanical engineers. Through that procedure, we can confirm that the premium switches do indeed live up to their higher cost price.
Since then, we have also been using the same components for subsequent prototypes building and testing. Not a single component has broken down throughout the many rounds of soldering/unsoldering, and not-so-gentle handling. This successfully eliminates our biggest worry of this campaign.
 
Supply & Manufacturing
We have set our delivery timelines by taking into account the time required for all manufactured components to reach our workshop for assembly, and then added some additional buffer period.
To further strengthen relationships, our team will visit the various manufacturing plants in May 2016 to ensure total accuracy of product manufacturing specifications, as well as lead time.
Every components will be ordered with 10% excess stock, to minimize reaction time should any component happen to be faulty-on-arrival. Ready back-up sources for every key component have also been negotiated for, and are ready to be activated with minimal delay.
 
Shipment
All shipments traditionally face an unlikely risk of delay or even missing/lost shipment, regardless of postal companies. In such an event, kindly contact us and we will work out a solution, or replacement for you.
We are also working with an established private freight-forwarding company in Singapore, to bring down the shipping cost significantly for international shipping with tracking option.
However, if you prefer FedEx postal services, simply drop us an e-mail and we can arrange it separately for you (extra charges applies).

 
 



 1. What games are support for Hubble controller ?Star Citizen, Elite Dangerous, EVE Online, and any other games which allow players to bind joystick keys, will work on with Hubble.

2. What are the PC requirements for Hubble ?Windows 7/8/10 PC. You will also need WIFI for the iPad Mini to connect to host PC on the same network.


3. Where can I find 3rd-party apps for my iPad Mini ?We recommend using ROCCAT™ Power-Grid™ software for the control interface. ROCCAT has invested much effort into their eco-system, and has an GRID store full of control interface for the latest games. You can even create your own control interface and share it here.


4. Why only iPad Mini ? Is Android supported ?The reason why we made the difficult decision to support only iPad Mini (with Lightning Charging Port) at launch, is mainly because it has retained almost identical form factor throughout its product refresh cycles.


iPad Mini's strong international availability, stable performance, strategic port placements and compact size enables us to design Hubble to work in tandem in the most seamless manner.
At the moment, we are experimenting with several ways that we can support Android tablets, but have no ETA on that at the moment.
5. Can I mount Hubble onto my desktop or cockpit ?Yes. Hubble's back-plate is pre-drilled with VESA compatible, 75mm and 100mm thru-holes.
6. What are the dimensions for Hubble ?Approximately: L 486mm x W 262mm x H 95mm
7. Does Hubble come with warranty ?It is in our standard operating procedure to personally test each button and function of every Hubble unit we ship so that the chances of backers receiving a faulty unit will be minimized
On top of that, we will cover every Hubble module for 12 months (18 months if Stretch Goal is achieved) against manufacturing defects. RMA procedures will be included in the final product.
8. Where can I buy cheap iPad Mini for Hubble ?If you are purchasing an iPad Mini only for gaming with Hubble, we recommend purchasing a pre-owned iPad Mini 2/3/4 via eBay, or refurbished via Apple's online store for your country.
Important: Please ensure that the iPad Mini that you are purchasing, comes with Lightning Charging Port, and NOT the older 30pin connector.
9. Can I buy Hubble after the Campaign has ended ?Yes. Visit our website here to purchase.
10. Which countries do you ship to ?United States, Australia, Canada, United Kingdom, Germany, Brunei, Hong Kong, India, Indonesia, Italy, Japan, Singapore, South Korea, Malaysia, Netherlands, New Zealand, Philippines, Taiwan, Thailand, Vietnam.
We are also able to arrange shipment to countries not listed above, simply send us an e-mail and we will update you of the shipping charges.
10. I am a re-seller/distributor, how can I get in touch ?We will be happy to work with you. Contact us at our e-mail below.
 11. I have more questions, how can I get in touch ?We will be happy to have a chat. Contact us at via Ask Us A Question at the top of this page.
 
 
 

The more we are known, the higher chances that the next-tier of stretch goals can be achieved. Help us spread the word among the community !
