story:
KIGAEA is a fictional realm based on the book, KIGAEA Effervescence of Reality.

KIGAEA is a world that defies the conventions of modern Science. Following a cosmic event mingled with human intervention, the nature of existence has been changed. Inspired by ancient cultural tales, KIGAEA aims to introduce Magic in a new way.

 

 

 

Development of KIGAEA Tactics began on January 2nd, 2017. However, the concept of this game began back in 1998, inspired by the original tactics titles of the 90s. As a gamer, my favorite genre has always been Tactical Turn-Based RPGs. However, I was always left with the desire to explore the beautifully rendered isometric maps in such games.

It always felt that these popular titles fell short of their full potential, focusing solely and mostly on the combat aspects. I found myself desiring other activities within a single player, isometric realm, such as Exploration, Trading, Collecting, Politics, and more of the traditional non-combat aspects of RPGs.

At this stage of my life, I have acquired the skills and experience to develop a game of my own. Honestly, if I could only develop a single game in my life, this would be it. THIS is the game I have wanted to play since I was 12 years old, and I would like to present to you the concept that is KIGAEA Tactics.

I sincerely hope you enjoy the presentation, and hopefully you will join me on this adventure to pave the way to the next generation of Tactical Turn-Based RPGs!

 

 

 

Never-before-seen Combat Engine. Turn-Based Choices, Real Time Action!

All units move during the Action Phase, however choices are made in traditional Turn-Based manner during the Intent Phase. When units meet on the field, an Interaction occurs, giving you full control of your response and a myriad of ways to achieve a tactical victory!

 

 

 

Spells travel on the field, at a rate of X tiles per second. Action phase consists of a fixed amount of seconds, meaning that it will be possible to block spells, deflect spells, or even magically alter them while they are traveling on the field!

 

 

 

Example Action Phase

Note: Speed in-game will be faster than conceptual mock ups

 

The 4x genre meets Tactical Turn-Based RPG, at the Unit's Perspective

Unlike most traditional 4x titles where your role is All-Seeing, in KIGAEA Tactics you will manage your squad of units and explore this realm at the Unit's perspective. In order to play the 4x management aspects, you will have to achieve the respective Role in Society (e.g. if you want to influence Politics or Laws, become a Judge or Bribe Diplomats).

 

Seamless (Yes, seamless!) Exploration to Combat Transition

Witness the A.I. battle as you sit on a bar stool and sip on a drink. Seamless transition to battle means, a war could ensue around you and you can do your best not to get involved, or you can indiscriminately wipe both sides. The choice will be yours.

 

Classes unlock exploration skills and crafting skills. It's not all about combat in KIGAEA Tactics. Exploration is a big key, and non-combat activities will range from fishing*, to “cook-offs”*. Many unique events planned!

 

* - Note: Initial Early Access release may not include fishing or cooking, as these features are planned for the Early Access stage of development. However, they may be included as Stretch Goals, to be made in time for Early Access.

 

Next Generation A.I. built from scratch in Python

Deep A.I. Logic that is not time-dependent. No weekly schedules here! Only a robust mind that constantly analyzes its environment, and makes choices based on factors presented in Jungian psychology and other branches of Scientific study.

An A.I. system devised of four Archetypal elements, and seven dynamic levels of Consciousness that vary based on the A.I.'s unique experience as the game progresses. No two games will be the same. No two A.I. will be the same. Needs vary. Moods vary. Actions change.

Ever played a true telepath that read an A.I.'s intentions? With this A.I. system, such skills will be a regular tool of not only combat, but also exploration!

 

A Living World that is dynamic, and affected by all player and A.I. decisions

Each Country will have a City with a Court. Each Court will have a Judicial Process. Each City will have Laws defining the type of Judicial Process. Countries have dynamic borders. Tribes can become politically tied to Countries, or become their own Independent organizations.

The whole realm of KIGAEA Tactics will be a dynamic, closed system, designed as a 4x world, played at the Unit's perspective.

 

Squad Management true to its Origins

Arithmetic based growth, just like the original titles. Progress and improvements will be constant, after nearly every battle or non-combat quest. New classes unlock layers of game mechanics, to be used both for combat, and also exploration!

 

Equipment will be arithmetically scaled, whereas crafting and unique items may add exponential scaling in the form of %s. However, such items will be exquisite and rare. The craftsmen of such pieces will be unique characters, influential to the realm and able to either be recruited or defeated (Note: try finding someone nowadays to make you a sword as good as a true Masamune katana...I wish to reflect that in KIGAEA Tactics, as older titles such as Suikoden embodied with its upgrading system).

New synergies (classes) will enhance the abilities of older classes, so that no skill ever becomes obsolete (e.g. a Mage may have Fireball, but the stronger Magus may have Enhanced Projectiles ability, which can make Fireball or any other projectile spell from any class, more powerful...note Mage and Magus are hypothetical classes for the purpose of example only).

 

Disclaimer: KIGAEA Tactics will be released as an Early Access game capable of delivering a full experience, and dozens (or hundreds, depending on your style) of hours of entertainment.

However, the full World Map will not be available at Early Access launch. The Early Access timeline is designed such that new locations, classes, and non-combat mechanics (like fishing and crafting) will be introduced. The exploratory zone will expand through the Early Access development, until the full world is available for the full version release.

For Early Access, expect the city of Centropolis, the Fishermen Tribe in the country of Midrealm, and various combat locations to be available, including the related artwork and lore. For more information on the Development Timeline through Early Access release, see below.

 

 

 

Currently, the following aspects have been programmed from scratch for the custom engine.

  • Isometric Grid Zones
    • Tile Art for all Zones, including varying Biomes
    • Click Detection and ability to move map
    • Transition to Isometric Grid from World Map
    • Integrated dynamic UI for various screens within Grid Zones
  • Inventory System
    • Categorized System
    • Differentiated Combat and Non-combat Inventories
    • UI Display for Squad Inventory Management and Looting
    • Looting mechanics for Containers
    • Vendor UI (Under Improvement)
  • Squad System
    • Unit management (Equipment, Abilities, Class)
    • Unit recruitment (Reserved for special building or A.I. interaction)
  • World Map
    • Art is complete.
    • Locations are integrated.
    • Hand-drawn paths have been crafted.
    • Units move along hand-crafted paths.
    • Dynamic country borders
  • Exploration in Grid Zones
    • Fully integrated art, including animated sprites for walking.
    • Zone to Zone transitions means you can enter buildings (so can the A.I.)!
    • Note: Fast travel is planned, but time auditing will occur, meaning you will be able to load the zone with specified building of said town, so you don't have to walk there, but the time it would have taken you to walk will have passed for all A.I. in the game.

 

 

 

  • Combat Engine (In Progress, ~1 month)
    • UI Improvements
    • Action Phase (Time Flow)
    • Class Mechanics
  • Main Town (~1 month)
    • Main Market
    • Functional Buildings (Quest Office, City Hall, among others)
    • Tavern Improvements
  • A.I. Logic (Pseudocode Done, ~2 months)
    • No weekly schedules!
    • General Archetypes
      • Fire (Passionate)
      • Earth (Stern)
      • Air (Aloof)
      • Water (Flexible)
    • Combat Logic
    • Speech Logic
    • Behavior Logic
  • 10 Classes
    • Adventurer
      • Branches to: Swordsman, Archer, Brawler, Spearman
    • Initiate
      • Branches to: Herbalist, Ritualist, Arcanist, Spiritualist
  • Fishermen Tribe Zone
    • Town Zone (less facilities than City)
    • Unique, Tribe-Specific goods
    • Dynamic Territory Border
  • Various Field Zones
    • Dynamic encounters
    • Resource gathering
    • Combat grinding
  • Start Conditions
    • Choose Wealth level
    • Choose social Role (limited at Early Access)
    • Choose starting Location (only Centropolis at Early Access)
    • Choose opposing Factions (feature intended after Early Access)
    • Choose starting Class (availabile as unlocked)
    • Choose number of Squad members

 

Above is the list of current development plans for the Early Access release. Note that Early Access is anticipated for launch in Winter 2018, unless sufficient funding is met to expedite the process by hiring additional artists and developers (see Stretch Goals).

 

 

 

 

 

 

  • Next Hurricane Season

Being that I am in Puerto Rico, and given the latest devastation caused by Hurricane Maria, it has been a challenge getting back to normal operating conditions. For this reason, extra preparations will be made to have backup power (solar or other, currently under consideration) in other to continue operations during power outages. I can work and fully finish the game offline, so internet is not the main priority, but power is necessary for development to be possible.

  • Shortage of Funding

For this project, funding means time. Like other developers before me, I could fully develop KIGAEA Tactics across the next couple of years. However, art is not my strong suit. Therefore, outsourcing art out of my regular pay has been working. With the success of this IndieGoGo campaign, I can turn to full-time development, including paying for artists, which will help me release the game sooner! Shortage of funding is a delay, not something that fully impedes the development.

  • Diversifying Game Features

Not everyone has the same vision or desire for features. For this reason, early backers will have access to the development Discord channel for text chat, in order to provide feedback, suggestions, or simply be in-the-know of the upcoming features as they are being developed. Where I am able, I will make toggles, and allow users to choose their preferred method of play, just like many 4x titles!

 

 

 

My name is Carlos Budet. I am the author of KIGAEA Effervescence of Reality.

As a self-taught programmer with 9 years experience, I am now using my skills to create KIGAEA Tactics, the game I have wanted to play since I was a child.

I invite you to join me on this adventure. With your support, the development can gain the momentum needed for an expedited release.

Thank you for taking the time to share my vision!

 

 

 

Many assets have come from independent artists.

I would like to Credit each, for their contributions to KIGAEA Tactics!

 

PyTom - Ren'Py Game Engine

http://www.renpy.org

Thank you, PyTom, for creating such a great engine for game development, and for your hard dedication to the engine after so many years. Thank you for attending my questions as I poked and prodded through the tools, learning to use the engine, and thank you for providing a great and helpful community through Lemma Soft Forums!

 

Max Heyder - Isometric Tile Art Assets & Isometric Decor Assets

http://maxheyderart.com

Thank you, Max, for your amazing tile sprites, and a license that allows customization of the sprites for tailored usage! Your work has helped to brighten the landscape of KIGAEA Tactics!

 

Spyros Kontis - Custom Pixel Sprite Assets

http://pixeljoint.com/forum/forum_posts.asp?TID...

Thank you, Spyros, for your awesome Character Sprite Art! Your work was tailored precisely to the requests for the starting classes of KIGAEA Tactics, including all of the animation frames!

 

LoiLoi Drawings - Custom Anime Art Assets

http://loiloichan.deviantart.com

Thank you, LoiLoi Drawings! Your amazing work, given pixel characters, is quite impressive! You were able to embody the pixel character in an anime format, creating the first mugshots for the starting classes of KIGAEA Tactics!

 

Bleed - Licensed Isometric Building Assets

http://remusprites.carbonmade.com/

Thank you, Bleed, for such exquisite detail in your isometric buildings! Also, thank for you providing a steady stream of art for the community, such that someone like myself could find one day, and use to create the game we dream to play.

 

Eric Matyas - Licensed & Custom Music Assets

http://www.soundimage.org/

Thank you, Eric, for providing an awe-inspiring website with licensed tunes for game development and other audiovisual needs. Also, thank you for your excellent work in creating custom tracks given only a starting hum drum audio clip. To be able to grasp the chord, or melody, and create a track of it, is truly the sign of an adept!

 

Public Domain Assets

To all of the artists who have contributed public domain assets to KIGAEA Tactics, please forgive the lack of mention, and feel free to contact me for a mention (with link of original asset, and a website link of your portfolio or work examples), if so desired! Thank you for your contributions to the independent video game developer community!

 

 

Tentative Computer Specifications

  • OS: Win XP+
  • Processor: i3+
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM*
  • DirectX: Version 9+*
  • Storage: 2 GB available space

* - Items marked with an asterisk may have parameters increased by Early Access release.

story:
Xobox is a game with a fanbase!

Xobox is better version of game which everyone knows as Tic-Tac-Toe, Noughts and Crosses or just Xs and Os.

 

We provide much more fun than classic TicTacToe game by extending it to the 3D and VR. It is very similar to classic one but you get additional third dimension and you can play against up to 7 players instantly on your mobile or PC in 3D or VR. Use can use your Oculus VR or GearVR to play.  

You will get a lot of fun for you and your Friends.

 

EPIC GAMES supports Xobox!

We just received generous “Unreal Dev Grants” from Epic Games. We get Oculus Rift and Touch from Epic Games and it means the word for us. Because of it we can continue to develop Xobox for VR devices. Thank you for investing in Xobox. 

We are so lucky to have Epic Games support. Base on it we will provide full support for Oculus Rift and Touch devices and develop the game. It will bring a new level into Xobox, the next generation TicTacToe game in 3D and VR.

You can get more info about Epic Games at www.epicgames.com and Unreal Engine at www.unrealengine.com .

 

Check out our alpha stage game trailer!

 

About Xobox game 

Tic-tac-toe (also known as “noughts and crosses” or “Xs and Os“) is a paper-and-pencil game for two players, X and O, who take turns marking the spaces in a 3×3 grid. The player who succeeds in placing three of their marks in a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal row wins the game.Tic-tac-toe (also known as “noughts and crosses” or “Xs and Os”) is a paper-and-pencil game for two players, X and O, who take turns marking the spaces in a 3×3 grid. The player who succeeds in placing three of their marks in a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal row wins the game.

At bigger grids you can play with more players up to 7 additional players which enable to play 8 players instantly. At bigger grids you can play with more players up to 7 additional players which enable to play 8 players instantly.

We provide much more fan as classic TicTacToe game by extending it to the 3D cubic and VR world. Play is very similar to classic one but you will get additional third dimension which extends grid into third dimension as 3x3x3 up to 7x7x7 grids.We provide the same and much more fan as classic TicTacToe game by extending it to the 3D cubic and VR world. 

The revolution is the same as you get colors into your TV. The same is with Xobox, the new generation TicTacToe game. You never see it before. You will become a part of the game in VR. Also you will meet our girl and robot named Xobox in this world.  Xobox is optimized to work in VR for Oculus and Samsung GearVR. It is possible that in the future we will add support for additional VR platforms and devices.

 

 

 

 

Our Perks for you

For almost all of you we would like to give a released game with all upcoming updates to first version of Xobox game. You can choose platform as mobile, VR or PC.

You can get early access to the game, to it's developer builds before the final game will be finished. We provide access to the alpha and beta versions of the Xobox.

We provide additional asset pack with photos, wallpapers, videos and other interesting stuff.

For our contributors we prepare 3D printed Xobox toys, different t-shirts with Xobox game printed and immortalize you as our sponsor at our game website or even at the game. 

You can participate into designing Xobox game because at specified level you can design our cubes. You can design it on paper, computer or whatever you like. It can be even your idea or notes, which we will implement into game.

 

Meet Xobox

We create Xobox from scrap which is friendly japanse robot. His main advantage is his  big stomach which hide cubic TicTacToe game. He is very heavy, so he moves very slowly. His processor is very good, but not so fast, so you will have possibilities to win a match with him.

It’s easy and can be difficult game at once.  Xobox enable to play 8 players at mobile or PC, all in the one game instantly. You will choose it that will be your Friends or AI, computer which against you can play too.

Small girl can control Xobox and start the hidden game. Let’s play game with him too.

 

Get into Virtual Reality

For many yeas Virtual Reality was just sounds of future. Today it is with you.

The revolution is the same as you get colors into your TV. The same is with Xobox, the new generation TicTacToe game. Propably, you never see it before. You will become a part of the game in VR. 

Xobox is optimized to work in VR for Oculus Rift and Samsung GearVR. It is possible that in the future we will add support for additional VR platforms and devices.   

VR gives you a new stage into this game.

But don't worry if you don't have VR yet. You can still play Xobox at mobile devices or at PC without VR set, just in 3D which looks amazing too.


How you can help us

Our target $15,000 is setup to deliver first version of the game. This money will be spend to buy additional and update software and licenses for different type of assets. Some work we will outsource for accelerate release date of the final game. A part of it we will spend for farm rendering to create videos too. 

Target is not our limit. It just a sum needed to finish the game, where the most to do is to finish  logic, VR and other platforms implementations. 

In the case we exceed our target then the rest money will be spent to develop Xobox for other platforms and develop second version of the Xobox.


Why $15,000 ?

The money raised for this target will be used towards the releasing first version of the Xobox game:

  • Finish AI logic,
  • Scripting & Coding,
  • The most of it will be spend for implements other platform versions (especially VR),
  • Sound and visual effects,
  • Update and buy additional software,
  • Buy license for different type assets,
  • Buy official Oculus VR HMD + touches (to replace our DK2 development version),
  • Buy Android TV console and gamepads,
  • Outsource some of the work (except core logic which is our domain),
  • Rendering some animations at farm renderings,
  • Touch up a game,
  • Release on multi-platform,
  • Test and release it.

$15,000 is a good litmus test for us. Making an indie game of this scope needs good funding. Until this point we invest all our private money, so the sum will be much bigger. That's why with this help we will be able to release Xobox on so many platforms:   

It's better that we ask now and see if there is a market for our idea. Using target based funding means we ensure there is enough demand before we go with further development. 

 

$26,000 will release game on Apple devices

Why additional $11,000 for Apple release? We need to rewrite and implement the game on such platforms which will need a lot of work on our side. There it is needs to buy an Mac, iPad and iPhone devices with software to work, test and release Xobox for it. 

To accomplish it we will spend our money for:

  • Implement game for Apple iPad, iPhone and Mac,
  • Buy an Mac, iPad and iPhone devices,
  • Buy software for it,
  • Test and release it on the Partner platform.

 

IT IS OUR PASSION

Everythink we are doing we doing 
with passion and heart

Our experience is in multimedia applications for multiple platforms, high end interactive eKiosks with 3D, creating 2D and 3D with animations, VR applications, Internet websites, video production, special effects and audio mastering. We use only legal software. Of course, game creation is our passion which we are spending all of our free time.

We are developing different type of VR games and multimedia applications. Oculus Rift and GearVR are our targets. 3D we use in every our projects at each platform.  Our team graduated the best University in VR with rewards creating most advanced VR applications for 6-wall CAVE, one from a few available in the Europe. Also as a children we were flaying around with a VFX-1 VR HMD at the Magic Carpet.

 

Experienced Team

We are small team who create games and professional 3D and VR multimedia applications across last decade. We develop multi-platform applications in different game engines as Unreal Engine 4, CryEngine, Lumberlyard and Unity. Also we have experience in Stingray game engine.  Our philosophy is to use proper engine for game/application, but not use just one from them for everything.

 

Risks & Challenges

There are no projects without a risk. Xobox is advanced multi-platform project which is very easy to play in it. We don't decide to show it publicly before we make some tests and prototype it. We spend many months to get what we have already. But this not prevent us from some risks and challenges.

For mobile platform it will need a modern mobile device from you. We have tested on some of it and it is works correctly and it looks amazing !

Other challenges are for Virtual Reality version of the application. About performance of GearVR I just writen up, but the same are for Oculus VR. Xobox logic is very advanced and makes a lot of calculations which reserve processing power. For VR we need to get very high FPS rate to work in it. Together both platforms needs comfortable controlling game in VR and need to implement VR techniques which minimize headache after long time playing in VR a match.

That's problems may delay a release date of the Xobox game.
 

Xobox website

Find more about Xobox game at: http://xoboxgame.com 


 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute today, you can always join us. Another way that anyone can help is by helping to spread the word of our new game. 

You can also visit our website http://xoboxgame.com and sign up to our mailing list at this link. Also you can found us at Social Channels: 

 https://www.facebook.com/xoboxfanpage

https://twitter.com/XoboxGame

https://www.instagram.com/xoboxgame

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC5CBctPJ61yP3aHKyMP_r8g

 

And please be sure to share this link on your social media accounts, forums, and other places you visit online. Help us make Xobox an even bigger success!

story:
About Myself

My name is Matthew Nutting and i am the founder and lead programmer of 1&a1/4 Games

i Have 2 kids and a loving wife. i have worked as a laborer for 20 years and after a work related incident me and my partner looked into doing something different.

i was always good at programming but needed to support my family so i made sure there was always food and a roof over there head, but now i thought i should work towards building my own business and that's where 1&a1/4 Games come from.

 

About 1&a1/4 Games

At 1&a1/4 Games we want to make games designed to play and be as fun and immersive as games from the N64/Dreamcast era of gaming as i feel all that fun got lost in online mutiplayer and season passes were games are noting more than an unfinished mess that people have to wait years for them to finish. 

1&a1/4 Games are looking at making FPS/ Third Person and RTS games that are fun to play with mates and alone, so you can have the excitement of fully finished games the day of release.

Plus all the games will be made with Modders in mind but also a controlled mod that wont be classed as cheating.

About Wavekillaz

Wavekillaz is a game i have been working on for 4 years. its an FPS Based on games like Golderneye and Turok, its a basic FPS with a run and gun gameplay with no regenerating heath

you can purchase weapons from ATM machines as well as heath but money is earned buy killing the bad guys.

you are a reprogrammed Robot buy mankind to save the world from Dr Baz Die.cHe has created a robot army desingned to kill and destroy the world so he can remake it in his own way. so you travel the world and then time to stop them before mankind is destroyed.   

What This Campaign Is To Achieve

I am looking to earn $10.000 to help me make this a more polished and fuller experiance:

4 New Single Player Levels

3 New Multiplayer Levels

Extra Programmer to Help Finish and Polish the Game

if i can Raise more hopefully between $15.000 to $20.000

Online Multiplayer

Close Quarters Battle Royale Map

this would help me release this game in a bigger more complete finshed product.

i have sorted the Perks in to a controlled way as i do not want to delay the release of this past November 2020.

story:
Demo (Windows only for now) contains:
22 enemy types of 2 factions
11 weapons
2 levels
2 bosses
Basic scoring system
Controller support

Demo does not contain:

Full scoring system
Random events
Perks



Rick Henderson is an endless horizontal-scrolling shoot 'em up with infinite replayability, a true homage to 16-bit shooters wrapped in graphics we all loved. Twitch your fingers through five enemy factions and their bosses, upgrade your ship and try to survive through unpredictable space events.

Levels are generated by combining hand-crafted waves (consisting of single enemies, squadrons, waypoint enemies and their combinations), multiple bosses' variations and random events to provide unique, but satisfying experience every time you play.

The Game Loop consists of Levels. First level is composed of Pirate only waves with a Pirate boss at the end. When you defeat the Pirate Boss, you get to choose a perk from a random selection of perks which will fit your play style (better firing rate for a weapon type, score bonus, and so on) and then enter the Warp. Random events can occur while being in warp, either a Warp Malfunction, which will drop you in the middle of a Meteor Storm, single faction space (the idea is to implement a special Warp Dweller faction which can be only found in Warp, if the funding allows), or other similar hazards during the next Level.

Next Level is made of Pirates AND Rift Miners, and so on until the final Boss. When you defeat it, you loop through the game again. The Bosses remain the same (in a sense of words, another variation of the Boss will be spawned on second loop) for each level, but the enemies are tougher, faster, fire more often and new, harder waves are added. Also, all the enemy factions are present from the start of Game Loop number 2.


To deepen the replayability of the game, i included several random events that will keep the players on their toes:

Warp Malfunction

I borrowed this idea from Galaga Deluxe, one of my favorite games from Amiga 500 back in the day. Between the levels, there's a small chance that your warp drive will malfunction and you may end up in null-space where you will be attacked by solo faction ships only, or get stuck in a  meteor storm that can yield extra points or end your run if you are destroyed in it. If i get enough funding, i'd really like to make a special Warp Dweller faction that would appear only during the Warp Malfunction.

Asteroid Rain, Laser Barrage, Minefield

Complete the level during some of these events for an additional score multiplier.

I'm planning more events and i'd be more than happy to hear your ideas on this one.

Perks

Depending on your style of play, at the end of each level you are presented with a choice of perks that can help you last longer, be it a faster ship, more health, additional score multiplier, better firing rate for certain types of weapons, critical hit chances for your weapons and so on.



There are over 20 weapons (for now, plan is to have around 40) divided into three groups Bullet, Missile, Energy. Each of the weapon types deals a different amount of damage based on the type of enemy armor, which is spread out into Unarmored, Armored and Shielded.

Bullet weapons deal normal damage to all armor types.
Missile weapons deal extra damage to armored enemies, but less damage to shielded enemies.
Energy weapons deal extra damage to shielded enemies, but less damage to armored enemies.

Switching between weapons takes a small amount of time so you need to have a plan prepared in split second for every incoming wave!


Rick Henderson currently features over 40 enemy ships to blast divided into 5 factions:

Pirates - Your typical cannon fodder faction, aggressive small and medium ships that make up the ship and weapon quality with numbers.



Rift Miners - Mining AI gone haywire, a lot of blades, drills and industrial grade weapons and armor.



Terran Confederacy - Highly organized military fleet with tight formations and organized attacks.



Paragon Cult - Mysterios cult utilizing an unknown source of energy in form of yellow orbs both for weapons, propulsion and cloak systems.



SunDyne Corporation - Privately owned space exploring corporation equipped with cutting-edge technology that let's no-one stand in their path.


I need your help to bring to life the sixth faction, Rokh Raiders, survivors of a long lost planet colonization gone wrong that are building their ships from space scrap. Here are some designs in the works, but i need additional funding for the artist to finish the rest of the ships.
 

 


 

A very important matter that i must admit i was quite oblivious to inclusion in the gaming until recently, but i vow to give my best for the game to be played by everyone and make it possible for people with visual impairments to compete for the highest score.

The things i've done until now:

Colorblind mode for people with Protanopia, Deuteranopia and Tritanopia.

For people that have problem with flashing lights, background screen flashes when hit are able to be turned off.

Screen shakes can be turned off if someone is bothered by those, and i'm quite sure they can make someone dizzy, at least.

Bloom levels will be adjustable to enable more crips visual presentation.

High-contrast mode for people with low vision.

I'm open to other improvements, if they are viable to do in a reasonable time-frame by a one man team.


One of the most important features of game is the music. It can make or break the game, make an average game feel outstanding or make a great game lifeless and dull. Therefore, i carefully chose the music tracks that will be included in the game. They need to properly breathe with the game, build the tension and release it when necessary, give away the sense of danger and accomplishment. Take a listen to some of the tracks that will appear in the game made by brilliant Cryocon and Mlada Fronta. I hope i will have some more cool tracks to announce soon.


Of course, the main question is how will your pledge be used, so here is a quick breakdown of the expenses involved:

Backgrounds - You noticed that the trailer only has two backgrounds. To make the game more visually pleasing i need 20 backgrounds in 5 thematic colors (red, green, blue, purple, yellow), each costing 45-70 USD per piece, which comes to roughly 1.500 USD since, besides the regular artist hours involved for making them, some additional hours will be probably needed for fixes and adjustments.

Additional gfx works - Additional graphics include finishing the Rokh Raiders sprites, background elements, bullets, special effects, explosions and works on the Galaxy Database. I approximate that 1.000 USD is needed for all of that. It might seem much, but bear in mind that's only 33 hours of more or less standard artist pay.

Translations - They cost around 0.1 USD per word for translating the basic user interface and options, but a lot more if i plan on translating the Galaxy Database. But for the basic translation into French, German, Italian, Spanish, Portuguese, Chinese and Japanese, i approximate that around 100-200 USD will be needed since the game does not have many words.

Fees and taxes - Steam Fee is 100 USD and Indiegogo takes 5%, and then there's income taxes too, which will come around to 10-20% for this amount.

Music and SFX - Music licenses are very expensive to obtain, but i am in contact with several musicians that are willing to let me use their music for an IndieGoGo and revenue cut. Still, it will come to at least 10-20% of the funding. I have been a music producer for more than 15 years so the sound effects will be handled by myself.

 




Mostly all of the planned features are already implemented. There's a lot of work on additional weapons and content which needs to be huge enough for the wave combinations to provide a feeling of randomness and feeling that each game you play is a new one.


 

  • Supporter - Your name will appear in the "Supporter" section of the credits.
  • Special Supporter - Your name will appear in the "Special Supporter" section of the credits.
  • Super Supporter - Your name will appear in the "Super Supporter" section of the credits.
  • Early Access - Early Access to the game via Steam.
  • Game - Digital Copy of the game (Steam key).
  • Soundtrack - Digital Copy of the Soundtrack for the video game
  • Galaxy Database in PDF - Database of enemies, weapons and bosses in PDF format.
  • Community Enemy Designer - Help design the enemy with other backers on the Discord channel.
  • Galaxy Database in hardcover - Database of enemies, weapons and bosses in hardcover.
  • Name on a Blimp - Get your name on a space blimp randomly appearing throughout the game.
  • Enemy Designer - Help me design your own enemy for any of the factions (bosses excluded).


Come chat about the game on Discord or follow the game's progress on Trello and Twitter! Community feedback is very important to me and essential to developing the game properly.


 

My name is Uroš Zečević and i come from Belgrade, Serbia. I'm 36 years old and i grew up playing likes of U.N. Squadron, R-Type and Uridium on C64, then Z-Type, Project X and Xenon 2 on Amiga 500, all the way to Jets 'n' Guns and Steredenn on PC. My dream is to kick off the game development career by making a game i always wanted to make - side-scrolling shoot 'em up that never ends, combining qualities of the games we all loved. Making video games is not cheap, i spent a lot of my own money until now and i need your help to make my dream come true.


Biggest risk is my dedication to quality. I regard this game as my baby and i want it to be perfect from start to finish. A gem that will remain a classic in times to come and always remain fun and challenging. Therе's hardly anything worse than to ruin a great game by tons of bugs.

I want to be completely transparent, share everything with the backers and let everyone express their opinion on features and how we can make them better, together.
story_txt:
Demo (Windows only for now) contains:22 enemy types of 2 factions11 weapons2 levels2 bossesBasic scoring systemController support
Demo does not contain:Full scoring systemRandom eventsPerksRick Henderson is an endless horizontal-scrolling shoot 'em up with infinite replayability, a true homage to 16-bit shooters wrapped in graphics we all loved. Twitch your fingers through five enemy factions and their bosses, upgrade your ship and try to survive through unpredictable space events.
Levels are generated by combining hand-crafted waves (consisting of single enemies, squadrons, waypoint enemies and their combinations), multiple bosses' variations and random events to provide unique, but satisfying experience every time you play.
The Game Loop consists of Levels. First level is composed of Pirate only waves with a Pirate boss at the end. When you defeat the Pirate Boss, you get to choose a perk from a random selection of perks which will fit your play style (better firing rate for a weapon type, score bonus, and so on) and then enter the Warp. Random events can occur while being in warp, either a Warp Malfunction, which will drop you in the middle of a Meteor Storm, single faction space (the idea is to implement a special Warp Dweller faction which can be only found in Warp, if the funding allows), or other similar hazards during the next Level.Next Level is made of Pirates AND Rift Miners, and so on until the final Boss. When you defeat it, you loop through the game again. The Bosses remain the same (in a sense of words, another variation of the Boss will be spawned on second loop) for each level, but the enemies are tougher, faster, fire more often and new, harder waves are added. Also, all the enemy factions are present from the start of Game Loop number 2.

To deepen the replayability of the game, i included several random events that will keep the players on their toes:
Warp Malfunction
I borrowed this idea from Galaga Deluxe, one of my favorite games from Amiga 500 back in the day. Between the levels, there's a small chance that your warp drive will malfunction and you may end up in null-space where you will be attacked by solo faction ships only, or get stuck in a  meteor storm that can yield extra points or end your run if you are destroyed in it. If i get enough funding, i'd really like to make a special Warp Dweller faction that would appear only during the Warp Malfunction.Asteroid Rain, Laser Barrage, MinefieldComplete the level during some of these events for an additional score multiplier.
I'm planning more events and i'd be more than happy to hear your ideas on this one.
Perks
Depending on your style of play, at the end of each level you are presented with a choice of perks that can help you last longer, be it a faster ship, more health, additional score multiplier, better firing rate for certain types of weapons, critical hit chances for your weapons and so on.
There are over 20 weapons (for now, plan is to have around 40) divided into three groups Bullet, Missile, Energy. Each of the weapon types deals a different amount of damage based on the type of enemy armor, which is spread out into Unarmored, Armored and Shielded.Bullet weapons deal normal damage to all armor types.Missile weapons deal extra damage to armored enemies, but less damage to shielded enemies.Energy weapons deal extra damage to shielded enemies, but less damage to armored enemies.Switching between weapons takes a small amount of time so you need to have a plan prepared in split second for every incoming wave!Rick Henderson currently features over 40 enemy ships to blast divided into 5 factions:Pirates - Your typical cannon fodder faction, aggressive small and medium ships that make up the ship and weapon quality with numbers.Rift Miners - Mining AI gone haywire, a lot of blades, drills and industrial grade weapons and armor.Terran Confederacy - Highly organized military fleet with tight formations and organized attacks.Paragon Cult - Mysterios cult utilizing an unknown source of energy in form of yellow orbs both for weapons, propulsion and cloak systems.SunDyne Corporation - Privately owned space exploring corporation equipped with cutting-edge technology that let's no-one stand in their path.
I need your help to bring to life the sixth faction, Rokh Raiders, survivors of a long lost planet colonization gone wrong that are building their ships from space scrap. Here are some designs in the works, but i need additional funding for the artist to finish the rest of the ships. 
  

A very important matter that i must admit i was quite oblivious to inclusion in the gaming until recently, but i vow to give my best for the game to be played by everyone and make it possible for people with visual impairments to compete for the highest score.
The things i've done until now:
Colorblind mode for people with Protanopia, Deuteranopia and Tritanopia.For people that have problem with flashing lights, background screen flashes when hit are able to be turned off.
Screen shakes can be turned off if someone is bothered by those, and i'm quite sure they can make someone dizzy, at least.
Bloom levels will be adjustable to enable more crips visual presentation.High-contrast mode for people with low vision.

I'm open to other improvements, if they are viable to do in a reasonable time-frame by a one man team.

One of the most important features of game is the music. It can make or break the game, make an average game feel outstanding or make a great game lifeless and dull. Therefore, i carefully chose the music tracks that will be included in the game. They need to properly breathe with the game, build the tension and release it when necessary, give away the sense of danger and accomplishment. Take a listen to some of the tracks that will appear in the game made by brilliant Cryocon and Mlada Fronta. I hope i will have some more cool tracks to announce soon.



Of course, the main question is how will your pledge be used, so here is a quick breakdown of the expenses involved:
Backgrounds - You noticed that the trailer only has two backgrounds. To make the game more visually pleasing i need 20 backgrounds in 5 thematic colors (red, green, blue, purple, yellow), each costing 45-70 USD per piece, which comes to roughly 1.500 USD since, besides the regular artist hours involved for making them, some additional hours will be probably needed for fixes and adjustments.Additional gfx works - Additional graphics include finishing the Rokh Raiders sprites, background elements, bullets, special effects, explosions and works on the Galaxy Database. I approximate that 1.000 USD is needed for all of that. It might seem much, but bear in mind that's only 33 hours of more or less standard artist pay.
Translations - They cost around 0.1 USD per word for translating the basic user interface and options, but a lot more if i plan on translating the Galaxy Database. But for the basic translation into French, German, Italian, Spanish, Portuguese, Chinese and Japanese, i approximate that around 100-200 USD will be needed since the game does not have many words.
Fees and taxes - Steam Fee is 100 USD and Indiegogo takes 5%, and then there's income taxes too, which will come around to 10-20% for this amount.Music and SFX - Music licenses are very expensive to obtain, but i am in contact with several musicians that are willing to let me use their music for an IndieGoGo and revenue cut. Still, it will come to at least 10-20% of the funding. I have been a music producer for more than 15 years so the sound effects will be handled by myself.
 

Mostly all of the planned features are already implemented. There's a lot of work on additional weapons and content which needs to be huge enough for the wave combinations to provide a feeling of randomness and feeling that each game you play is a new one.

 

Supporter - Your name will appear in the "Supporter" section of the credits.
Special Supporter - Your name will appear in the "Special Supporter" section of the credits.
Super Supporter - Your name will appear in the "Super Supporter" section of the credits.
Early Access - Early Access to the game via Steam.
Game - Digital Copy of the game (Steam key).
Soundtrack - Digital Copy of the Soundtrack for the video game
Galaxy Database in PDF - Database of enemies, weapons and bosses in PDF format.
Community Enemy Designer - Help design the enemy with other backers on the Discord channel.
Galaxy Database in hardcover - Database of enemies, weapons and bosses in hardcover.
Name on a Blimp - Get your name on a space blimp randomly appearing throughout the game.
Enemy Designer - Help me design your own enemy for any of the factions (bosses excluded).


Come chat about the game on Discord or follow the game's progress on Trello and Twitter! Community feedback is very important to me and essential to developing the game properly.

 
My name is Uroš Zečević and i come from Belgrade, Serbia. I'm 36 years old and i grew up playing likes of U.N. Squadron, R-Type and Uridium on C64, then Z-Type, Project X and Xenon 2 on Amiga 500, all the way to Jets 'n' Guns and Steredenn on PC. My dream is to kick off the game development career by making a game i always wanted to make - side-scrolling shoot 'em up that never ends, combining qualities of the games we all loved. Making video games is not cheap, i spent a lot of my own money until now and i need your help to make my dream come true.


Biggest risk is my dedication to quality. I regard this game as my baby and i want it to be perfect from start to finish. A gem that will remain a classic in times to come and always remain fun and challenging. Therе's hardly anything worse than to ruin a great game by tons of bugs.I want to be completely transparent, share everything with the backers and let everyone express their opinion on features and how we can make them better, together.

story:
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/InvolutionGame

YouTube: htttp://www.youtube.com/SheepCraftingRecipe

Indiegogo: http://igg.me/at/Involution

Questions:
Help us to make the game of your dreams.
Answer to our questions!
1. http://strawpoll.me/3753284
2.http://strawpoll.me/3753305
3.http://strawpoll.me/3753319
4.http://strawpoll.me/3753330
5.http://strawpoll.me/3753357




[Development Screenshots]

*(There is not just desert in the game!!!)


 The future of the movies are the games. We always knew this.

You can choose what you wanna see in that "movie". When you're watching a movie, it's so annoying when the characters are dumb, and they do stupid things. Here you can make the story. Involution gives you the possibility to choose what to say, what to do, where to go. You can even kill yourself, if you want to. But you can't really save the game. When you die, you wake up in the last place you slept and you realize that everything was a nightmare. You can save Sasha, or you can kill her. You can even try to hug a lion. Or... you can do smart things like hiding. This game is not just like a movie, it's a simulation of what would you do in those moments. If everything was real. With a lot of suspense, drama, jump scares etc.

And if your lazy, you can watch a gameplay...


We need money for Steam and for few assets.
We had to pay every software from our pocket so we can't afford another 1000 dollars. You can get the game on steam choosing a Perk and donating.
Donating now, you get the game cheaper than the regular price on Steam.


In 2018 because of the unbalanced magnetic force of the Earth core, the continents begin to move faster than is normal, and this makes them to collide. Everything happen so fast that just the people who had a bunker under the house survived. There's no more army... no more police. Everything... is wild. After the collision of North America with Africa the nature started to enter in the cities. After 12 days, our team from New York had to get out from the bunker because they had no more food. Everything was destroyed, and not just because of the earthquake. The nature eaten the city. Our team have to survive, so they need to find food. And at a moment, they start to hunt the wild animals in the city. Or that's what they thought. Actually they were hunted by lions and tigers. The humans start to die one by one. You have to be alive. You and your family. You have to keep the humans alive... you have to stop the Involution.



We will have to work a lot. The only risk is to loose people from the team. My teammates wouldn't do that, but i can't stop them from dying... (LoL, just kidding).

And, if we don't get funded... we're dead. LoL That's a big risk.


If you can't afford to fund us, you can share this page on Facebook, Twitter and Google+.

It helps a lot.

__________________________________________________________________________

Thank you for your time!

story:
Futuristic Action-Packed Space Combat Shooter

5 vs 5 Multiplayer for IOS & Android


  • Viro-Games is an Indie Video Game Development Studio Based in Mexico City.
  • Urban Artists, Programmers, Designers, Writers, Animators, Musicians and Sound Engineers have been brought together to create a unique creative team. 
  • In Association with GraffitiWorld (Art-Design) & R3GMA (Sound-Music)
  • Help us ACHIEVE OUR DREAM of making the most advanced Mobile Space Game to date. Support our campaign!

Developing STELLAR has been a work of love and learning for our team. Our time, brain-power (and money) has gone into creating the first building-block of what we hope to develop into a wide-reaching gaming experience, across multiple platforms, bringing innovative design and fun new experiences to the Space Shooter genre.

  • We are in the last stages of development 
  • Target: mid-September. 
  • 4 Spaceship Manufacturers. 
  • Over 50 unique ship models. 
  • 60+ weapons with variable attributes. 
  • Upgrade your Spaceships at the Hangar - Tune them up to your liking. 
  • 5 VS 5 Multiplayer Battles. Create a Squadron and play with your friends. 
  • League System - Get ranked only with adversaries worth fighting. 
  • Leaderboards & Achievements.
  • 5 Game-play modes TDM, CTF, FFA, DTB and RC*
  • Energy Weapons (Lasers - Plasma Cannons) & Classic Weapons (Machine Gun - Missiles) 
  • SPACE ROBOTS!!
  • 3D Radar - Heat Seeking Weapons - Predictive Missiles. 
  • Immersive and Futuristic HUD System & UI.
  • 10 fully-detailed arenas:  Planets, Galaxies, Star Systems, Local Stars, Nebulas, Cosmic particles, Stellar Dust.   

Alpha Rigel - Planet Teaser


Creating STELLAR has been the work of over a dozen artists, programmers, engineers... and the administrators who have helped us keep it all together. 

Now entering the Final Stages of production, STELLAR requires the full-time commitment of a core development team. Our campaign will allow us to make a final push with  6 graphic artists, 4 programmers, 3 sound technicians and 2 writers to bring the full potential of the game to life. Up to 60% of funding raised will be divided among this team to repay their hard work to this point.  

The campaign, if fully successful, will also contribute to expanding ViroGames' infrastructure and technology, which will help us in the long-term development of STELLAR and future games.

Securing licensing, registering the several unique designs, logos and characters, and other legal protections for STELLAR will involve mounting legal and registration fees. Campaign funds will seek to cover these fees.


THE PERKS

  • All Perk Packs include $25 USD Space Crystals + 1 Month Premium Account.
  • "Unique Name Tag" - Register your User "Name Tag" before the game goes live.
  • "IGG - X Fighter" - Series only available for Indiegogo contributors. 
  • "IGG SPACE-BOT" - A Bad-Ass Space Robot to fight your enemies. 
  • "Deep Space Black Ops" Squadron - 5 "DSBO" Special Fighter.
  • "Unique Space Ship" - Get your one of a kind Space Ship, Unique space ship designed specially for you.
  • "Dream Space Ship" Have you ever dreamed about your own Space Ship. Let our 3D design team take your idea and turn it into reality. Send us your sketches and you will be flying your own Space Ship by launch day.
  • We will have updates every week for our supporters, Showing them our progress as Character design, artwork and other goodies are developed as we approach our September launch date.

- IGG - X Fighter Chasis - 

The Impact

STELLAR is the creation of a group of friends and co-workers who weren't originally  connected to the world of Video Game development. We are primarily artists, engineers, programers and writers working in our own, particular careers. But we are also creators... and players.  Players obsessed with making an experience that is instantly enjoyable, adaptable and that will continue to evolve in new and exciting ways as more and more creative influences are added to our project.

  • STELLAR is driven primarily by two factors: A smooth and intuitive flight experience, and  some of the most visually stunning settings and in-game artwork ever seen in mobile platforms.
  • Developed in association with Graffitiworld and R3GMA, two rising Art and Media companies with access to world-class artists and top designers, musicians and engineers.

Our Team

Eutimio Garcia N. (Project Manager) 

Audio Engineer & Programmer - CEO and Co-Founder of Viro Games. STELLAR project manager & main programmer. 

Jan Roth K. (Story/QA)

MA Political Theory - Co-Founder of Viro Games.  Story & Script Writer.

Roberto Gutierrez O. aka N3O (Lead Artist)

Graphic Designer & Know Street Artist   Stellar Lead Artist and UI Designer. 

Daniel Sierra M. (Cinematics) 

Systems Engineer -  Cinematics director 

Risks & Challenges

For the past 10 months we have worked tirelessly in bringing STELLAR to life. Much remains in development - primarily the grunt work of modelling and design, as well as crafting and streamlining the Multiplayer experience with properly rendered graphics and Sound sync. 

We are already in the last stages of development. We are pushing this Indiegogo campaign to polish the game and bring a AAA experience for all players. However, a gruelling testing-period awaits, to ensure a high-quality product.

Whether this campaign is successful or not, a form STELLAR will be released on early Q3 2015 on the App Store and Play Store. We are fully committed to this project. However, the time and investment required for the final push (as per our current development plan) means that our Full Vision for the game would have to wait. 

Other Ways To Help Stellar

  • Can't contribute to this project. No worries help us get the word out. 
  • Social Media can Create or Break a Project. - Share this campaign with your friends and help us Create STELLAR. 
  • For more info about STELLAR go to www.stellar-game.com

story:
An intro before beginning

Hi, IndieGoGo. In this short section I'd just like to say that the next lines talks about the basis of the calculation in detail, with mathematical operations (they are so easy don't worry ;) and the schedule.

The video conteins what about this proyect and why I want to do it. I highly recommend you that you see it because this kind of things feel more real and closer on image than through words.

I've planned like this because, in my opinion, if I were a backer, I'd like to know for sure where I'm investing my money so I have created a brief document but contains all you need to know economically, while the rest of things I put in the video since they are more entertaining.

If you want to know more about the videogame, please check this link:

https://www.telltalegames.com/

Agreements:

Dubbers: http://adoma.es/convenio/

Sound engineer: http://cice.es/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/convenio-colectio-tabla-salarial-produccion-audiovisual-2014.pdf


THIS DESCRIPTION IS TRASLATED INTO THE SPANISH TOO (it's lower down).


Una introducción antes de empezar

Hola, IndieGoGO. En esta breve sección me gustaría comentar que todo lo que viene a continuación trata sobre el cálculo que he llevado a cabo detalladamente, con operaciones matemáticas (son muy fáciles, tranquilos ;) y el calendario.

El video contiene sobre qué trata el proyecto y por qué quiero hacerlo. Os recomiendo enormemente que veáis el video porque esta clase de temas se aprecian más cercanas y sinceras a través de la imagen que de las palabras.

Lo he planteado así porque, en mi opinión, si yo fuera promotor, me gustaría saber dónde invierto mi dinero así que he creado un breve documento pero que contiene todo lo que necesitas saber en términos económicos, mientras que el resto de las cosas las puse en el video ya que son más entretenidas.

Si quieres saber más acerca del videojuego, pincha aquí, por favor:

https://www.telltalegames.com/

Convenios:

Dobladores: http://adoma.es/convenio/

Técnico de sonido: http://cice.es/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/conve...


ESTA DESCRIPCIÓN ESTÁ TRADUCIDA AL ESPAÑOL TAMBIÉN (se encuentra más abajo).


  

ENGLISH


TIMETABLE 


CASTING ---> From beginning of June until July 17th (I have to search on Internet to find new talents, that's why it lasts so much).

RECORDING ---> From July 20th until mid-September.

POST-PRODUCTION AND TESTING ---> From mid-September until end of October.


GETTING TO THE POINT 

       

     TOTAL ACTORS = 34865$


SCHEDULE 

     TOTAL DAYS = 42 DAYS


FINAL BUDGET

     

        TOTAL = 54424,14$


BASES OF THE CALCULATION 

So, if you have taken a look to those numbers, you will ask yourself how I have got them. Stay with me a little bit more if you want to know it.

ACTORS

Based on the dubber agreement (salary annexure is at the end) from Madrid, Spain, it forced me to work out the number of half-hours that the dubbers are going to work since the first half hour or fragment (this is the case  the recording session finish without completing the half hour) it costs 82.88 $, while the following half-hours or fragments cost 49.72 $.

That’s why I set an average of 7 minutes per sentence (it's an approximate duration in which I take into account possible setbacks that might arise in the work such as the actor's skills or if their way to act weren't in line with the director’s view). This means that the amount of money requested is bigger than it actually is.

Considering that and following the dubber's agreement, one working day is equal to 6 and a half hours (400 minutes) so I estimated how many sentences could be recorded approximately in that time:

                            

Thus, I jumped to the next inference and I conclude that:

           

Therefore, I can work out with all this data how many recording days I need for each character. Supposing Lee, the reckoning would be like this:

                                     

In this way, I can get how many days I need for each character, which allows me to create an approximate planning.

On the other hand, I have to work out how much money I will spend. With all the previous data, I can know how many half-hours there are in the number of working days of each character (let us remember that spanish dubbers are paid each half hour that they are recording). If we deduce that:

       

 Still supposing Lee, our result is:

                                       

Following the agreement guidelines, since you call the actor in, is more expensive (82.88 $). Therefore, as the actor is going to be called 25 times as he has 25 recording days, it should be substracted 25 half-hours from the total (which is 325 half-hours) in order to obtain how much would cost the total call price:

                                         

Once I got how much money I must pay him for the call, now I have to work out how much money he will receive for the following half normal hours (which cost 49.72 $). In this way, we start by the above-mentioned substraction:

                                          

 Obviously, this is insane and happens for two reasons:

  • It would be significantly reduced if I knew for a fact how much time would be necessary to record each sentence.
  • Usually, dubbing companies have actors with an open-ended contract and they choose them as main characters in order to cut costs.

That’s why I have decided to reduce the main character’s salary multiplying by 2 with the higher salary (which is 3397 $), obtaining 6443 $ approximately.


SOUND ENGINEER

In relation to the sound engineer, I have worked out his salary through the audiovisuals agreement of 2014 (I couldn’t find the agreement of this year and it appears at the end) from Spain. This post receives 322.17 $ per week. Supposing that a week, in this case, is equal to 7 days, I have to ignore Saturdays and Sundays since I will just record on weekdays. For that, first of all I have calculated how much money he actually receive per day:

                                                 

If this is the case, I have to substract Saturday and Sunday’s salary from which he receive in a week. Therefore:

                                   

Finally, based on the planning, 42 recording days are month and a half approximately.As we are not including weekends, it would last to 2 months (8 weeks). In this way, we obtain the salary of the sound engineer:

                                                        

THE REST

In relation to the rest of things, the casting costs and tester costs are indicative (although the price of casting appears in the agreement dubber, which is 38.68 $), while the rental recording studio, according to my searching, is usually costs between 161 to 215 $ per day (if you multiply by the 42 days, the price is about 7517 $).

The miscellaneous expenses is equal to the fees charged.

The director salary is void since I am the director and my sole purpose with this proyect is acquire professional maturity and bring myself a satisfactory experience, in addition to use that as a possible Bacherol’s tesis for college. Non-profit-making for me. 

Obviously, all of this numbers can vary a lot because if one lasted so much in dubbing a videogame, it would be crazy. I have worked all out based on higher numbers than they actually are since, in contrary way, I could risk not make payments. In case of having money left over, I commit myself to create another proyect of a similar nature.

I hope I’m making myself crystal clear.


                                                                           

                     ESPAÑOL


CALENDARIO DE TRABAJO 


CASTING ---> De principios de Junio hasta el 17 de Julio (la duración es tan larga porque necesito tiempo para buscar nuevos talentos en Internet).

GRABACIÓN ---> Del 20 de Junio hasta mediados de Septiembre.

POST-PRODUCCIÓN ---> Desde mediados de Septiembre hasta finales de Octubre.


¡AL GRANO! 

TOTAL ACTORES = 32468,86 €


PLANIFICACIÓN 

        TOTAL DÍAS = 42 DÍAS


PRESUPUESTO FINAL

TOTAL = 50683,26 €


BASES DEL CÁLCULO 

Si has echado un vistazo a esos números, te preguntarás de dónde me los he sacado. Pues quédate conmigo si lo quieres saber.

ACTORES

Basándome en el convenio de dobladores (el anexo salarial se encuentra al final) de Madrid, España, éste me obligaba a calcular el número de medias horas de los que dispongo para realizar el doblaje, ya que la primera media hora o fracción (es decir, si la sesión finaliza sin llegar a completar la media hora) equivale a 77,18 €, y las siguientes medias horas o fracciones equivalen a 46,30 €.

Por ello, establecí una media de 7 minutos por frase (una duración aproximada teniendo en cuenta posibles contratiempos que pudieran surgir tales como las habilidades del actor o que su forma de interpretar no fuera la requerida por el director), lo que significa que la cantidad de dinero solicitada es mayor de lo que en realidad es.

Teniendo en cuenta que, según el convenio de dobladores, una jornada equivale a 6 horas y media (que son 400 minutos), calculé cuántas frases más o menos se podrían locutar en ese tiempo. Es decir: 

                                         

 De esta forma, pasé a la siguiente deducción y concluí que:

                          

Por tanto, con esto puedo calcular cuántas jornadas de grabación necesito para cada personaje. En el caso de Lee, quedaría así:

                                                 

De esta manera, consigo averiguar cuántos días necesito para cada personaje lo que me permite crear una planificación aproximada.

Por otra parte, tengo que calcular cuánto dinero me voy a gastar. Con todo lo obtenido anteriormente, puedo saber cuántas medias horas hay en el número de jornadas de cada personaje (recordemos que a los actores de voz se les paga cada media hora que estén grabando). Si deducimos que:

                       

Siguiendo con el ejemplo de Lee, obtenemos que:

                                                

Siguiendo las pautas del convenio, la primera media hora se cobra más cara por convocar al actor. Por tanto, como el actor va a ser convocado 25 veces por tener 25 jornadas de grabación, a las 325 medias horas habría que restarle 25, para obtener cuanto sería la cuota de convocatoria, cuyo precio era 77,18 €:

                                         

Una vez sacado cuánto le tengo que pagar por convocatoria, ahora debo calcular cuánto le correspondería por las siguientes medias horas normales (que se pagan por 46,30 €). Así, comenzamos por la resta anteriormente mencionada:

                                         

 Evidentemente, esto es una burrada y ocurre por dos motivos:

  • Esto se reduciría notablemente si supiera a ciencia cierta cuánto se duraría en grabar cada frase.
  • Normalmente las empresas de doblaje tienen a actores con contrato indefinido y los eligen a ellos como protagonistas por lo que se abaratan los costes.

Por ello, he decidido rebajar el sueldo del protagonista multiplicándolo x2 con respecto al sueldo más alto (3163,9 €), saliendo aproximadamente 6000 €.


TÉCNICO DE SONIDO

Respecto al técnico de sonido, he obtenido su sueldo a través del convenio de audiovisuales de 2014 (ya que el de este año me ha sido imposible encontrarlo) de España. Este puesto tiene un sueldo de 300,02 € a la semana. Suponiendo que la semana, en este caso, equivale a 7 días, yo tengo que ignorar sábados y domingos ya que solo grabaré entre semana. Para ello, primeramente he calculado a cuánto toca cada día:

                                                             

Si esto es así, debo restar sábado y domingo a lo que gana a la semana. Por tanto:

                                            

Finalmente, basándonos en el planning, 42 días de grabación son 1 mes y medio aproximadamente, pero como no estamos utilizando los fines de semana, se nos quedaría en 2 meses (8 semanas). Así, obtenemos el sueldo del técnico de mesa:

                                                          

EL RESTO

Respecto al resto de cosas, los gastos de casting y testeadores son orientativos (aunque el precio del casting, 36,02 €, aparece en el convenio de dobladores), mientras que el alquiler de la sala, según mis investigaciones, suelen rondar los 150 o 200 € por día (si se multiplica por los 42 días rondan los 7000€).

Los gastos varios equivalen a las tarifas que se cobran.

El precio del director es nulo ya que, siendo yo el director, mi único objetivo con este proyecto es adquirir madurez profesional y llevarme una experiencia satisfactoria, además de utilizarlo como posible estudio de Trabajo de Fin de Grado para la universidad, sin ningún fin lucrativo para mi persona.

Evidentemente, todo esto puede variar mucho porque si se durara tanto en doblar un juego sería una locura. Yo he calculado a la alta ya que, de modo contrario, podría arriesgarme a no cumplir con los pagos. En caso de que sobre dinero, me comprometo a crear otro proyecto de índole parecida.

Espero que les haya quedado todo muy claro.


RISKS AND CHALLENGE / RIESGOS Y DESAFÍOS

ENGLISH

The only clear risk that comes to my mind is (I need the appoval of the videogame company as the game is not mine, as you know, so I can  continue with the proyect and the only way to get his attention was through this web page, since I'm a nobody compared to them.

If I could reach the goal, I'll move heaven, earth and space to get the neccesary rights . I would do anything I could to carry out the proyect.

If I couldn't get them, I would resolve to do a proyect of a similar nature or to create an indie videogame that I have in mind with some people I know.

SPANISH

El único riesgo claro que me viene a la mente es que, como ya sabrán, este juego pertenece a una compañía, por lo que necesito su visto bueno para continuar con el proyecto pero la única manera que tenía de llamarles la atención era a través de esta plataforma, ya que yo solo era un don nadie.

Si consiguiera llegar a la meta, movería tierra, mar y cielo para conseguir los derechos necesarios. Haría lo que fuera por llevar adelante el proyecto.

En caso de no conseguirlo, me dispondría a hacer un proyecto de índole parecida o a crear un videojuego indie que tengo en mente con unos conocidos.


WHO AM I? / ¿QUIÉN SOY?

ENGLISH

Hey, what's up? My name is Ángel Molina and I'm 20 years old. I love to do Motion Graphics, to dub and to edit sound and image too. I study Audiovisual Communication in Spain so cinema is one of my greatest passions and I'm always ready to learn more about photography, camera shooting and visual techniques.

For the moment, I haven't done any professional work yet but I hope this web page and his funders can give me a challenge.

SPANISH
Hola, ¿qué hay? Mi nombre es Ángel Molina y tengo 20 años. Me encanta componer Motion Graphics, doblar y editar sonido e imagen. Estudio Comunicación Audiovisual en España así que el cine es una de mis grandes pasiones y siempre estoy dispuesto a aprender más sobre fotografía, tiros de cámara y técnicas visuales.
Por el momento, todavía no he hecho nada profesional pero espero que esta página y sus financiadores puedan conseguirme un reto.

The video conteins what about this proyect and why I want to do it. I highly recommend you that you see it because this kind of things feel more real and closer on image than through words.
I've planned like this because, in my opinion, if I were a backer, I'd like to know for sure where I'm investing my money so I have created a brief document but contains all you need to know economically, while the rest of things I put in the video since they are more entertaining.

Estudio Comunicación Audiovisual en España así que el cine es una de mis grandes pasiones y siempre estoy dispuesto a aprender más sobre fotografía, tiros de cámara y técnicas visuales.
Por el momento, todavía no he hecho nada profesional pero espero que esta página y sus financiadores puedan conseguirme un reto.

story:
"Dice of Destiny" is an extraordinary, intense and fun board game for 2 to 6 players. The race between the players goes on rough terrain with many and various obstacles. The goal of every player is to collect and keep big fortune and finish the race before anyone else. Roll The Dicе of Destiny to see what expects you in the next throwing.
                                                       

The game is ready for manufacturing. Without your help I would not be able to succeed. Please support the campaign - you can make it come true. All the fundings are aimed towards production and product delivery, so the fun could start.

The game in its core is a fun race between you and the other players - each using unique characters. The race is going on incredible diverse terrain with many obstacles. Among them are a waterfall that you can fall in, an angry bees, quicksands that you can stuck and many others.

Start your adventure on the map, collect gold and use your special skills on the path to victory. 

There are six characters and at the beginning of the game each player can choose one of them. The characters have special skills that affect the gameplay - increase pickpocketed gold, allows you to push other players back or just helps you to run faster.

Choose the unique character, that best suits your strategy in game.



Throwing the Dice of Destiny, which is 12D with different special symbol on every side, affects the other dice values and defines which and how many of them will be thrown. The special symbols on the Dice of Destiny can give useful opportunities for the player. Additionally there are 6D dices - a wooden ones that are for moving and a golden ones for earning gold.

No one can escape their destiny. See what the Dice of Destiny has got for you.

                                                           

Gold is needed to win the race. Roll the golden dice.

The road is long and tough, how fast can you go on the path to victory? Only the wooden dice will decide.

 


The victory has its price - save your gold so you can pay it

and win the “Dice of Destiny”!



The combination of unique characters, the result from the Dice of Destiny and the variety of the map obstacles makes the game extremely fun for young and not that young players.


         



   





   



 

 There are many ways to help this campaign. Don’t hesitate to talk about this project to people around you and to share it on social networks.  If you follow blogs, celebrities or some kind of fans channel, ask them to take a look and to talk about the project. This would really be a great help!

story:
Xplode is a highly strategic and ultra Xplosive card game. If you like to Xplode a player or DUMP your enemy then this is the game for you. Players take turn picking a card from the deck until you get bombed. Trust me when I say that the bomb is more powerful than the Tsar Bomba.

The deck also contains cards that will help you bomb a player or your enemy in the game. You can even save your self from the bomb using the shield made using reinforced titanium metal.

The game is easy to play and child friendly. Don't get me wrong here. The game is easy to play but not easy to win. The game gets intensified as you proceed. Every time you draw a card you increase the chances of drawing the bomb or getting yourself Xploded by an opponent.

Please back the project so that you get to Xplode your friends and help this game reach every one.

Thank you - 

   Armaan + My brains


Rule #1 : Each player takes turn in drawing a card until he gets bombed.                                                                        

If you are bombed you get Xploded and you are out of the game.


Rule #2 : You can save yourself if you have the SHIELD.

                                               

The shield can stop any attack from reaching you including the special powers included in the Premium pack. 
(It's a secret, you get to know when you get the pack)

Rule #3 : The pack includes special cards such as the KICK and the DUMP card.

                                    

The KICK card allows you to Xplode the next player and with the DUMP card 
(My favorite)  you can Xplode any player in the game.      

Rule #4 : You get another card with which you can pass onto the next player 
                   (1 secret revealed)



The card is not so huge, but this is the card that you will most frequently see in the deck. For blue haters do not worry, you will get four different type of the NEXT cards and I pray that your color comes in that.

Rule #5 : You also get other powers such as SKIP and the REVERSE card.

Rule #6 : Enjoy the game!




 






The Story:

Initially the idea came up to me while I was studying for my Engineering semester exam. I started working on the same day and came up with an initial prototype that was too boring. There were many iterations of the game and after six months I have reached to the existing game. I then tested it's worthiness by passing it on to my friends and they seemed to like it and that is when I decided that the everyone should enjoy Xploding!

The process of designing the game was very hectic for me as i had to exams coming up alongside. The project has taken a lot of thinking and I am sure that each one of you will enjoy it a lot!

Please spread the word about the campaign. The one who gets the most amount of likes or re-tweets will get free Xplode deck from me! Make sure to tag my name in your post.

Facebook

Twitter

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
