The Art:





All artworks in game are done by the following team members of InnoMen Productions:
Jason Cheng



Jason Cheng is the current lead artist, web developer, and general manager of the Sierra Ops project for team InnoMen Productions. He's formerly a professional web developer who mainly worked for companies at Sydney, Australia such as Dotty Style Creative and Weaving Weblets. He then switched careers as a full time game artist and developer after being inspired by IGDA game jams. He was taught by the former lead artist, gtd-carthage,the fundamentals to continue the game artworks by himself. He's now tasked to create all future background artworks, including ship designs, weapons, and stage design elements like space debris and structures found in game.
Jester Paul Go



Jester Paul Go is the UI designer of the team. He designed the icons, buttons, and the other user interface elements, with the corresponding animations. His 3 years of flash development and animation experience combined with inspirations acquired from sci-fi interests, have been handy to come up with hi-tech looking game interfaces that will fit the theme and setting of Sierra Ops.
Ken Ian Laurel


"Hi, I'm Ken Ian Laurel,and I've been an artist since the first game, Operation SD: Space Defense. The improvement of the team is really inspiring, and it made me design the characters the way they are right now and is a huge step up from my previous artworks. I'm now the lead character designer for Sierra Ops and has been doing my best to make the characters look good." He owns the groups  "BestDrawings" at DeviantArt, and has been actively helping out the artist community.

"It is hard to complete a game, we have been there, done that."

After completing Operation SD: Space Defense together with several heated debates/ arguments/ tears/ sweat/ beers, we were very happy by the end. But the game didn't really did well to the public as it has a lot of flaws. It was frustrating, we failed to sell the game higher than 200 units, making our revenue for the whole year 2012 and 2013 just around 400$-ish and did not even made it to the distributor's 500$ monthly cut.
After a few months, we decided to create Sierra Ops - an idealization of Operation SD: Space Defense. At first, we were really skeptical and wanted to jump straight to real-time strategy instead. But Jason decided to rebuild Operation SD instead to its "ideal" form and the main inspiration was gtd-carthage's redesign of the Sierra. 
Since we knew how the original game works, we just had to add more depth to it such as including consequence based storyline development, the overworld system, as well as the further customizations to Sierra's parts and weapons - It was a very straightforward development.
Along the way, we have met a lot of professional voice actors/actresses who are very supportive to the indie scene. We have learned a lot in this project, and everyone really did their best to step up their game for Sierra Ops compared to how OSD was being made.
The biggest risk is that, if we can't reach the funding goal, a few members of the team might need to work on a full time job and we have to cut down the features that should be in game just for the sake of releasing it earlier.
In addition, any unforeseen circumstances may happen, this is life after all, but we do think we are capable of completing Sierra Ops, and make it one of the memorable games of the decade. 
We are developers inspired by various titles from Eastern and Western games/novels such as Muv Luv Alternative, Gundam series, Mass Effect, Master of Orion, Freespace, GSB and many other non Sci-Fi novels from Type Moon, R07, Minori and more. 
We are also a team of aspiring directors since we were young (we're 25+ now) - we have been joining at several video making contests and we basically know how to execute something, no matter how cliche it is very well. You may take the story trailer as our primary example.

The challenge we expect from making Sierra Ops is that, since we're stepping up our methods of development, everyone has to get used to the following:
1. New software, such as the Unity game engine and its extensions we've bought recently, because OSD was created from XNA alone and was not Mac/Linux compatible.
2. As for the creative department, the composer has to do advanced mixing of the music, and the CG artists must be capable of delivering a polished style consistently and should appeal the mainstream audience. All of our content are original and we did not took assets from royalty free aside from the planet textures (that were modified severely anyway).
We are not asking for your support to start the game development, but we are requesting your aid to make the game a lot better to play with the added features. 
Every amount we receive from you will help us release the game faster and will make the game a lot more possible to be released this year with the desired and expanded features. Missed the Indiegogo campaign? You can still help us through the Alderon Games Store!

https://alderongames.com/store/path-of-titans

 

Path of Titans will feature an extensive environment you must survive in. Find water, forage for edible plants, and hunt prey in order to avoid death. But that’s just the beginning. Partake in realistic, environment driven quests in order to gain points to put towards improving your character and permanently unlocking skins or new dinosaurs.

Path of Titans will be packed with features to allow for plenty of replayability and content for hundreds of hours of play time. Some of the main features include:

  • Permanent characters with in-depth skin and trait customization
  • A complex questing system.
  • Group and Guild systems that allow for pack hunting and herd migration, with servers supporting up to 200 concurrent players.
  • Lush environment filled with AI dinosaurs and smaller prehistoric creatures
  • Swimming, diving, and fishing in both lakes and rivers.
  • Cross platform functionality, play the game from your PC with your friends on mobile and vice versa.
  • Powerful modding tools with extensive documentation, and a backend allowing modders to deliver their content to other players.

 

Game Mechanic Videos

 

The dinosaurs you will find in Path of Titans have been selected for variety in aesthetics, physical traits, and playstyles. From the small Camptosaurus to the giant Daspletosaurus, a wide variety of playstyles will be available. All our dinosaurs aim for scientific accuracy, with feathered species and semi-aquatic species being fully present in-game.

Our 10 dinosaurs have been selected from two time periods and geological formations: the Morrison Formation from the Jurassic Period, and the Dinosaur Park Formation from the Cretaceous Period. In the future we plan on adding dinosaurs from the Elrhaz Formation, with one dinosaur already in-game.

 

Community is important to any game, and the Path of Titans team recognizes the amount of passion and talent dinosaur enthusiasts have. Powerful modding tools will be a staple in Path of Titans and will always be free for anyone to download and use. With extensive documentation and help to guide modders, anyone can download the dev kit and begin creating.

Our already developed mod deployment backend will allow modders to upload their content directly to our servers to be automatically patched with each new update. Dozens of mods have already been created by members of our community. A few are listed below!

Supported Platforms

Path of Titans will be available for multiple platforms complete with cross-platform play, with a future ideal goal to bring it to consoles at a later date. Path of Titans will be distributed through our own Alderon Games launcher, from which you will be able to download mods, patches, and engage with the community. This game will not be available through Steam.

  • Windows (7, 8.1, and 10)
  • MacOS (Mojave and later)
  • Linux (Tested on Ubuntu / Debian Based OS)
  • Android (Must support Vulkan)
  • iOS (iOS12 and higher, and iPhone 6S or higher)

For server owners:
Windows, Linux, and Mac based servers will be compatible with Path of Titans. Listen servers can also be hosted on all supported platforms.

Our Launcher

Path of Titans will be downloadable and playable through our launcher. Through our launcher you will be able to easily keep up to date with news, updates, and patches. For more information please check out our blog post here. If you would like to download our launcher for free, please visit https://alderongames.com and create an account. Once you log in, you will be able to download our launcher and install it on your device. While you cannot yet play the game, you can still check out news and information about the game through the launcher!

Supported Languages

We recognize that dinosaur enthusiasts come from around the world, so we plan to support 27 different languages from all corners of the globe. All supported languages are listed below.

 

Budget Breakdown

By utilizing crowdfunding we will be able to remain independent and develop the game as we and the community see fit instead of having to partner with a publisher. Publishing agreements can often come with pressure to change the creative direction of the game or to implement more predatory revenue models such as loot boxes or pay-to-win microtransactions.

Whether or not Path of Titans meets our crowdfunding goal, the game will be released at some point in the future. We will be self-funding the project with $36 000 AUD (Approx. $25 200 USD) in order to ensure work on the game can continue. This money will go towards paying for rent, electricity, development server costs, and generally allowing us to sustain our work environment for the core development team. We are committed to bringing this game to life and won’t stop until it’s been completed. However, without the money raised through crowdfunding the release date of the game will have to be pushed further back, as our team members will have to work part-time on the project in order to make their own ends meet.

Everything raised during our crowdfunding campaign will be put directly towards further development of Path of Titans. The exact place these funds will go towards are outlined below.

  • Indiegogo Platform Fees - $1800 AUD (Approx. $1250 USD)
    Indiegogo takes a flat 5% for all funds raised, which amounts to $1 800 AUD.
  • Processing Fees - $1080 AUD (Approx. $750 USD)
    Payment processing and currency conversion will take about 3% of all funds raised, which will amount to approximately $1 080 AUD.
  • Taxes - $9940 AUD (Approx. $6980 USD)
    Australian law requires 30% tax paid on all funds earned after processing fees and platform fees, which amounts to approximately $9 940 AUD.
  • 2D Art and Texture Work - $7100 AUD (Approx. $5000 USD)
    The very high amount of 2D and Texture work needed will require outsourcing to our freelance artists in order to meet our targeted release date.
  • Development Kits and Tools - $5700 AUD (Approx. $4000 USD)
    Developing for consoles and specific devices require expensive development kits and development tools that we currently cannot afford on our own. This will go directly towards paying for these and for any platform-related fees.
  • Backend Development - $7100 AUD (Approx. $5000 USD)
    These funds will go towards further developing our distribution methods, launcher, game patching tools, mod deployment backend, and modding tools.
  • Bandwidth and Download Costs - $3300 AUD (Approx. $2300 USD)
    Because we are hosting our own servers and distribution platform we will have to bear all the costs of distribution. This means all game downloads, mod downloads and server fees will have to be paid for, and this is what these funds will go towards.

 

Stretch Goals

If we manage to meet our crowdfunding goal, all further money raised will be put towards our stretch goals. These goals represent content, features, mechanics, and game modes that we believe are strong additions to Path of Titans but are currently not within the scope of our budget. Help us get there faster by backing today! All stretch goals will be added after the release of the initial base game and will be available to all players at no additional cost.

As more money is raised, the next tiers will be revealed! Check back and see what new goals become unlocked as crowdfunding continues.

Play the Game Early

As a reward for backing at our Pre-release Access tier, backers will have access to the game during a specified Pre-Release window. During this time you will have a preview of the full game and will be able to give us feedback to help shape the final release.

Pre-Release Access is expected to begin during December 2019, and will allow backers who have purchased a $30 or higher perk to download and play the game with other players who also have access to the pre-release. Pre-Release Access will be for PC only (Windows, Linux, and Mac)

As a Pre-Release version of the game, it will not be fully feature complete and may contains bugs or other problems that could hinder gameplay. More information about the exact Pre-Release date will become available as we get closer to the estimated date, and we will be posting news about it as development continues.

By backing the game early, you can gain access to exclusive rewards! Your support will allow us to continue our quick development pace and allow us to bring the game to you sooner! Backer rewards will be delivered upon official launch of the game, excluding Pre-Release Access, which will be delivered when the Pre-Release window is opened.

Note that skin rewards, OST and Artbook rewards, and custom dinosaur rewards will be delivered to your account across all platforms (present and future), as we have a unified login and database system that works across all devices.

 

    Thank you!

Thank you for your support! Your name will be listed in the in-game credits screen as a token of our appreciation.

 

    Add 1 Exclusive Backer Skin

Interested in only one or two backer skins? Grab one for a specific dinosaur with this perk! You will receive a code for the skin that you will enter into the Alderon Games Launcher in order to unlock the skin in-game. You can choose the species upon selecting the perk.

NOTE: You must own a copy of the game in order to use this skin (game is not included with this perk).

Click the dinosaur names below to view a large image of each backer skin available. You will receive all 3 pattern variations displayed per species.

Carnivores:

  • Allosaurus
  • Ceratosaurus
  • Daspletosaurus
  • Latenivenatrix
  • Suchomimus

Herbivores:

  • Stegosaurus
  • Camptosaurus
  • Lambeosaurus
  • Styracosaurus
  • Struthiomimus

    One Copy of the Game

Own a copy of Path of Titans. This will include the full game for PC (Windows, Mac, Linux), which will be tied to your Alderon Games account. To play the game, you will have to download the Alderon Games launcher which is a portal to the community and will allow you to play with friends, download mods, and discuss the game through our forums.

 

    Pre-Release Access + 1 Backer Skin

Grab a bundle that comes with 1 copy of Path of Titans for PC (Windows, Mac, Linux), 1 backer skin of your choice, and early access to the game before it is released.

This will include the full game at launch, which will be tied to your Alderon Games account. To play the game, you will have to download the Alderon Games launcher which is a portal to the community and will allow you to play with friends, download mods, and discuss the game through our forums.

Pre-Release Access is expected to begin closer to release, and will allow owners of this perk to download and play the game with other players who also have access to the pre-release. This is an early version of the game, and may not have all features fully complete and may contain bugs or other problems. More information about the exact Pre-Release date will become available as we get closer to the estimated date, and we will be posting news about it as development continues.

   

    Digital Soundtrack

Path of Titans will feature a full original soundtrack, pulling inspiration from tribalistic and ambient themes. Environmental sounds will be the driving force behind setting the tone for each time of day as well as accenting combat, interactions, and natural events. By helping back the project, you can choose to receive a copy of the full soundtrack in high quality audio formats.

Click the video below to hear sample clips of the Path of Titans soundtrack!

 

    Digital Art Book

This art book will contain exclusive sketches, concepts, and work-in-progress images of the dinosaurs, prehistoric creatures, environment, and technical art that went into creating the game. At 100+ pages long, this book will give insight into the design and game dev process that goes into creating video game characters and environments.

A mock up of 4 pages of the art book can be seen below (layout is subject to change)!

   

    All 10 Exclusive Backer Skins

Unlock all 10 skins exclusive to this crowdfunding event! This includes 1 copy of Path of Titans for PC (Windows, Mac, Linux) and 1 skin for each species of dinosaur included in the base game (Allosaurus, Ceratosaurus, Camptosaurus, Stegosaurus, Daspletosaurus, Latenivenatrix, Lambeosaurus, Struthiomimus, Styracosaurus, and Suchomimus). The three sub-species of each dinosaur will all be able to use the skin associated with them. These skins will be visible on both official and unofficial servers.

Full size images of all skins are linked in the Backer Skin section above.

You will each also be thanked with your names in the credits, and you will also receive 4 pre-release access codes that you can give to your friends in order to participate in the pre-release access window!

Pre-Release Access is expected to begin closer to release, and will allow owners of this perk to download and play the game with other players who also have access to the pre-release. This is an early version of the game, and may not have all features fully complete and may contain bugs or other problems. More information about the exact Pre-Release date will become available as we get closer to the estimated date, and we will be posting news about it as development continues.

 

Group Game 4 Pack + 4 Skins

Whether you want to complete quests as a party or simply explore the prehistoric world together, you can save 20% in this bundle! Select 1 exclusive backer skin for yourself and 1 for each of your friends. Each individual skin will be tied to each players account.

Full size images of all backer skins are linked in the Backer Skin section above.

You will also receive 4 pre-release access codes that you can give to your friends in order to participate in the pre-release access window!

Pre-Release Access is expected to begin closer to release, and will allow owners of this perk to download and play the game with other players who also have access to the pre-release. This is an early version of the game, and may not have all features fully complete and may contain bugs or other problems. More information about the exact Pre-Release date will become available as we get closer to the estimated date, and we will be posting news about it as development continues.

 

Complete Group Game 4 Pack

More information about the exact Pre-Release date will become available as we get closer to the estimated date, and we will be posting news about it as development continues.

 

    Design a Skin

Design a skin for your favourite dinosaur! Work with our skin artists to create a design that will be put in-game that all players will be able to unlock and use. This skin will be visible on both official and unofficial servers.

You may only select one dinosaur species to create a skin for. The design must not contain any copyrighted or obscene material.

 

    Design a Personal Skin

Design an in-game skin for your favourite dinosaur that will be exclusive to you. No other players will be able to unlock or use this skin. Work with our skin designers to create a design that speaks to you and makes you stand out from the crowd! This skin will be visible on both official and unofficial servers.

You may only select one dinosaur species to create a skin for. The design must not contain any copyrighted or obscene material.

 

    Design a Personal Group Skin (4 or 8 Pack)

Design an in-game skin for your favourite dinosaur that will be exclusive to you and up to 7 other friends depending on the perk selected. No other players will be able to unlock or use this skin. Work with our skin designers to create a design that makes you and your pack stand out from the crowd! This skin will be visible on both official and unofficial servers.

You may only select one dinosaur species to create a skin for. The design must not contain any copyrighted or obscene material.

 

    Add a Specific Dinosaur or Critter to the Game

Add a Specific Dinosaur

Choose a specific dinosaur to add to the game! The type of dinosaur must fall within the group specified on the perk chosen.

This includes the 3D model with 3 sub-species variations, a full set of animations, 3 skins, unique sounds, and a unique playstyle that compliments the creatures strengths and weaknesses. Work with our artists to help guide the creature's design and the skins that will be created for it, and suggest unique abilities and attacks it may have!

You may only select land-based or semi-aquatic creatures. Flying and swimming reptiles are not allowed. The creature must not be more than 20 meters (65 feet) long, as our map has not been designed for creatures larger than that. The creature must be from the Mesozoic Era. 

Add a Critter

Add any prehistoric critter to add to the game! Choose a species of small non-dinosaur animal and work with our artists to design it and create a skin for it. It will be added as an AI creature (non-playable) to the game. Includes 1 critter model, a full set of animations, 3 unique skins, and unique sounds. This will be be added to the game upon launch. The creature must be from the Mesozoic Era.

 

    Add any Dinosaur to the Game

Choose any dinosaur to add to the game! This includes the 3D model with 3 sub-species variations, a full set of animations, 3 skins, unique sounds, and a unique playstyle that compliments the creatures strengths and weaknesses. Work with our artists to help guide the creature's design and the skins that will be created for it, and suggest unique abilities and attacks it may have!

You may only select land-based or semi-aquatic creatures. Flying and swimming reptiles are not allowed. The creature must not be more than 20 meters (65 feet) long, as our map has not been designed for creatures larger than that. The creature must be from the Mesozoic Era. 

 

The Path of Titans team is committed to bringing the quintessential dinosaur survival game to life. Members of the Path of Titans development team come from all over the world. Our primary developers have all moved from their hometowns halfway around the world to work out of the same building together in Victoria, Australia to build better team cohesion and have the underappreciated benefit of face-to-face conversations.

Say hello to everyone on the team, listed below!

Path of Titans will feature an extensive environment you must survive in. Find water, forage for edible plants, and hunt prey in order to avoid death. But that’s just the beginning. Partake in realistic, environment driven quests in order to gain points to put towards improving your character and permanently unlocking skins or new dinosaurs.
Path of Titans will be packed with features to allow for plenty of replayability and content for hundreds of hours of play time. Some of the main features include:

Permanent characters with in-depth skin and trait customization
A complex questing system.
Group and Guild systems that allow for pack hunting and herd migration, with servers supporting up to 200 concurrent players.
Lush environment filled with AI dinosaurs and smaller prehistoric creatures
Swimming, diving, and fishing in both lakes and rivers.
Cross platform functionality, play the game from your PC with your friends on mobile and vice versa.
Powerful modding tools with extensive documentation, and a backend allowing modders to deliver their content to other players.

Work with our skin artists to create a design that will be put in-game that all players will be able to unlock and use. This skin will be visible on both official and unofficial servers.You may only select one dinosaur species to create a skin for. The design must not contain any copyrighted or obscene material.     Design a Personal SkinDesign an in-game skin for your favourite dinosaur that will be exclusive to you. No other players will be able to unlock or use this skin. Work with our skin designers to create a design that speaks to you and makes you stand out from the crowd! This skin will be visible on both official and unofficial servers.You may only select one dinosaur species to create a skin for. The design must not contain any copyrighted or obscene material.     Design a Personal Group Skin (4 or 8 Pack)Design an in-game skin for your favourite dinosaur that will be exclusive to you and up to 7 other friends depending on the perk selected. No other players will be able to unlock or use this skin. Work with our skin designers to create a design that makes you and your pack stand out from the crowd! This skin will be visible on both official and unofficial servers.You may only select one dinosaur species to create a skin for. The design must not contain any copyrighted or obscene material.     Add a Specific Dinosaur or Critter to the GameAdd a Specific DinosaurChoose a specific dinosaur to add to the game! The type of dinosaur must fall within the group specified on the perk chosen.This includes the 3D model with 3 sub-species variations, a full set of animations, 3 skins, unique sounds, and a unique playstyle that compliments the creatures strengths and weaknesses. Work with our artists to help guide the creature's design and the skins that will be created for it, and suggest unique abilities and attacks it may have!You may only select land-based or semi-aquatic creatures. Flying and swimming reptiles are not allowed. The creature must not be more than 20 meters (65 feet) long, as our map has not been designed for creatures larger than that. The creature must be from the Mesozoic Era. Add a CritterAdd any prehistoric critter to add to the game! Choose a species of small non-dinosaur animal and work with our artists to design it and create a skin for it. It will be added as an AI creature (non-playable) to the game. Includes 1 critter model, a full set of animations, 3 unique skins, and unique sounds. This will be be added to the game upon launch. The creature must be from the Mesozoic Era.     Add any Dinosaur to the GameChoose any dinosaur to add to the game! This includes the 3D model with 3 sub-species variations, a full set of animations, 3 skins, unique sounds, and a unique playstyle that compliments the creatures strengths and weaknesses. Work with our artists to help guide the creature's design and the skins that will be created for it, and suggest unique abilities and attacks it may have!You may only select land-based or semi-aquatic creatures. Flying and swimming reptiles are not allowed. The creature must not be more than 20 meters (65 feet) long, as our map has not been designed for creatures larger than that. The creature must be from the Mesozoic Era.  The Path of Titans team is committed to bringing the quintessential dinosaur survival game to life. Members of the Path of Titans development team come from all over the world. Our primary developers have all moved from their hometowns halfway around the world to work out of the same building together in Victoria, Australia to build better team cohesion and have the underappreciated benefit of face-to-face conversations.Say hello to everyone on the team, listed below!

story:
Overview

ETIKA was a legend in the Nintendo community. His early death highlights a major issue in the US today - our mental health care system. By raising money for the JED Foundation we can put the necessary tools into the right hands and help provide resources for mental health and suicide prevention awareness. As a backer for this campaign, you'll be able to honor ETIKA with a pair of Game Armor controller shells, while also providing money for a really great cause.

 

The ETIKONS

Desmond "Etika" Amofah tragically took his own life on June 19th, 2019. The Etikons are a way to honor his legacy while putting a lasting product into the hands of his fans, and raising a ton of money for mental health and suicide prevention awareness.  

 

The Design

The design shown is what we expect the controller shells to look like when complete. Please keep in mind these designs are not final and subject to change. This is a drawn mock-up, not factory made, and will likely have variations from a factory produced version. Once we get factory samples, we will include those photos. 

- The Game Armor Joy shells will be manufactured in China 

- Options to have your controller shells pre-assembled on a new set of controllers by our team of experts will be offered post campaign. Campaign backers will only receive Game Armor Joy shells to install on their own controllers with this campaign, unless they upgrade afterwards.

 

The Campaign

By reaching our initial goal of $5,000 we'll be able to make our first production run of 500 Game Armor Joy shells. This is the minimum order quantity needed for production. 

The price for each set of shells is $35 and is broken down as follows...

40% - Production cost and Indiegogo Campaign fees

30% - Employee and Operation costs

30% - Donated to the JED Foundation* for Mental Health and Suicide Prevention Awareness 

*30% Donated to JED Foundation is based on the total amount raised after all production costs are deducted. 

STRETCH GOALS

$5000 - Initial Campaign for ETIKON Joy Shells Funded 

$10,000 - Game Armor ETIKON Console Backplate Reaches Production Funding

$15,000 - Game Armor ETIKON Professional Controller shells reach production funding

 

Pledge Options

Game Armor Joy Shells: 

Every pledge in this campaign is for a single set of shells. These shells must be self installed on a pair of controllers that you already own. Want more than one set of shells? No problem! Once you select your pledge, you'll be able to select additional shell sets as an add-on option at checkout! Each shell set comes with a left and right shell (one black and one white) 

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk involved in this campaign is the manufacturing process. With everything happening in the world (like a global pandemic) manufacturing can take longer than expected.

In the event that for some reason the project cannot be completed, each and every backer will have the option for a full refund or to have their pledge donated to JED Foundation without a reward. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Let everyone you know, know about the campaign! Every voice matters!

You can donate directly to the JED Foundation in Etikas name if you're unable to pledge for a reward!

 

*** NOTE: THIS FUNDRAISING CAMPAIGN IS IN NO WAY AFFILIATED OR ASSOCIATED WITH NINTENDO OF AMERICA OR ANY OF ITS PARTIES, THIS CAMPAIGN DOES NOT SEEK TO INFRINGE ON ANY COPYRIGHTS OR TRADEMARKS HELD BY NINTENDO. NINTENDO CONTINUES TO RESERVE ALL RIGHTS TO ITS PROPERTIES. THE CAMPAIGN REWARDS ARE NOT INFRINGING ON NINTENDO IP AND ONLY SEEK TO RAISE MONEY FOR CHARITY WHILE OFFERING A PRODUCT COMPATIBLE WITH THE NINTENDO SWITCH

story:
Designed by leading researchers in neural interfaces and bionic limbs from the University of Waterloo, Impulse is the first gaming peripheral that enables you to react at the speed of thought by recognizing your intention to click your mouse. Commands activated with Impulse are faster than mouse clicks by up to 80 milliseconds, paving the way for an unprecedented gaming experience.



Impulse has built-in sensors that use a proprietary machine-learning algorithm to read your muscles’ biosignals and predict your clicking intentions. Essentially, we’re cutting out the time lag between when you think about clicking and when your finger actually executes on that movement through muscular contraction.
 


Impulse weighs less than 50 grams and works with any gaming mouse, so you don’t need to change your existing gaming setup to use it.

Watch Trisha Hershberger break down how the Impulse Neuro-Controller works and even test it out in Halo!

 


From faster gaming mice to better monitors, you’re constantly trying to improve your reaction in your game-play. Impulse is the next evolution—reducing your lag by interpreting your intentions from the neural data in your muscles. 




Impulse gives you an extra edge in FPS, MOBA, RTS games, and more. React, fire, and rapid fire faster to beat out the competition. Impulse improves performance for both left and right click actions.







After a couple of sessions, some of our beta testers started to forget they were even wearing Impulse. Have more than one gaming device? No problem, Impulse works with any mouse, any time. Impulse will also be available for both left- and right-handed gamers. 







 






 

Between your intention to click your mouse, and when the actual click happens, two processes take place simultaneously:

 

The time difference between these two processes is called EMD. The proprietary algorithm of Impulse leverages the electric process, while the physical mouse relies on the mechanical process. This is the Impulse difference!

 



Here’s a full breakdown of our tech specs:





 

Impulse is the very first consumer neural interface of its kind, but we’re far from the first team to attempt to improve gamer reaction time with innovative tech. Here’s how we compare: 




 

 

Our team includes some of the foremost experts in neural interface technologies, and we're confident that we have the experience to make the Impulse a reality for you. To further ensure our ability to deliver, we’ve harnessed over $350,000 in VC funding and have secured partnerships with a full-stack manufacturing team and hardware development team.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


Before setting our production timeline, we did extensive research and spoke at length with our manufacturing and operations partners. The resulting timeline takes into account our determination to deliver a high-quality product, without the constant delivery extensions that plague many Indiegogo campaigns.

story:
It's a question you've probably asked yourself, and it's a question we want to help you answer.

Dead Matter is a community driven, crowd funded survival game that aims to quench the thirst for a true zombie survival sandbox. Initially funded in August of 2017. We aim to bring the game to Steam Early Access shortly after our closed testing period.

Dead Matter caters to a multitude of survival playstyles that can be mixed and matched, affording players an infinite amount of ways to survive in post apocalyptic Alberta.

We've been hard at work over the past 9 months to bring Dead Matter to life. After many hardships the foundation has been laid and we're now working on fleshing out key content. We always listen to feedback that our fans give us and truly appreciate all of the support we've been shown thus far.

In Dead Matter, the only limits on your player is you. Freedom of expression is an important design philosophy for us and as such, we've planned out our customisation systems from the beginning to give you as much power over your protagonist as you want. From hair, to head, to body, you'll be in control.

 

The world of Dead Matter is filled with every manner of weapon you could think of, and we've built them from the ground up to support all kinds of customisation, allowing you to tune the weapon to your playstyle. Whether you want to wrap your baseball bat in barbed wire and go out bashing, rig an alarm clock with C4 to go off with a bang, or strap up your gun with a makeshift kitchen knife bayonet, the choice is yours.

You can also use scraps such as old lawnmowers, fire extinguishers, pressure washers, and more to put together weapons, ensuring your survival no matter the situation.

All of those rails will be used to hold a wide variety of attachments designed to aid your survival.

It doesn't stop with the weapons. Our vehicles were broken down and designed in parts to allow you to transform any run-of-the-mill suburban family van into an apocalypse-kitted survivalist's dream. All it takes is the right ambition and desire to leave your mark on the world (and the right materials, of course).

You can also turn your vehicle into a mobile fortress, or have a truck configured to tow a few thousand litres of fuel, water or even tow a wrecked vehicle. It's up to you.

 

20x20km of beautiful Canadian landscape.

We've crafted our depiction of Alberta to be the ultimate survival sandbox; lush with variety and life, from the wild forests and lakes of the Rockies, to the once bustling city of Calgary.

 

To effectively simulate a breathing world, we've built our metagame and AI systems to support true variety. Expect the unexpected: any forest trek, highway cruise, or grocery store trip could lead you on crossed paths with a settlement of soldiers, a band of scavengers, or simple families searching for shelter, all of which will do whatever it takes to ensure their own survival.

But the AI don't get to have all the fun. The world of Dead Matter was developed to support your settlements. Any building you see can be barricaded, upgraded, and fitted with electricity and flowing water. The land can be farmed and cultivated, and the lakes fished. You can live quietly, in the shadows of day-to-day post-apocalyptic life, or settle your people around Alberta's transformers, dams, and bridges, to retake control of the world around you.

Dead Matter utilises a grid-based, jigsaw-style inventory system that challenges you to plan and conserve. Just as they are in the real world, items are host to a variety of unique variables beyond size and quantity, like temperature and quality. What you scavenge will often require unique planning and storage, so be conscious. 

We don't want scavenging to feel restrictive in Dead Matter. Any container you find can be physically opened and looted, from a nightstand, to a vending machine, to a locked-up gun safe. You can search the home for the key or force it open and play your luck - just don't make too much noise. 

Your character physically reaches out to pick up items, flick light switches, push buttons, open doors, open containers, and much more. Nothing in Dead Matter happens instantly, and items don't teleport off the ground into your inventory. You are a part of the world and must interact with it.

RESOURCES

Essential to living.

Electricity is a core part of modern life, and the beginning of the zombie apocalypse will reflect that. Our robust electrical system enables you to fully power your home, opening up many gameplay options from the typical minutia of turning lights on and off, to permitting the usage of power tools to enhance your crafting and upgrades. Nothing this good lasts forever, however, and bad luck and poor planning could leave you with dead equipment when things go south.

We also have a robust sewer system to go alongside our water system, you'll occasionally be required to head into a dark, cramped and terrifying environment in order to secure a steady supply of water for the survivors at your settlement or for survivors willing to trade some supplies for a little bit of your time.

Once you have a stable source of water, you can hunt, forage or scavenge for food in order to feed yourself and those that rely on you. Keep in mind that every gunshot near a town will draw the undead closer to your location.

 

Back to our roots.

Player freedom is an incredibly important aspect of a fun survival game, and as such we're putting everything in your hands - our procedural development tools (which support full polish control for our environment artists), C++ and blueprint access, everything. We're modders at our core, and we know how important modding support is for a healthy, long lasting community. Any user can host their own server, with their own settings and mods - on or off the Steam Workshop. It's all accessible and it's all free.

Epic Games has offered to help us bring modding to Dead Matter via the Unreal Launcher, and we plan to take them up on this once we know the game is ready. We plan to support modding via Steam Workshop to ensure ease of use for everyday players and for server owners.

 

 

Dead Matter is a community driven title. Our development staff is extremely active on the community Discord, and we often give our backers sneak peaks, as well as take suggestions. One of the most complex systems in the game was initially a fan suggestion that ended up becoming the vehicle towing system.

Want to join our discord server? Simply click here: discord.gg/deadmatter

We also take suggestions and engage with our community via our forum, which you can check out here: playdeadmatter.com/forums

We'll also be opening our influencer program in the near future, allowing content creators and other cool folks to help spread the word around about Dead Matter!

 

We love progress!

Since our Kickstarter we've been working hard on not only the base game but the stretch goals for Dead Matter. Even though we're still in pre-alpha, we've already put a dent into our stretch goals and we plan on bringing them to our supporters as fast as humanly possible.


MAP EXPANSION

"Our depiction of Alberta is already huge. However, we still have some unused space to fill, including underground. Hitting the required amount for this stretch goal means that we will be able to add in new locations to the map, such as an abandoned underground mining complex. We will also include new weapons and new items to compliment the locations that we add in."

The code for the map expansion has been written and our world will now feature abandoned bunkers strewn across it. This stretch goal is complete.

Required Amount: $70,000 CAD - REACHED

 

PLANES & TRAINS

"While the base game will be bustling with cars, trucks, boats, and bicycles, giving you the tools to conquer the skies and the rails will require more. Hitting our goal with this means that Dead Matter will receive helicopters, fixed wing aircraft, and trains for you to fortify, upgrade, and defend from those who want them for themselves. 

To store your new machines, we'll also be fleshing out the train stations, heliports, and airports throughout the map. New unique weapons, vehicles, and clothing will be there for you to find and claim."

Planes and Helicopters are still in progress. Trains are receiving a polish pass before we post them publicly, but are currently functional in game. This stretch goal is underway.

Required Amount: $85,000 CAD - REACHED

 

WAY BACK WEST

"A new sandbox inspired by Vancouver Island and the original Dead Matter mod's map. Smaller and denser, Vancouver Island is home to new weapons, new enemies, new vehicles, new clothes, and new places to explore, all on a coastal landscape that will change the terms of survival.

You'll also be able to travel between Alberta and Vancouver Island at your leisure, assuming you've got the supplies for it."

This stretch goal is still in early development and will be completed after the initial Dead Matter release on Steam. This stretch goal has not been started.

Required Amount: $120,000 CAD - REACHED

 

INTERACTIVE AI SETTLEMENTS & FACTIONS

"Work with - or against - your fellow man. Trade with, run errands for, and earn favour with the inhabitants of the world to determine the outcome of new communities of families and strangers.

Or expand your own: invite your new friends and followers to join your homes. Organize scavenging runs, delegate jobs and roles, and work to keep each other alive."

This is our favourite stretch goal. We'll be revealing more information on player and AI settlements shortly. This stretch goal is nearly complete. 

Required Amount: $175,000 CAD - REACHED

 

RADIO & RADIO STATIONS

"The final word of stations of the past, classical tunes, emergency broadcasts, and hijacked airwaves will be yours to hear, control, and follow. Play with new vehicles like OB vans, contact your friends with new tools like pocket and HAM radios, and explore and conquer the old radio stations at your leisure."

We've created the art related to the radios but not the stations. The code we'll be using for VoIP has been partially implemented, and NPC Radio Hosts have been organised and are present in the teaser trailer along with a functional radio entity. This stretch goal is underway.

Required Amount: $200,000 CAD - REACHED

 

MODULAR GEAR, NEW WEAPONS, AND ENHANCED TWITCH SUPPORT

"Upon reaching this tier, we’ll be able to fully flesh out our modular suit system. Scavenge and scrap the remnants of the apocalypse and fit your player with a set of gear that can be worn atop most of the clothing in the game. We’ll also be adding fifteen new melee weapons and five new firearms.  

We’ll also be including official Twitch support. In addition to our already planned ‘Broadcast Mode’, which disguises your player name and the server you’re connected to, this goal will allow us to expand our integration further: view your chat in-game, poll your viewers, invite them to participate and easily add connected viewers to your party."

All of our weapons have been remade from scratch. We've added over 15 new firearms and over 5 new melee weapons (on top of the 40+ melee weapons we had pre-kickstarter).  This half of the stretch goal is considered complete.

 

Streamer mode is currently implemented however an official Twitch integration is still underway. The additional gear is currently in the planning phases. This half of the stretch goal is still underway.

Required Amount: $225,000 CAD - REACHED

 

PLAYER-MADE STRUCTURES

"Construct, upgrade, and expand your control of the world. We’ll be overhauling our player settlement system to support greater constructive capabilities, allowing you to assemble seamless, personalized shelters from shacks, to shanties, to cabins, to garages that serve whatever purpose you’ll give them. Like all else in the game, our game options will allow server hosts or singleplayer explorers to adjust and fine-tune every aspect of these player structures, from changing the material requirements to outright disabling them."

Player-made structures have been integrated into the player settlement system, and we'll be revealing more information on this very soon. This stretch goal is nearly complete.

Required Amount: $275,000 CAD - REACHED

 

Enhanced Character Customization

"Reaching this stretch goal will enable us to implement custom morph targets that will expand our character customisation options. In addition to modifying your player's eye colour, hair colour, and head type, morph targets will allow you to completely retool your player's face.  

Hitting this stretch goal will also allow server owners to enable dynamic progression for your character's appearance: hair growth, scarring, and ageing and more, all of which can be adjusted via server settings. We will also be adding makeup, razors, and similar cosmetic items to let you change your look on the fly."

Even though we haven't received the funds we needed for this goal, we've started work on it with some of the best the industry has to offer. We'll be posting some pictures of the progress here as soon as possible. This stretch goal is underway!

Required Amount: $325,000 CAD - NOT REACHED

 

 

We are making this game happen, and we couldn't have done it without the support and feedback of the community. You can check out our Kickstarter or our Greenlight pages to see our older work and the number of improvements that we've made since. We currently have a tiny team of 3 full time employees and multiple contractors. With your continued support we can continue to take Dead Matter further than any other survival game has gone before. Thank you to all our supporters, and thank you for your time.

 

We have modelled our system requirements based off of the Unreal Engine 4 recommended specifications. They are subject to change based on further development.

  • Desktop PC or Mac.
  • Windows 7 64-bit or Mac OS X 10.9.2 or later.
  • Quad-core Intel or AMD processor, 2.5 GHz or faster.
  • NVIDIA GeForce 470 GTX or AMD Radeon 6870 HD series card or higher.
  • 8 GB RAM.

Initially funded in August of 2017. After many hardships the foundation has been laid and we're now working on fleshing out key content. We always listen to feedback that our fans give us and truly appreciate all of the support we've been shown thus far.CUSTOMISE YOUR LOOK
The way you like it.In Dead Matter, the only limits on your player is you. Freedom of expression is an important design philosophy for us and as such, we've planned out our customisation systems from the beginning to give you as much power over your protagonist as you want. From hair, to head, to body, you'll be in control. The world of Dead Matter is filled with every manner of weapon you could think of, and we've built them from the ground up to support all kinds of customisation, allowing you to tune the weapon to your playstyle. Whether you want to wrap your baseball bat in barbed wire and go out bashing, rig an alarm clock with C4 to go off with a bang, or strap up your gun with a makeshift kitchen knife bayonet, the choice is yours.You can also use scraps such as old lawnmowers, fire extinguishers, pressure washers, and more to put together weapons, ensuring your survival no matter the situation.All of those rails will be used to hold a wide variety of attachments designed to aid your survival.It doesn't stop with the weapons. It's up to you. 


 
MULTIPLAYER
Hell on Earth. Better with friends.
Dead Matter was conceived and developed, from the beginning, by friends and singleplayer enthusiasts alike. We plan to support and encourage both playstyles as often as we can and wherever we can.
Whether you want to join a huge dedicated server and explore a bustling community of players and build your list of friends and enemies, or invite some friends and try to take on post-apocalyptic Alberta in privacy - it's up to you. You won't have to worry about any port forwarding, just invite a friend on Steam and Dead Matter will take care of the rest.


 
OUR WORLD20x20km of beautiful Canadian landscape.We've crafted our depiction of Alberta to be the ultimate survival sandbox; lush with variety and life, from the wild forests and lakes of the Rockies, to the once bustling city of Calgary. To effectively simulate a breathing world, we've built our metagame and AI systems to support true variety. Expect the unexpected: any forest trek, highway cruise, or grocery store trip could lead you on crossed paths with a settlement of soldiers, a band of scavengers, or simple families searching for shelter, all of which will do whatever it takes to ensure their own survival.But the AI don't get to have all the fun. The world of Dead Matter was developed to support your settlements. Any building you see can be barricaded, upgraded, and fitted with electricity and flowing water. The land can be farmed and cultivated, and the lakes fished. You can live quietly, in the shadows of day-to-day post-apocalyptic life, or settle your people around Alberta's transformers, dams, and bridges, to retake control of the world around you.



IMMERSIVE INVENTORY
Minimal HUD elements. Maximum attention to detail.Dead Matter utilises a grid-based, jigsaw-style inventory system that challenges you to plan and conserve. Just as they are in the real world, items are host to a variety of unique variables beyond size and quantity, like temperature and quality. What you scavenge will often require unique planning and storage, so be conscious. 
Our items are designed to behave realistically. You'll have to unbox your ammo and pack your magazines, open cans of food with various tools that can be found in the world - or simply smash it on the ground if nothing else is available.We don't want scavenging to feel restrictive in Dead Matter. Any container you find can be physically opened and looted, from a nightstand, to a vending machine, to a locked-up gun safe. You can search the home for the key or force it open and play your luck - just don't make too much noise. Your character physically reaches out to pick up items, flick light switches, push buttons, open doors, open containers, and much more. Nothing in Dead Matter happens instantly, and items don't teleport off the ground into your inventory. You are a part of the world and must interact with it.RESOURCESEssential to living.Electricity is a core part of modern life, and the beginning of the zombie apocalypse will reflect that. Our robust electrical system enables you to fully power your home, opening up many gameplay options from the typical minutia of turning lights on and off, to permitting the usage of power tools to enhance your crafting and upgrades. Nothing this good lasts forever, however, and bad luck and poor planning could leave you with dead equipment when things go south.We also have a robust sewer system to go alongside our water system, you'll occasionally be required to head into a dark, cramped and terrifying environment in order to secure a steady supply of water for the survivors at your settlement or for survivors willing to trade some supplies for a little bit of your time.Once you have a stable source of water, you can hunt, forage or scavenge for food in order to feed yourself and those that rely on you. Keep in mind that every gunshot near a town will draw the undead closer to your location. MODDING SUPPORTBack to our roots.
 Player freedom is an incredibly important aspect of a fun survival game, and as such we're putting everything in your hands - our procedural development tools (which support full polish control for our environment artists), C++ and blueprint access, everything. We're modders at our core, and we know how important modding support is for a healthy, long lasting community. Any user can host their own server, with their own settings and mods - on or off the Steam Workshop. It's all accessible and it's all free.Epic Games has offered to help us bring modding to Dead Matter via the Unreal Launcher, and we plan to take them up on this once we know the game is ready. We plan to support modding via Steam Workshop to ensure ease of use for everyday players and for server owners.   
OUR COMMUNITY
Essential to our success!Dead Matter is a community driven title. Our development staff is extremely active on the community Discord, and we often give our backers sneak peaks, as well as take suggestions. One of the most complex systems in the game was initially a fan suggestion that ended up becoming the vehicle towing system.Want to join our discord server? Simply click here: discord.gg/deadmatterWe also take suggestions and engage with our community via our forum, which you can check out here: playdeadmatter.com/forumsWe'll also be opening our influencer program in the near future, allowing content creators and other cool folks to help spread the word around about Dead Matter!  STRETCH GOAL PROGRESS​We love progress!Since our Kickstarter we've been working hard on not only the base game but the stretch goals for Dead Matter. Even though we're still in pre-alpha, we've already put a dent into our stretch goals and we plan on bringing them to our supporters as fast as humanly possible.
MAP EXPANSION"Our depiction of Alberta is already huge. However, we still have some unused space to fill, including underground. Hitting the required amount for this stretch goal means that we will be able to add in new locations to the map, such as an abandoned underground mining complex. We will also include new weapons and new items to compliment the locations that we add in."The code for the map expansion has been written and our world will now feature abandoned bunkers strewn across it. This stretch goal is complete.Required Amount: $70,000 CAD - REACHED PLANES & TRAINS"While the base game will be bustling with cars, trucks, boats, and bicycles, giving you the tools to conquer the skies and the rails will require more. Hitting our goal with this means that Dead Matter will receive helicopters, fixed wing aircraft, and trains for you to fortify, upgrade, and defend from those who want them for themselves. To store your new machines, we'll also be fleshing out the train stations, heliports, and airports throughout the map. New unique weapons, vehicles, and clothing will be there for you to find and claim."Planes and Helicopters are still in progress. Trains are receiving a polish pass before we post them publicly, but are currently functional in game. This stretch goal is underway.Required Amount: $85,000 CAD - REACHED WAY BACK WEST"A new sandbox inspired by Vancouver Island and the original Dead Matter mod's map. Smaller and denser, Vancouver Island is home to new weapons, new enemies, new vehicles, new clothes, and new places to explore, all on a coastal landscape that will change the terms of survival.You'll also be able to travel between Alberta and Vancouver Island at your leisure, assuming you've got the supplies for it."This stretch goal is still in early development and will be completed after the initial Dead Matter release on Steam. This stretch goal has not been started.Required Amount: $120,000 CAD - REACHED INTERACTIVE AI SETTLEMENTS & FACTIONS"Work with - or against - your fellow man. Trade with, run errands for, and earn favour with the inhabitants of the world to determine the outcome of new communities of families and strangers.Or expand your own: invite your new friends and followers to join your homes. Organize scavenging runs, delegate jobs and roles, and work to keep each other alive."This is our favourite stretch goal. We'll be revealing more information on player and AI settlements shortly. This stretch goal is nearly complete. Required Amount: $175,000 CAD - REACHED RADIO & RADIO STATIONS"The final word of stations of the past, classical tunes, emergency broadcasts, and hijacked airwaves will be yours to hear, control, and follow. Play with new vehicles like OB vans, contact your friends with new tools like pocket and HAM radios, and explore and conquer the old radio stations at your leisure."We've created the art related to the radios but not the stations. The code we'll be using for VoIP has been partially implemented, and NPC Radio Hosts have been organised and are present in the teaser trailer along with a functional radio entity. This stretch goal is underway.Required Amount: $200,000 CAD - REACHED MODULAR GEAR, NEW WEAPONS, AND ENHANCED TWITCH SUPPORT"Upon reaching this tier, we’ll be able to fully flesh out our modular suit system. Scavenge and scrap the remnants of the apocalypse and fit your player with a set of gear that can be worn atop most of the clothing in the game. We’ll also be adding fifteen new melee weapons and five new firearms.  We’ll also be including official Twitch support. In addition to our already planned ‘Broadcast Mode’, which disguises your player name and the server you’re connected to, this goal will allow us to expand our integration further: view your chat in-game, poll your viewers, invite them to participate and easily add connected viewers to your party."All of our weapons have been remade from scratch. We've added over 15 new firearms and over 5 new melee weapons (on top of the 40+ melee weapons we had pre-kickstarter).  This half of the stretch goal is considered complete. Streamer mode is currently implemented however an official Twitch integration is still underway. The additional gear is currently in the planning phases. This half of the stretch goal is still underway.Required Amount: $225,000 CAD - REACHED PLAYER-MADE STRUCTURES"Construct, upgrade, and expand your control of the world. We’ll be overhauling our player settlement system to support greater constructive capabilities, allowing you to assemble seamless, personalized shelters from shacks, to shanties, to cabins, to garages that serve whatever purpose you’ll give them. Like all else in the game, our game options will allow server hosts or singleplayer explorers to adjust and fine-tune every aspect of these player structures, from changing the material requirements to outright disabling them."Player-made structures have been integrated into the player settlement system, and we'll be revealing more information on this very soon. This stretch goal is nearly complete.Required Amount: $275,000 CAD - REACHED Enhanced Character Customization"Reaching this stretch goal will enable us to implement custom morph targets that will expand our character customisation options. In addition to modifying your player's eye colour, hair colour, and head type, morph targets will allow you to completely retool your player's face.  
Hitting this stretch goal will also allow server owners to enable dynamic progression for your character's appearance: hair growth, scarring, and ageing and more, all of which can be adjusted via server settings. We will also be adding makeup, razors, and similar cosmetic items to let you change your look on the fly."
Even though we haven't received the funds we needed for this goal, we've started work on it with some of the best the industry has to offer. We'll be posting some pictures of the progress here as soon as possible. This stretch goal is underway!
Required Amount: $325,000 CAD - NOT REACHED
 

 
WHAT WOULD YOU DO IN A ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE?
We'd probably cry.
We are making this game happen, and we couldn't have done it without the support and feedback of the community. You can check out our Kickstarter or our Greenlight pages to see our older work and the number of improvements that we've made since. We currently have a tiny team of 3 full time employees and multiple contractors. With your continued support we can continue to take Dead Matter further than any other survival game has gone before. Thank you to all our supporters, and thank you for your time.
 
 
Follow us on Twitter for frequent updates!
 
Like us on Facebook!
 
Subscribe to our channel on YouTube!
 
 
Check out our page on Steam Greenlight! 
SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS
We have modelled our system requirements based off of the Unreal Engine 4 recommended specifications. They are subject to change based on further development.

Desktop PC or Mac.
Windows 7 64-bit or Mac OS X 10.9.2 or later.
Quad-core Intel or AMD processor, 2.5 GHz or faster.
NVIDIA GeForce 470 GTX or AMD Radeon 6870 HD series card or higher.
8 GB RAM.

story:
Short Summary

Aebal is a procedurally generated music-based rhythm game that focuses on your ability to avoid enemies. Dodge synchronized patterns and the dreaded Red Arrow which moves in tune with the current song! 

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $6,000 to provide us with everything we need to make an amazing game that's both visually and functionally satisfying to interact with. The money raised will provide us with funding for Music Licensing, Design, Artwork, and our ability to sell our game on Steam. Regardless of the reward tier you choose, your name will be in the available credits of the game.

The Impact

This game is perfect for people that enjoy "Osu!" and other rhythm-based games. What sets this game apart is that the enemies are unpredictable and random with each song you play.

Risks & Challenges

Something that we are aware of within the Aebal team is, we know that $6,000 will not cover all of our costs. But, we are also spending money out of our own pockets to make our vision a reality.

story:
This campaign concluded on 4/30/2021!

Thanks for your support and look for Amaru on the App Store and Google Play on or about May 15!


If you've already purchased a Believer Tier Perk, the bonus gift copies and Early-bird Pack have been automatically added to your order. 
 

Welcome!

This campaign is a continuation of our Kickstarter which raised $62,257 from 1883 backers. Help us keep our project growing!

 

We're gamers with a purpose. We're alarmed at the rising rates of anxiety and depression we've seen nationally, especially in our youth. We know that there are scientifically validated self-care practices that can help, but we also know how hard it is to maintain new habits and routines. That's why we're combining the best features of mobile games and wellness apps into Amaru: The Self-Care Virtual Pet, a game designed specifically to help support players in developing habits of self-care.

Even though we're tackling a serious topic, we wanted to tackle it with fun, beauty, and lightness. This is our opportunity to use the video game medium for serious real-world impact. Thanks for checking us out and backing our project!

When the mysterious Fog of Maya descends, it plunges the world of Enso into chaos. Amaru is lost, anxious, and far from his home.  Far across the cosmos, a human Seeker is searching for hope and meaning.  A helpful guide named Kamali senses a tie in the fates of these two creatures and creates a portal for the Seeker to enter the world of Enso.  The game begins when the Seeker and Amaru meet.  A fated friendship is about to be born!

*your day may look different depending on your selected goals.

This game is different from many you may have encountered.  Players will customize their self-care goals and are encouraged to play the game for 15-30 minutes each day. Players who play daily can expect to clear the main game content in roughly 2 months, the amount of time it takes for new habits to become routine. Think of it as Neopets meets Headspace: a place where you check in with your pet while checking in with yourself!

 

Your very own virtual pet! 

  • Feed, pet, and care for Amaru to build your Bond!
  • Enjoy hand-drawn animations that evolve as your Bond grows stronger.
  • Amaru will awaken and go to sleep based on your goal times for beginning your morning routine and powering down electronics for the night.
     

 Self-care Support

  • Customize a self-care regimen that works for you.
  • Meet your Self-care Goals to earn Goal Gems and strengthen your Aura.
  • Follow empowering prompts such as Gratitude Journaling in your in-game Journal.
  • Explore 20+ guided breathing and mindfulness meditation recordings scientifically shown to reduce stress, anxiety and depression. Enjoy this preview below from our Test Version!


 Exploration and Collections 

  • Discover five gorgeous regions in the World of Enso with unique Soundscapes like ocean waves or falling rain. 
  • Complete a collection of 100+ lore-rich items revealing details about Enso and its inhabitants.
  • Find hundreds of player-submitted Affirmation messages to brighten your day!
     

Mini-games and Quests
 

  • Challenge yourself to earn hi-scores in engaging Minigames!
  • These are just for fun and totally optional if you prefer less screen-time!
     

Hydration Garden

 

 

The Hydration Garden rewards you for staying hydrated! When you report meeting your hydration goals, you are rewarded with water for your plants. Keep up your streak and your plants will grow, eventually producing food you can feed to Amaru!
​

Amaru is the first installment of the The Fog of Maya series taking place in the world of Enso. The game makers take artistic inspiration from Final Fantasy, The Legend of Zelda,  Hollow Knight, and How to Train Your Dragon, and the elementally aligned civilizations and Eastern mystic themes of Enso have often drawn comparison to Avatar: The Last Airbender. Our goal is for this game to serve as a foundation for a series that tackles different mental health topics with different stories taking place in a common narrative universe.

 

Updated Perk Tables (4/27/2021)

These tables help you see which rewards are associated with each Perk. Gold Text indicates Limited Quantity Perks. Slashed Tiers are Sold Out. 

Team No-VID and Extra Copies of Plushies/Artbooks can be added to any Tier

The Early-bird Pack is included with all Believer Tier Perks ($100+)

 

Perk Details



See FAQ for what features are included in the Digital Copy. Please note you must be running Android 6.0 or newer or iOS 13 or newer. iPhone 6 will not run the game, but iPhone 6S will! 

You will be able to give us an email to send the copy as a gift or leave it to us to donate to a person or organization in need. See FAQ for more info. 

 


The digital edition is available for backers at the "Cat Pictures" tier or higher. The print edition contains BONUS pages and is signed by designer Gabe Pappalardo and artist Lexie Flock! It is available for backers pledging at the Bring Him Home tier or higher. 

 

Will you choose the classic red, the crowdfund exclusive gold , or both? You can add extra plushies onto any tier for $25+ shipping and handling. Both plushies come with Exclusive Founder's Tag.

 

All backers are Founders and will receive the Founder badge. Backers who pledge at the Friends Forever tier or higher will receive recognition in the in-game credits. The Advocate, Angel, and Seraph designations are reserved for top-tier backers of our project. We honor them with special loading-screen badges and statuses in our in-game credits.

Sustainer Badges are for reserved for Kickstarter Backers who have chosen to continue backing us on Indiegogo.

Team No-VID is a special designation for those who recognize the need to provide mental health resources in the challenging time that COVID presents. Team No-VID Members receive a special in-game badge and credit as well as a bonus Echo Stone whose contents are a secret to everyone... Access this Perk as an Add On to any other Perk. 

 

Shipping

We are currently shipping to the United States, Canada, Mexico, European Union, United Kingdom of Great Britain, Australia, and New Zealand.

 

Campaign Goals

This is a Flexible Goal campaign; however, we do have some rewards we'll grant to all backers in the event we hit certain milestones. 

  • $90,000 (UPDATED)- We'll grant all backers our "Custom-aru Bonus", the ability to change Amaru's colors anytime you want! 
     


Timeline

  • In March 2020, we released a demo to iOS and Android that won strong praise, endorsements, and over 20,000 downloads!
  • In August 2020, we completed a Kickstarter campaign that raised $62,257 from 1883 backers. Check out the campaign here!
  • In November 2020, we beat out 120 other companies for a $50,000 NC IDEA grant. 
  • In December of 2020, we attracted a $50,000 investment as well as coaching to help us with our development process and business. 
  • In March 2021, we delivered on all ancillary rewards to our Kickstarter backers including desktop and mobile backgrounds, plushies, and a 34-page artbook. We also grew our team. 
  • Today, we open this campaign to you so that you may gain access to these exclusive crowdfund backer rewards! 
  • By end of May 2021, we will soft-launch the game with features expanded beyond the demo, but not everything we promised included in your Base Game copy. 
  • By end of Fall 2021, we will release a Story Mode complete with all features we promised in the Base Game as well as any content included in stretch goals. 
  • Beyond,  we'll use sales revenue to expand and scale the game with new pets, well-being features, and game modes which will be available as separate in-app purchases or via a subscription model. 
     

Achievements and Endorsements

We are proud to have been endorsed by these incredible organizations highlighting mental health resources to gamer communities and providing support for entrepreneurs. 

Testimonials


"the app just helped me prevent a full on crisis of self worth when it comes to work. That meditation/breathing exercise definitely works well to help fight off the thoughts that cause the spiral effect." - Sol, beta tester

"It's super relaxing, and Amaru is just stupidly adorable I love him so much! Aaaaaah! Just... everything about this game is so helpful." - K, beta tester. 

"I think this is one of the most charming mental health apps I've ever seen!" - Luna, beta tester. 

"Whilst this app obviously doesn't replace therapy, it's already done more for min a few days than months of CBT did, and I'm really glad that this app is being made so that it can help other people like me." - Dawn, beta tester.

Risks and challenges

Many aspects of this project were ones we were attempting for the first time, but we've gained a ton of EXP and made substantial headway on the project. We're confident we can deliver everything we've promised with your support.  We've raised additional money, grown our team, and are being guided by veteran technologists in our development process.  Furthermore, our physical rewards, the plushie and artbook, are fully designed and arrived to strong praise, and we now have built a record shipping high quality products. 
 

Why Indiegogo?

First off, our online following can't get enough of the limited-edition plushies and artbooks! We wanted to open the doors one last time to allow people to join our campaign and snag these awesome rewards. 

Secondly, our followers have continually urged us to take our time in making Amaru the best product we can. All said and done, the fixed costs for running our studio come in at around $15k/month before factoring in advertising budget, and additional funds will help us give us the runway to deliver a quality product and set our studio up for long-term success. 

Thank you so much for your help! Please help us bring Amaru home!

Just... everything about this game is so helpful." - K, beta tester. "I think this is one of the most charming mental health apps I've ever seen!" - Luna, beta tester. "Whilst this app obviously doesn't replace therapy, it's already done more for min a few days than months of CBT did, and I'm really glad that this app is being made so that it can help other people like me." - Dawn, beta tester.Risks and challengesMany aspects of this project were ones we were attempting for the first time, but we've gained a ton of EXP and made substantial headway on the project. We wanted to open the doors one last time to allow people to join our campaign and snag these awesome rewards. Secondly, our followers have continually urged us to take our time in making Amaru the best product we can. All said and done, the fixed costs for running our studio come in at around $15k/month before factoring in advertising budget, and additional funds will help us give us the runway to deliver a quality product and set our studio up for long-term success. Thank you so much for your help! Please help us bring Amaru home!

story:
Project Tesla vs. Porsche East Slovakia Championship

- Multiplatform simulator/videogame (Win/Linux/Mac/Android/iOS)
- Python core, Blender rendering enviroment by ES
- OnDemand play, VR Oculus DK support
- Realtime texture levels, weather from East of Slovakia
- Real state of roads using GPS RDS_TMC
- Tesla Motors and Porsche car models
- Bonus downloadable car models Mazda 323 BA, Mazda RX-8
- Other cars: Audi, Skoda, Kia, Dream cars 
- Bonus Levels, Modding support

CONTACT INFORMATION
ExtremeSystems Inc.
EU, Slovakia
Email: tvp@extremesystems.eu
Integrator : Jan Istocko
