story:
Summer in Mara is an adventure at your own pace. Take care of your island and customize it as you want. Explore an open ocean full of places to travel and people to meet and trade with.

Set in a tropical ocean, Summer in Mara is a single-player game about farming and crafting, with an easy-RPG system and exploration elements. You'll be Koa, a little adventurer who has to take care of her own island.

You can also sail away on your boat and discover new different islands. With new islands come new people. You will trade and bargain or just chat with them. Getting to know these people is a significant part of the game because every one of them has their own unique and exciting story.

Afterward, you can go back to your island and manage your resources to improve your home, grow new crops and create new structures.

This is the circle of life: take care of your home island, travel through the ocean to get new items and help others, and then come back to your home.    

Summer in Mara is a calm and relaxing experience with a handmade look and a compelling narrative.

  • More than 150 quests to make the world a better place.   
     
  • Over 20 characters to meet and trade with. Befriend them! 
  •  More than 130 inventory items to craft, use, and trade. 
  •  Improve your boat, make it bigger and faster.  
  •  Unlock and acquire new skills and abilities for Koa, helping her to craft, trade and explore in an easy-RPG system. 
  •  Day and night cycle with climate events.
     

We have been developing a game that not only feels great but is also a ton of fun. Full of things to do, in Summer in Mara you will take care of your own island by sowing and harvesting your crop fields, planting and chopping down trees and mining. You will also be able to craft brand new tools and materials to build structures and improve the ones you already have.

But the adventure doesn't stop there. You will be fishing, swimming, and diving in the ocean. With your boat, you can sail through the sea, discover new islands and seek for treasures.

Take care of your island. 

Explore the ocean. 

Improve your home.

 Sail away.

The game is inspired by the exploration in The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker, the farming in Stardew Valley, the visual aspect of Studio Ghibli’s movies and the adventure feeling of your childhood summers. It’s also part of the Deiland universe, although it is an independent and unique adventure with its own story.

 We will release the game on PlayStation 4, Nintendo Switch, Xbox One and Windows and MacOS in Steam. 

The game will be in English, Spanish, German, French, Dutch, Japanese, Valencian and Galician when it is released.

We would love to have the game in all the languages possible, but we're going to need  50 backers to translate the game to Russian, Japanese, and Chinese to translate the game into these languages. So, share this campaign with a friend and help us to reach this goal!

 

If you want Summer in Mara in another language, leave us a comment and we'll see if we can make it possible. 

On the planet Qü, Mara is the ocean that brings life to our islands and our lives. You’re Koa, a little adventurer who has to take care of her home island. She has never seen the outside world beyond this island, but the ocean has always called her. 

Koa has always lived with her grandma, Yaya Haku, a very strict old qüido. Yaya Haku allows Koa to go wherever she wants on the island. But there is a big door on a cliff and Koa can't touch or do anything to it. Surrounded in mystery, this door keeps a secret that only Yaya Haku knows about.

Now, Mara ocean is in danger. An evil corporation from another planet has arrived at planet Qü, attracted by a strange energy that emerges from the sea. They're the Elit and they want to conquer and exploit Mara's resources. 

Mara is an ocean full of life, with a lot of exciting things to do and see. Don't miss the city island or the pirates racing through the sea and take very good care when you reach to the Storm Belt in the south. That's just a few of the things that you can find in the Mara ocean. 

Home Island

Your island. It has a beautiful beach, an enormous mountain, and a strange door. This is the place where Koa grew up and the only home that she knows. Taking care of an entire island is a lot of work, but Koa likes it.  However, she wants to venture outside and discover new places.

City Island

 

A lot of different qüidos and humans (even an elit!) live on this island. They have their business, such as the fish market, the restaurant, the bank, and the forge. On the edge of the cliff, there is a lighthouse where a strange and lonely shadow lives. 

Desert Island

 

It seems like an empty island, but you will have to look closer. The most relevant thing in this place is a hive of strange creatures. If somebody lives here, it might be because they don't want to be found. 

Small Islands

 

All across Mara are little islands scattered about. You can find treasures, new items, and mythical creatures on these small islands. 

Koa

The main protagonist of Summer in Mara, Koa is a little adventurer who wants to explore the world, but she can’t leave her home island. She's always barefoot and has a name for every seagull on the island.

Yaya Haku

 

Yaya Haku takes care of Koa and their island, but she’s old, and she can’t do all the things that she used to do. She’s very strict with Koa because she thinks that discipline is essential for surviving. Yaya Haku has a fantastic past, but few people know about it.

Napopo

 

Napopo, like all of the creatures of her race, cares very much for the other species that live in the ocean. Also, she can feel if someone is pure at heart or a dangerous person. They’re not fighters, but they won’t let evil prevail, and they will do everything they can to fight it. 

Other Characters

 

There’re a lot of qüidos, humans and other species living in Mara. Almost everyone is friendly and all of them need a little help.                                                                                            

There aren't factions in Mara, just different lifestyles. For example, the Qüido are the principal inhabitants of the planet. They always help one another and don't have a ruler or a leader. At sea, you can find the Qü Navy, guardians and explorers of Mara, and the Pirates, people who only trust themselves. Recently, the Elit, a corporation from another planet, appeared on Qü. 

The Qüido are a strange race, but they're pretty calm. They are fishers, merchants, cooks, explorers… They can live for 200 years, and there are stories about 500 years-old Qüido. Also, they can change their color under certain circumstances.

The Qü Navy is an old institution where the boldest and the brightest are trained to guard and explore Qü, the planet of the Qüido. Their primary objective is to protect the peace in the ocean and help others.

In Mara, the pirates tend to race a lot for ridiculous prizes and fight each other for no reason. They’re always running away from the Navy and even have their own island too. Among these fierce pirates, you can find Ereti, the fastest pirate in Mara, Mr. Ecco, an old and not-so-trustworthy man, Litio, the lawful evil outlaw, or Rigatta, the Elit pirate. 

 An evil corporation from another planet. They travel from one world to another, exploiting their resources and destroying them. The Elit need the dadiva fruit to survive, and that’s why their skin is purple.

 

We want to give you the most beautiful and summer-like game possible. These are just a sample of our work, with character designs, concepts, illustrations and background pictures that you will see in the final product.

We start with 2D concepts of all the characters and buildings. From them, we work to get a 3D model that feels similar to the first idea. In the case of the characters, after the 3D model, we made the animation, trying to convey the personality traits that every character has in particular.

 

Paco Mitos, our musician from Deiland and the previous Chibig projects, is back for Summer in Mara, this time with a tropical feeling in his instrumental themes.       

 

 

We also have Adrián Berenguer with us. He made the song that you can hear in the trailer. He also has other surprises for you. 

 

 Check the sheet music for Marinera by Adrián Berenguer.

As a sound designer, we have Jaime Almenar, who worked with us to make a fantastic atmosphere and bring life to all the creatures in Mara. 

The animation that you saw in the trailer was made by Ciervo Alto, with a little help from our artists. We think it helps to convey the universe of the game, expanding through different media the story of Koa and Mara ocean.     

With your help we can create even more amazing 2D cinematics, working with our Ciervo Alto friends. We would love to make a cinematic opening and ending for the game, but it would only be possible if we reach certain stretch goals. 

 We have limited tiers with special rewards, so stay tuned to our Indiegogo page because you never know what surprises could be!

Chibig Studio has been making games since 2016. In 2016, we launched Tiny Planet and Ankora for iOS and Android. Today, those games have over 3 million players.

Last year, we launched Deiland for PS4 and PC, after a successful Kickstarter. We sold over 20.000 copies, and it’s a massive hit for us. A small community was built around this game, with content creators and fans taking care of their own tiny planet.

 We also count on Vicente Molina as a 3D modeler to help us with the project. 

You can learn more about us on our website: Chibig.com

Our previous experience with Deiland crowdfunding was a great success for us. We funded the project in five days, and we reached four stretch goals. After that, we launched the game for PS4 and PC, and everyone received their rewards on time.

Our community were so kind to us that we want to share our new game with all of you and give you the chance to get the game before anyone else.

Summer in Mara has been in development for six months now. We can finish the game on our own, but we want to involve you in this development. With your help, we can make the best possible version of Summer in Mara. 

We will launch Summer in Mara for PC, PlayStation 4 and Nintendo Switch. We want to take the game to Xbox One, but our resources are limited, and we need you to smash that stretch goal. 

This campaign is promoted by Backercamp. Since 2012, Backercamp has helped 5,000+ creators make their projects a reality, raising over $250MM through crowdfunding.

story:
Bittersweet Birthday is an action game where every combat encounter is a challenging and unique fight! Adventure into a lively world full of endearing characters and discover the many mysteries lurking in every corner..!

Features

  • A story of mystery driven by endearing characters!
  • Punishing combat where reading the enemy is the key to victory!
  • Explore a lively world with friendly residents and their interlocking quests!
  • Personalize your combat style to adjust the game's difficulty!
  • Multiple collectibles, exchangeable items, and mini-games!
  • Cute pixel-art characters on beautifully drawn backgrounds!
  • Heart-touching tunes that will stay with you forever!

 

 

Bittersweet Birthday will release on Windows, Mac, Linux, and guess what? The Nintendo Switch! Here's some footage showing the game already running on it! Courtesy of Pineapple Works!

 

PLAY! JOIN! SUPPORT!

                            

Follow us on our social media and stay in touch with every update!

 

 

 

 

 

 

This is the main dish of Bittersweet Birthday. Combat takes place in real-time, as your reflexes are put to the test. Here, the spotlight shines brightly on the enemies, which will feature numerous animations that properly telegraph their intentions so you can live on the edge of the moment!

As the player, your bread and butter is your light-attack: a quick 3-hit combo! By being quick and having a generous hitbox, this is the most optimal way to chip at your enemies and break their focus!

Once your enemy loses their focus, they'll start glowing red. When this happens, you can use your heavy-attack to catch your opponent while they are doing theirs, in order to knock them down to the floor and rack some more damage!

With every encounter not only will you become more skilled... but so will the protagonist! New skills are bound to open paths to new strategies and methods of exploration!

 
 

 

Our goal with the enemies rather than each being more difficult than the previous one is for each to present a unique challenge. For example, the first enemy's abilities are mostly inspired by Bullet Hells...

 Others will rely on more physical attacks, with odd timings and counters like in Soulslikes.

The only certainty is that every combat will be different to keep you on your toes!

And this is only the beginning! You can expect a wide variety of combat styles and arenas in OVER A DOZEN BATTLES!

 

Bittersweet Birthday is... tough. And while we and a lot of our fans love it like that, the reality is that some people are just interested in the story. This put us in a tight spot since to us, the story we want to tell is very important and we want as many people as possible to experience it and fall in love with it while still keeping true to our design beliefs.

Thankfully, we found a solution that leaves no compromises..!

Memories are powerful, and even more so in Bittersweet Birthday. By completing side-quests, solving mysteries, or finding secret items, you'll unlock a bunch of them. Every dear memory you recover will enhance you with different effects, letting you tweak the odds in your favor the best way you see fit!

Sadly, like in life, not all memories reflect on better times. The good news is that if you'd like an even greater challenge, you can use some of these "bad" memories in order to further ramp up the difficulty to your heart's content!

 

The intended level of difficulty does not require the use of Memories. However, you can customize your experience and define the level of challenge you'd like to face!

 

 

Take a break from the main campaign and indulge in some free-roaming exploration. Different areas are full of mysteries and curiosities in every corner, available for you to unveil!

Colorful characters from different backgrounds offer a full tour of both the past and the future. Gather the pieces and build this world-building puzzle!

Expect many reasons to return to the game... who knows what else you may discover!

Help the town residents with their daily-life struggles and find out more about the state of the world you live in. Every NPC has been written to steal a smile from you!

 

Side quests interlock through item management and even day and night time!

We've thought of many ways to reward the player's curiosity. Items, Memories, Collectibles, etc, all await the curious and the restless!

 

You may find tokens by exploring around town or by receiving them from thankful villagers and redeem them for Gachapon in Muina's Gacha machine!

Gachapon is the latest craze in town! Try your luck at collecting the rarest of them or simply finding your favorites. There are over 50 of them of the Cool, Creepy, and Cute kind, so get started!

 

 

World Eater Games is a team of two life-long friends based in Panama. With the help of two amazing artists and an incredible musician, our goal is to deliver challenging but fun experiences and charming but gut-wrenching stories like the ones that made us fall in love with gaming in the first place.

 

Besides this magnificent team, we also somehow managed to get in contact with Jérôme Bailly, who has composed many songs for Epica!!! He will be helping us make some genuine heavy metal music and has in fact already made a short preview for you guys! Give it a listen!

 

PUBLISHER

Team of pineapples to help make the fruitcake happen!

Pineapple Works is a Polish publishing and porting studio focused on indie games. They recently helped Oddventure with their own campaign and are set to help them with development, and are also responsible for publishing and porting Death And Taxes on the Nintendo Switch. It's thanks to them that Bittersweet Birthday will come to the Switch as well without the need of meeting a stretch goal!

Why Indiegogo?

Up until now, we've been able to fund the project thanks to the kindness of friends and family, as well as at times full-time jobs, and at others, part-time jobs. With the overwhelmingly positive response to the demo we launched shortly before Christmas, we felt it was finally time to kick it into full gear.

Development is being made with the Godot Engine and we're pretty far along, mostly falling short in the asset department. With the money we manage to collect from this campaign, we'll be able to properly compensate our artists and musician for their work which will allow us to fully devote ourselves to the game, making development possible. Here's a quick breakdown of how the funds will be managed.

Risks & Challenges

We are aware of how cautious one needs to be with projects when it comes to a team with no previous released products, which is why we went so incredibly hard on the demo so that you can see what we are capable of and the commitment we have to the project. Polishing the demo up to this point has also made it easier for us to properly calculate how much time, effort, and money it would take to develop the rest of the game. Based on this experience we are confident that we can deliver the complete game within the estimated release window.

Should the goal be met, the game will be completed. We hope to have earned your trust with what we've shown so far.

To anyone that has even scrolled this far down, thank you so much!

And to those who have decided to support us monetarily or otherwise even more so. Being able to complete this game will be nothing short of a dream come true, and we won't let you down!

 

PLAY! JOIN! SUPPORT!

                            

Follow us in our social media and stay in touch with every update!

SUPPORT!                            Follow us on our social media and stay in touch with every update!      This is the main dish of Bittersweet Birthday. Combat takes place in real-time, as your reflexes are put to the test. Here, the spotlight shines brightly on the enemies, which will feature numerous animations that properly telegraph their intentions so you can live on the edge of the moment!As the player, your bread and butter is your light-attack: a quick 3-hit combo! By being quick and having a generous hitbox, this is the most optimal way to chip at your enemies and break their focus!Once your enemy loses their focus, they'll start glowing red. When this happens, you can use your heavy-attack to catch your opponent while they are doing theirs, in order to knock them down to the floor and rack some more damage!With every encounter not only will you become more skilled... but so will the protagonist! New skills are bound to open paths to new strategies and methods of exploration!   Our goal with the enemies rather than each being more difficult than the previous one is for each to present a unique challenge. For example, the first enemy's abilities are mostly inspired by Bullet Hells... Others will rely on more physical attacks, with odd timings and counters like in Soulslikes.The only certainty is that every combat will be different to keep you on your toes!And this is only the beginning! You can expect a wide variety of combat styles and arenas in OVER A DOZEN BATTLES! Bittersweet Birthday is... tough. And while we and a lot of our fans love it like that, the reality is that some people are just interested in the story. This put us in a tight spot since to us, the story we want to tell is very important and we want as many people as possible to experience it and fall in love with it while still keeping true to our design beliefs.Thankfully, we found a solution that leaves no compromises..!Memories are powerful, and even more so in Bittersweet Birthday. By completing side-quests, solving mysteries, or finding secret items, you'll unlock a bunch of them. Every dear memory you recover will enhance you with different effects, letting you tweak the odds in your favor the best way you see fit!Sadly, like in life, not all memories reflect on better times. The good news is that if you'd like an even greater challenge, you can use some of these "bad" memories in order to further ramp up the difficulty to your heart's content! The intended level of difficulty does not require the use of Memories. However, you can customize your experience and define the level of challenge you'd like to face!  Take a break from the main campaign and indulge in some free-roaming exploration. Different areas are full of mysteries and curiosities in every corner, available for you to unveil!    Colorful characters from different backgrounds offer a full tour of both the past and the future. Gather the pieces and build this world-building puzzle!Expect many reasons to return to the game... who knows what else you may discover!Help the town residents with their daily-life struggles and find out more about the state of the world you live in. Every NPC has been written to steal a smile from you!      Side quests interlock through item management and even day and night time!   We've thought of many ways to reward the player's curiosity. Items, Memories, Collectibles, etc, all await the curious and the restless! You may find tokens by exploring around town or by receiving them from thankful villagers and redeem them for Gachapon in Muina's Gacha machine!Gachapon is the latest craze in town! Try your luck at collecting the rarest of them or simply finding your favorites. There are over 50 of them of the Cool, Creepy, and Cute kind, so get started!  World Eater Games is a team of two life-long friends based in Panama. With the help of two amazing artists and an incredible musician, our goal is to deliver challenging but fun experiences and charming but gut-wrenching stories like the ones that made us fall in love with gaming in the first place. Besides this magnificent team, we also somehow managed to get in contact with Jérôme Bailly, who has composed many songs for Epica!!! He will be helping us make some genuine heavy metal music and has in fact already made a short preview for you guys! Give it a listen! PUBLISHERTeam of pineapples to help make the fruitcake happen!Pineapple Works is a Polish publishing and porting studio focused on indie games. They recently helped Oddventure with their own campaign and are set to help them with development, and are also responsible for publishing and porting Death And Taxes on the Nintendo Switch. It's thanks to them that Bittersweet Birthday will come to the Switch as well without the need of meeting a stretch goal!Why Indiegogo?Up until now, we've been able to fund the project thanks to the kindness of friends and family, as well as at times full-time jobs, and at others, part-time jobs. With the overwhelmingly positive response to the demo we launched shortly before Christmas, we felt it was finally time to kick it into full gear.Development is being made with the Godot Engine and we're pretty far along, mostly falling short in the asset department. With the money we manage to collect from this campaign, we'll be able to properly compensate our artists and musician for their work which will allow us to fully devote ourselves to the game, making development possible. Here's a quick breakdown of how the funds will be managed.Risks & ChallengesWe are aware of how cautious one needs to be with projects when it comes to a team with no previous released products, which is why we went so incredibly hard on the demo so that you can see what we are capable of and the commitment we have to the project. Polishing the demo up to this point has also made it easier for us to properly calculate how much time, effort, and money it would take to develop the rest of the game. Based on this experience we are confident that we can deliver the complete game within the estimated release window.Should the goal be met, the game will be completed. We hope to have earned your trust with what we've shown so far.To anyone that has even scrolled this far down, thank you so much!And to those who have decided to support us monetarily or otherwise even more so. Being able to complete this game will be nothing short of a dream come true, and we won't let you down! PLAY! JOIN! SUPPORT!                            Follow us in our social media and stay in touch with every update!

story:
Select tactical options in dialogues and combat. Spend willpower points to boost your chances. Then face the consequences. Will you dodge at the last moment to gain renown?

 

 

Our backers love the text-based preview of Sacred Fire’s first chapter:

“The story was very engrossing! Even at this level I was totally enthralled and immersed. Cannot wait for more.”

“I’m proud to be a backer for Sacred Fire and spent several evenings poking through every line of your text-based chapter. I enjoyed it thoroughly and I’m looking forward to the game even more.“

“It was amazing. I loved the ability to analyze the situation or trying to understand where a character was coming from. These kinds of context clues make it so much more immersive. The decisions felt like they had weight. Thank you for being able to establish a great character relationship and background.”

 

 

 

 

 

  • Choice-driven narrative game with RPG elements and replayability​
  • Single-player
  • Windows, Mac & Linux (Steam, Humble, DRM-free GOG)*
  • Release date: TBD
  • Supported Languages: English

    * Sacred Fire will be ported to PS4 and Xbox One. Work on the console versions will start after the PC release.


KEY FEATURES

  • Psychology and emotions affect your choices and combat
  • Develop relationships to survive, fight for influence to change the history
  • Build inner strength to make difficult decisions
  • Multiple play styles, story branching and character development ensure extensive replayability

 

 

 

Rome has sought to conquer Caledonia for as long as your people can recall. Only fierce resistance drove the Romans back behind the great wall marking the boundary of their empire. There Rome is watching and waiting for an opportunity to strike.

But walls do not bring peace, and the scars of war run deep. Trouble stirs at Dunadd, the seat of power of your people, as Morrigan, a vengeful queen, rises to power.

You may be young, but you have seen enough of war for a lifetime. Will you unite the tribes and bring an end to strife, or will you channel their rage and crush Rome once for all?

 

 

Check out our developers’ commentary, where we explain the new concepts by going through several gameplay scenes:

 

 

 

Sacred Fire’s tactical combat revolves around your character’s inner strength. It blends storytelling and tactics while testing your character’s ingenuity and integrity.

Your emotions are your weapon and your weakness. Anger adds strength to your attacks, but makes them less accurate and can leave your defense open. And just as your enemies’ fear can weaken their resolve, it can erode your strength as well.

Diplomacy can end a conflict without bloodshed. Winning the respect or instilling fear in your enemies can serve you better than littering the battlefield with corpses.

 

Cinematic turn-based combat with psychological tactics

 

 

You will need allies to survive, but relationships are a double-edged sword. The challenge is to read the motivation of others and learn to overcome your own base instincts.

Sacred Fire features 10 major story characters. Each represents an ultimate psychological challenge such as overcoming guilt, resisting envy or winning trust.

Each relationship has a breaking point, a moment where it is tested. It remains strong or fails, based on your choices. Will you be prepared?

 

Take a chance with a stranger or be ruthless and safe?

 

ALLIES

ENEMIES

 

 

CORE TEAM

 

EXTERNAL TEAM

 

 

 

 

 We are happy to offer you a Limited Collector’s Edition Box Set and other great perks. Some of the perks feature Doug Cockle, the voice of the Witcher.

 

 

Credits In-Game (VIP/Producer Credits In-Game)

  • Your name will be listed in Sacred Fire in-game credits
  • Backers in the Firekeeper tier will be listed in the VIP section of the credits

 

Copy of Sacred Fire + 2 Digital Wallpapers + Renown Trait

  • Digital copy of Sacred Fire on Steam, GOG or Humble
  • 2 Sacred Fire-themed digital wallpapers with a note from Doug Cockle
  • In-game Renown Trait Ancient Blood

 

Backer Forum Badge

  • Display your Backer Badge on Sacred Fire forums (VIP Badge for the Firekeeper backers)

 

Special Personality Trait + Digital Soundtrack + Digital Poster + Golden Eagle Companion

  • Get a Special Personality Trait for your character affecting how you react to NPCs, such as being Passionate, Shy or Cheerful
  • Original Sacred Fire soundtrack by Sean Beeson
  • High resolution Sacred Fire digital cover poster with a note from Doug Cockle
  • In-game Golden Eagle Companion

There is an emotional bond and loyalty dynamic between your character and the animal companion.

 

Second Copy of Sacred Fire + Special Appearance Trait + Private Early Access + Set of Sacred Fire Ringtones

  • Get a Special Appearance Trait for your character affecting how NPCs react to you, such as Innocent Eyes, Menacing Figure or Graceful Moves.
  • A second copy of Sacred Fire. Share the happiness.
  • Private early access for 2 people.
  • A ringtone, alarm tone and text message tone narrated by Doug Cockle.
    - Ringtone: “The world needs you. The choice is yours. Will you answer the call?”
    - Text message tone: “A new mission brief is in.”
    - Alarm tone: “You may be done with the world, but the world is not done with you. Time to gear up and dive once more into the fray.”

 

Backer-only Start Screen + Digital Art Book

  • Exclusive in-game start screen with beautiful location art and a thank you note, so every time you launch Sacred Fire, you’ll remember that it was thanks to your support that this game was created
  • PDF of the Sacred Fire art book

 

Collector’s Edition Box + 2 Printed Posters + Postcards

  • Collector’s Edition Box with a physical Sacred Fire game disc + digital copy of Sacred Fire for one platform of your choosing
  • The Box can be hand-signed by Doug Cockle (if you want)
  • Choice between Sacred Fire on a DVD or a USB flash drive
  • Printed Sacred Fire-themed poster by an artist Corrado Vanelli
  • Printed original Sacred Fire poster
  • A set of Sacred Fire themed postcards based on in-game art by Rene Aigner
  • Hand-written and signed thank you note from the team

 

 

 

In the beginning we had been financing the development of Sacred Fire from our personal savings. To be able to finish the game in a reasonable time, we decided to ask for support on Kickstarter.

Over 29 days in March and April 2017 we welcomed 1,435 backers into our community and raised $65,000. We reached all 3 stretch goals along the way. 

After our successful campaign we have had ongoing interest from new backers so we've decided to come to IndieGoGo to continue our crowdfunding efforts. Our goal is to grow the community which appreciates the new narrative format that Sacred Fire offers and to raise additional funds to make Sacred Fire the best it can be. The more funds we raise, the more polish, voiceover and improvements to the core gameplay we can bring.

story:
Updates

Please check the updates tab for more info, screenshots and development news over the coming days.  A massive thank you to everyone who has supported us so far.

 

Our Story and how we met Jelle

During the lockdown of 2020,  at a time when we were starved of sports or any kind of exciting live action, we stumbled across the fantastic Jelle's Marble Runs!

 https://www.youtube.com/c/JellesMarbleRuns 

Being game developers we thought there must be a Jelle's Marble game we can play. We searched...there wasn't... and that was the lightbulb moment.

We contacted Jelle and his team. We told them of our love for his marble runs and how we could recreate them in a video game. Jelle agreed, and we were rolling!

Our voyage began. We spent our evenings watching videos, making notes, zooming with Jelle and building a game design document for the first game - Jelle's Marble League.

In 2021 we started work on it. We made a demo, showed it to Jelle and his team and they loved it!  We carried on until we had something that started to show the potential for the full game. Some call it a demo, we call it our baby.

That led us to today, asking you guys to help us finish this game.  We've gotten half way there and now we need to motor on and finish it.  That's where you guys come in. To help us fund this beautiful thing, to help us make this the world's new obsession and in return we'll give you some lovely things.

 

The Game

We're working in the Unity game engine. We've made many games in it, so it feels like a second skin. Our developers are craftsmen of the digital age, magicians, people with a passion, an obsession.

We decided to make Marble League first. It's where this obsession started and we figure is the best place to start. It's going to feature all the things we (and you) love about Marble League, in no particular order -

  • Greg Woods custom made commentary
  • All the official teams as well as custom teams.
  • Marble and team designer to allow you to build your own teams.
  • All of the official events from 2021 Marble League.
  • Single player career mode - manage your team to become season champions.
  • Multiplayer local couch mode - take on buddies in your own space.
  • Multiplayer Online - take on the world.
  • Stats and characteristics that change over time.
  • And better still have your say on the discord channel - we're listening:         https://discord.gg/marbles  (Official developer discord will be announced once the indiegogo campaign ends)

 

Big Head Games & Jelle's Marbles

Big Head Games have been making games for donkey's years, starting out individually in game studios working on titles as diverse as Pokemon, Hannah Montana, Tony Hawks, Batman, Sky Sports Football Manager, Lemmings, Colin McRae Rally and many more.

Forming Big Head Games at the start of the iPhone era and making games for other people including Ultimate Mortal Kombat 3 for EA, Grease (yes the movie) for 505 Games as well as our own games with the massively successful snooker sim International Snooker and Pool classic Doodle Pool.

 

Most people reading this will already know about Jelle but for those who don't, Jelle's been making YouTube videos of marble machines and marble runs since he could hold a camera, his YouTube channel is now huge with 1.34m subscribers and has been featured in media around the world including on Sky and HBO's John Oliver's Last Week Tonight show as well as ESPN and numerous pieces on news channels.

Known as the Marble Master his creations have made an impact in every corner of the world.  https://www.youtube.com/c/JellesMarbleRuns 

 

The development process

We are currently at what is known as first playable. That is a version of the game you can play that represents how the game will look and play, calling out key parts. Rough and ready it forms the basis of the game as a whole. Next up we work towards second playable in August and Alpha in September - it's this build that will be uploaded to Steam and early backers will get access to, it'll not be perfect, it'll still be in development and it'll give you a chance to comment and feedback your thoughts to the developers. Together we take this game to Beta, a complete game just needing translations and bug fixes. This is timed for October.

Once we have a clean build we'll start on more content, currently we think we'll be adding winter events next.

 

Risks and challenges

We feel there are very few risks, as we are already a long way on with development and have developed many games previously. So we feel the game will be completed and on time. We've kept the perk rewards simple so we know we can fulfil them.

story:
It's dangerous to go outside alone!

After three incredible campaigns, it's time to return for our fourth issue of Ninty Fresh Magazine and our second of 2021. This one is of course all about The Legend of Zelda. Well, the iconic franchise is 35 years old this year!

With more than 20 adventures coming in all shapes and sizes - not to mention contentious art styles - this legendary franchise is so deep and engaging that we do our best to cover everything in 25 odd pages! We also have this absolutely incredible cover artwork by the amazing artist, Phil Summers. You may remember him from not only our second issue but also his hand-drawn manual series. It's truly special and it looks amazing on our cover!

What is Ninty Fresh Magazine?

We are three issues in now, but if this is your first time finding us then we will explain a little bit about ourselves again. Until we launched, there had not been any Nintendo magazines in the UK since ONM closed in 2014. With the recent demise of corporate multi-format publications in general (like GamesMaster and GamesTM) there's a huge lack of Nintendo coverage in print form. Whilst there are enthusiast ventures available, we craved something that completely covered and encompassed Nintendo's vast history. Something that looks at the retro aspect as well as the new, with a fresh perspective on things. So, we thought we would make one: Ninty Fresh. Something that will cater for ALL of Nintendo. From NES to Now. Or, in this case, Virtual Boy to Now - we have a Virtual Boy Retrospective in the pages of the next issue!

Our title, Ninty Fresh, captures exactly what the magazine is about with the added benefit of a cheeky pun. Imagine, if you will, a cross between EMAP's Nintendo Official Magazine, Future's Official Nintendo Magazine and a dash of Retro Gamer and NGamer and that's what we hope to bring to the party, all with that Nintendo flavour and familiarity that older magazines brought you. But in 2021. And obviously, with no affiliation to those amazing magazines. Making your own magazine without advertising support or huge corporate backing is challenging, but since our first three issues went down so well, we came back. The fourth issue of Ninty Fresh is going to be another A4 (210mmx297mm) page turner with a smorgasbord of Nintendo content crammed into 84 pages. And no adverts.

 

 

What will be in Ninty Fresh issue 4?

Just like our previous issues, our Ninty Fresh magazines are themed and this one is dedicated to The Legend of Zelda, with 35 years of celebration covered. But that's not all you will find inside! 

We plan to bring a range of enjoyable content to each issue. We will have editorials looking at the latest big Nintendo stories and what's happened since the last issue, system recaps, informative interviews and huge cover features, all interwoven with amazing artwork, the latest reviews and even some fun and games! Oh, and fan content. We want your stuff. Letters (or emails), tweets, questions, artwork - all that sort of thing. We will be in touch closer to the launch with more details about those bits. All of the core games will have spreads just like this with bespoke artwork.

Everything is either in progress, already completed or awaiting release (reviews); we'd say around 50% of the content is already prepared.

Why Indiegogo?

We have used Kickstarter for our previous issues, but with a pending project in the works we are not allowed to launch another on there until it is fulfilled. We didn't know this, and so need to find another means of funding Issue 4 so that we don't fall behind or miss major milestones! It's also useful research for future issues as to which works better!

We have successfully produced three issues thus far for Ninty Fresh Magazine, as well as 52 issues of Switch Player, our smaller and Switch-focused publication and are well-versed in hitting our deadlines and fulfilling issues!

Our target of £3000 will ensure that an 84-page print issue can be produced. We love Nintendo and think that coverage on Nintendo devices and fantastic writing should be back where it belongs - in print. We hope that this will be around for the long-haul; in fact, even our spines are being designed so that they'll make a pretty picture when put together. We'd need quite a few successful issue to achieve that!

If you like the sound of what we are doing, we have physical and digital options available, and some premium levels if you really want to help this project come to life. Please help us get a print Nintendo magazine back into people's hands.

What can I get for supporting?

We have four different ways that you can support us to get a copy of the magazine. There are the options and what you'll get!

The Magazine - the standard option will get you a copy of the magazine with standard shipping.

Premium - this level gets you the magazine, the PDF, a poster and an enamel pin badge depicting the triforce!

Super Mario 128 - as you can probably guess, there are 128 of these and you'll get the perks from the premium tier as well as a bonus poster and art print, a special badge and also your name in the magazine! The artwork for our Zelda feature will also come on NINE postcards.

Nintendo 64 - you'll get everything from the Super Mario 128 with your name upgraded to an image in the style of the team featured on a page as one of our sponsors. You'll also get a few extra bonus pieces of artwork.

However you want to support us, it's hugely appreciated and will go a long way to making our vision and dream a reality as well as keeping print Nintendo magazines alive!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge right now is obviously the ongoing global situation. However, our usual printing company are running as normal as is the Royal Mail, so delivery of these issues shouldn't be an issue. We've already successfully launched two issues, which should give you confidence that we know what we are doing. If you had any issues with NF01, NF2 or NF3 then I blame my kids, they helped me pack them so it was their fault! I'm joking, kids. But we also run Switch Player, which has over 50 issues. The financial cost of the project is managed versus the target. If we hit the target, we will be able to fund and manage the issue.

Please Note

Ninty Fresh Magazine is an unofficial publication that is not endorsed or affiliated with Nintendo. Nintendo and all associated games and characters are registered trademarks to Nintendo.
story_txt:
It's dangerous to go outside alone!
After three incredible campaigns, it's time to return for our fourth issue of Ninty Fresh Magazine and our second of 2021. This one is of course all about The Legend of Zelda. Well, the iconic franchise is 35 years old this year!
With more than 20 adventures coming in all shapes and sizes - not to mention contentious art styles - this legendary franchise is so deep and engaging that we do our best to cover everything in 25 odd pages! We also have this absolutely incredible cover artwork by the amazing artist, Phil Summers. You may remember him from not only our second issue but also his hand-drawn manual series. It's truly special and it looks amazing on our cover!

What is Ninty Fresh Magazine?
We are three issues in now, but if this is your first time finding us then we will explain a little bit about ourselves again. Until we launched, there had not been any Nintendo magazines in the UK since ONM closed in 2014. With the recent demise of corporate multi-format publications in general (like GamesMaster and GamesTM) there's a huge lack of Nintendo coverage in print form. Whilst there are enthusiast ventures available, we craved something that completely covered and encompassed Nintendo's vast history. Something that looks at the retro aspect as well as the new, with a fresh perspective on things. So, we thought we would make one: Ninty Fresh. Something that will cater for ALL of Nintendo. From NES to Now. Or, in this case, Virtual Boy to Now - we have a Virtual Boy Retrospective in the pages of the next issue!

Our title, Ninty Fresh, captures exactly what the magazine is about with the added benefit of a cheeky pun. Imagine, if you will, a cross between EMAP's Nintendo Official Magazine, Future's Official Nintendo Magazine and a dash of Retro Gamer and NGamer and that's what we hope to bring to the party, all with that Nintendo flavour and familiarity that older magazines brought you. But in 2021. And obviously, with no affiliation to those amazing magazines. Making your own magazine without advertising support or huge corporate backing is challenging, but since our first three issues went down so well, we came back. The fourth issue of Ninty Fresh is going to be another A4 (210mmx297mm) page turner with a smorgasbord of Nintendo content crammed into 84 pages. And no adverts.
 
 

What will be in Ninty Fresh issue 4?
Just like our previous issues, our Ninty Fresh magazines are themed and this one is dedicated to The Legend of Zelda, with 35 years of celebration covered. But that's not all you will find inside! 
We plan to bring a range of enjoyable content to each issue. We will have editorials looking at the latest big Nintendo stories and what's happened since the last issue, system recaps, informative interviews and huge cover features, all interwoven with amazing artwork, the latest reviews and even some fun and games! Oh, and fan content. We want your stuff. Letters (or emails), tweets, questions, artwork - all that sort of thing. We will be in touch closer to the launch with more details about those bits. All of the core games will have spreads just like this with bespoke artwork.
Everything is either in progress, already completed or awaiting release (reviews); we'd say around 50% of the content is already prepared.

Why Indiegogo?
We have used Kickstarter for our previous issues, but with a pending project in the works we are not allowed to launch another on there until it is fulfilled. We didn't know this, and so need to find another means of funding Issue 4 so that we don't fall behind or miss major milestones! It's also useful research for future issues as to which works better!
We have successfully produced three issues thus far for Ninty Fresh Magazine, as well as 52 issues of Switch Player, our smaller and Switch-focused publication and are well-versed in hitting our deadlines and fulfilling issues!
Our target of £3000 will ensure that an 84-page print issue can be produced. We love Nintendo and think that coverage on Nintendo devices and fantastic writing should be back where it belongs - in print. We hope that this will be around for the long-haul; in fact, even our spines are being designed so that they'll make a pretty picture when put together. We'd need quite a few successful issue to achieve that!
If you like the sound of what we are doing, we have physical and digital options available, and some premium levels if you really want to help this project come to life. Please help us get a print Nintendo magazine back into people's hands.

We have four different ways that you can support us to get a copy of the magazine. There are the options and what you'll get!
The Magazine - the standard option will get you a copy of the magazine with standard shipping.
Premium - this level gets you the magazine, the PDF, a poster and an enamel pin badge depicting the triforce!
Super Mario 128 - as you can probably guess, there are 128 of these and you'll get the perks from the premium tier as well as a bonus poster and art print, a special badge and also your name in the magazine! The artwork for our Zelda feature will also come on NINE postcards.
Nintendo 64 - you'll get everything from the Super Mario 128 with your name upgraded to an image in the style of the team featured on a page as one of our sponsors. You'll also get a few extra bonus pieces of artwork.
However you want to support us, it's hugely appreciated and will go a long way to making our vision and dream a reality as well as keeping print Nintendo magazines alive!

Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge right now is obviously the ongoing global situation. However, our usual printing company are running as normal as is the Royal Mail, so delivery of these issues shouldn't be an issue. We've already successfully launched two issues, which should give you confidence that we know what we are doing. If you had any issues with NF01, NF2 or NF3 then I blame my kids, they helped me pack them so it was their fault! I'm joking, kids. But we also run Switch Player, which has over 50 issues. The financial cost of the project is managed versus the target. If we hit the target, we will be able to fund and manage the issue.

story:
Kinetic Love Days is a visual novel currently in development by WGWDev, utilizing the characters of the Weapons Grade Waifus franchise.



  • 1 common route + 6 potential character-focused routes
  • 100+ CGs (+ additional H-Scene CGs) by SoySauceDoodles
  • 40+ backgroundsof locales that span the globe
  • Authentic weapon noises (recorded on the range!)
  • Realistic guns, gear and tactics
  • Original EDM/lo-fi/future bass soundtrack by Studio 7.62

 

 

 

The world economy has become dominated by private military companies.

Standing armies are now relegated to the roles of bargaining chips and display pieces - balanced precariously on the edge of a third global war, the world governments instead rely on mercenaries to enforce their policies and fight the multitude of small conflicts that have erupted in order to maintain the worldwide “peace.” With military contract work quickly becoming the world's most common profession, specialty “colleges” that focus on the higher-level learning of low-intensity conflict have been founded.

After four years of friends lost and hard lessons learned, you find yourself appointed as a Special Adviser to the Asymmetric Strategies Institute, a prestigious multi-national contractor academy. The hybrid coach/talent scout position is regarded by many of your peers as a cushy admin job - an easy ride to a nice paycheck, without any real danger involved.

The plan? Ride out your assignment while doing the least amount of work possible.

But as everyone knows, no plan survives first contact with the enemy...
 

 


 

 

 

In addition to digital rewards (soundtrack and artbook), we have a few other physical items that will be available to backers as well! Physical reward selections can be changed down the line - we will be using BackerKit for reward confirmation and fulfillment, and that will be the choice that matters. This will take place a couple of weeks after the main IndieGoGo campaign is done, and will allow you to add individual items to your initial pledge if you want!

PATCHES
You know we had to do it to ‘em. What WGW venture would be complete without patches to go with it? 4 different styles will be available, both for individual purchase through BackerKit and included as part of our tiers.



Asymmetric Strategies Institute - ASI is the low-intensity conflict academy
where much of the visual novel takes place. As prestigious as the school
is, their logo is very simple in design, featuring a short dagger separated into offset halves. The dagger symbolizes utility, concealment and speed - essential attributes for the contemporary, PMC-focused battlespace. Student patches are grey with a subdued green dagger, while faculty patches are black with a red dagger.

 


Task Force Astral - Jake’s old team from his rotation to Somalia four years ago. On it, the Grim Reaper beckons the viewer to the stars - “You’re coming with me.” The team motto is displayed here, “AVAA,” which is an acronym for the Latin phrase Anima Vestra Ad Astra, or “Your soul, to the stars.” The unofficial motto, “RFS,” is much simpler and a more apt description - Real Fuckin’ Spooky.



HTR TOMAHAWK - (Still in design phase). HTR TOMAHAWK is one of ASI's premier student-led small teams - it also has the distinction of being the only all-female HTR at the school.

PINCHED STRAPS
It’s not every day that you will have gear or clothing that has velcro on it - enter the WGW character strap/PVC patch hybrid. Equally suited for hanging off of your phone or knife as it is attaching to your jacket velcro, the exclusive hybrid pinched straps will feature the girls in their school uniforms. The artwork for the straps is currently in-progress. They will be available individually through BackerKit and as part of several backer tiers.

(sample hybrid pinched strap/PVC patch - artwork for backer exclusive items is not finalized)


DAKIMAKURA COVERS
After a long day out in the field,  nothing beats dropping your kit and getting into bed with your waifu. For these IndieGoGo exclusive daki covers, we are working with renowned artist Tony G to bring the ladies of HTR TOMAHAWK to reality. Currently we have the art for Tammy and Gisele - The other four girls are in-progress. You will be able to select which girl you want through BackerKit after the IndieGoGo campaign has ended!

 

WALLSCROLLS
What good weeaboo doesn't have a ton of anime girls plastered over their walls? Now, the girls of HTR Tomahawk can join the ranks of your favorite waifus hanging over your bed - With three planned variants!
 


Variant 1: Title Splash Art

Variant 2: Beach Day (IN PROGRESS). Wetter is better. Join the girls of HTR Tomahawk as they hit the beach for some rigorous "Amphibious Exercises."

Variant 3: A Night On The Town (IN PROGRESS). Always classy, just a little trashy, with the right amount of wrong. ASI's top ladies don their evening wear for a night of drinks and danger.


GAME & ARTBOOK
Closer to the end of development, physical copies of Kinetic Love Days and it's accompanying artbook will be created and shipped. These will be perfect collector's items for long time WGW fans!
 

In order to green light the project, we will need to raise an amount of at least $20,000USD - the money necessary for the first payment for our artists and coder to begin working on Kinetic Love Days. The actual total for the entire project is $23,000USD and the closer we get to that, the better!

BASE GOAL - $20,000. At this amount raised, the full development phase will begin. We expect 1.5-2 years in development, but if we can get it out sooner, even better!

 

STRETCH GOALS

$25,000 - Hiring a Japanese musician to create an opening song. 
While Studio 7.62 is doing awesome work for the project, how cool would it be if we had our very own OP for the visual novel? At $25,000 we will have enough to hire a singer/songwriter and have them make a song that would perfectly complement our opening sequence!

$27,000 - Beach Episode.
A visual novel romance isn't complete without a hot springs trip... or, failing that, a trip to the beach! Hitting $27,000 in pledges will unlock the episode Amphibious Training/Jungle Ops, where the crew take a trip to sunny Florida to "learn the art of fighting while wet." Whatever that means.

$30,000 - Rina Route.
"Your son calls me mommy, too." As it stand, Rina (or Resting Bitch Face-chan) is the only major female character without a planned route. If we hit $30,000 in pledges we will make her route a reality - a true treat for all of you into Christmas cakes, as Rina is the closest thing we have to a MILF in the WGW lineup.
